title: What Space Saving Engineering! - Really love this mop set!
text:
I love products that are super functional yet engineered really well too - especially when it comes to the space saving aspect of something you want to stow away in a closet or cabinet. This definitely fits the bill across the board.

First it comes in a small box - just large enough for the bucket. But the mop is also inside the bucket. Genius!
Now when I unpacked it I was like will this mop be sturdy enough as it comes in pieces you screw together. But YES - it totally is - and I was surprised! It was sturdy and stable and yet maneuvered very, very well as it swivels beautifully. In fact, even though my older mop is smaller - this one was much better for getting behind the toilet - again because it swivels and moves so well. It did a great job. The parts of the handle never came apart - until I took them apart (which was also easy). It is also much longer than my old mop which, for me as a tall woman, makes life sooooo much easier! In fact at the end of mopping my bathroom I was able to stand outside the door and finish up and was actually able to stretch and reach almost the entire bathroom from the doorway - I was impressed. It was very easy to use. I was even able to really scrub with it and it was still very sturdy.

The best part is the bucket. It is super tiny yet super functional. It is also much better than using my bathroom sink - as now I can properly dispose of dirty water right down the toilet. Plus it does not take that much water to fill that part of the bucket - again the engineering is super helpful and thoughtful and conserving. The mop definitely got up the dirt and I was able to rinse it well and then run it through the dry side a few times where it really did get rid of most of the water - you could see it literally pour off the mop with the little attached squeegee. Then I just left it standing against a wall and by that night it was completely dry! (Unlike my old mop which took like days to completely dry!)

Lastly - when you are done with it - you just unscrew the handle and put it all right back in the tiny bucket. Super easy to put on a shelf, in a closet, or in a cupboard. REALLY space saving! My pic shows the size next to a bottle of champagne - really small! I am impressed with he size, engineering, durability, and ease of use. Great product! Totally recommend!

If you found my review helpful, why not click the "Helpful" button. Thanks! : )

title: Little Vegan Treat!

title: Smells VERY "green" but taste is much better

These capsules smell VERY green but the taste is much better - only very slightly green. Once you add water and swallow no taste whatsoever. No aftertaste either.

title: Poo poo'd these things for years - until I got it and used it - WOW - a true convert now
text:
I am surprised that I like this set so much. For years I have seen these things and poo poo'd them as a weird fad. I even already have a pricey ultrasonic face machine - so why would I need these? SO GLAD I got this set, though.

I literally use these EVERY DAY now! The handle is easy to hold (unlike my ultrasonic face machine). It is easy to turn on and off and so far the battery I put in lasts and lasts and lasts. I thought that the handle would vibrate more then the head - but I am glad that I was wrong. The vibration is definitely more confined to the head and hence your hands do not feel weird using it.

The eye head is nice - I thought it would be too big - but works and fits well around my eyes. The jade roller one is nice too - I especially like it when it is cool. Then it is like a nice ahhhhh after a long day. But the roller ball head is da bomb! That thing really makes you feel like you are having a facial as your skin sort of gets squeezed between the ball heads. In the directions they call it "kneading" and I guess that is what it really feels like. I am not one to be gentle with my skin - personally, I believe you need to move it around and get the blood flowing to keep youthful. That has always worked for me - and that is why I think this set does such a great job on my face. I recommend. In fact going to get some as gifts for family and friends - who will probably also poo poo it - until they actually try it.

If you thought my review was helpful - why not click the "Helpful" button. Thanks! : )

title: These are VEGAN - have no taste - are better absorbed (and I only need just one!)
text:
These vitamins have no smell really as well as no taste - so that is great! They are also clearly marked Vegan on the bottle. This Vegan LOVES that! They are on the larger side of pills but I, personally, had no trouble swallowing them. If larger pills are an issue for you try drinking it with a lot of water to make it go down easier.

They are a higher dose than most vitamin C's out there. Usually I do 250 to 500 mgs daily - with more (during normal times) in flu and cold season to boost immunity. These are 725 mgs each. The dosage says to take two - but I will just take the one at 725 most days - unless I need to really boost in my immunity. The good thing about vitamin C it is like the only vitamin you can't OD on as any excess your body easily urinates out. So no worries you will get too much either way.

These are a very easy way to get your vitamin C! : ) Plus they are liposomal - that means your body more efficiently uses and absorbs them. You gotta love that!

title: Great combination of turmeric & ginger

I don't have much joint pain at 72 so they must be working!

title: Healthy supplement but no noticeable memory improvement
text: This is a healthy supplement especially with the omegas but after a couple of weeks of use, I haven't notice any real memory improvement. I don't recall names any better or faster. It might be good for the brain overall, but I haven't noticed any changes in mental activity.

title: Concentrated components, not a lot of pain relief
text: I've used Turmeric for years for everything from pain relief to cancer risk reduction. This is an organic product with the best of turmeric and black pepper to aid in absorption but I don't see a lot of pain relief increase. I do like I get the best benefit from these concentrated elements so I recommend it for those that don't like to eat a lot of natural turmeric in their foods.

title: Handsome and convenient food storage containers
text:
The containers are great for storing leftovers. They have 8, 12, and 18 notations on the side for those wanting measured amounts for dietary requirements, too. They work for refrigerators and for freezer storage. They are safe to microwave in, also, though personally I don't like heating food in plastic. They will be great for freezing poultry stock for use in soups and stews later. The lids fit snuggly and have a great transparent yet rich purple color.
The material is thin, but I might try using them for water reservoirs when wicking small houseplants like African violets, too.

title: Excellent hand protection
text: These PVC gloves make excellent hand protection for household chores. They aren't good with oils or harsh chemicals the package says. They are easier to slip on and off than rubber gloves. I like the lined pair best. The hold up on the forearm well which is a good thing when working in liquids where slipping exposes the hand skin to the material one is trying to avoid touching.

title: Comfortable knit, no filter pocket.
text: Comfortable knit with stretch, sits close on your face without being overly snug.  Sweatshirt type material that I expect to be pleasantly warm when the outdoor temperatures dip.  These do not have a filter pocket, which I would prefer, but they have a nice thickness.  I do think those who overheat easily may prefer other mask materials, however these are soft and worth a try for those with sensory issues.

title: Fresh scent.
text: A light fresh, not overpowering scent.  Easy to apply.  And I find this to be somewhat helpful for my general 2020 stress level; it's not a miracle, but it does seem to help a bit, and it doesn't smell unpleasant.  Worth a try.

title: Good quantity, fair value.  I don't notice any changes.

title: the taste is quite good + energizes
text:
The Hulk Juice flavor is named sour gummie bear which I don't think fits.
This is a sweet / SLIGHTLY sour drink that's quite good. Sour isn't predominate

The powder mixes especially well with a spoon.
It's quickly - thoroughly blended but does settle a tiny bit, not as much as many,
but may need to swirl around the last swallow.

For me the drink kicks in energizing in 1/2 hour and lasts through the day.
This is good for a workout - general work - PC. - and without jitters.

This is a small tub of 4.47 oz. - I measured = there's 14 scoops - scoop included.
Serving for beginners = one scoop in 6-8 oz water = 14 servings
> Advanced = two scoops in 8-10 oz water = 7 servings.

I use ginseng / energy shots / drinks / gummies / capsules / etc.
So I'm kinda aware whats enough for me = and one scoop is it.
Two scoops would likely be fine but I'd be flying and nervous.

Among other ingredients to support the speed and energy of the body and mind
> the powder contains 150 mg caffeine per scoop (as Anhydrous caffeine) meaning
it has no water as to not impede it's impact.
> Plus a tiny bit more in the green coffee bean / green tea extract
So with a cup of perked coffee containing 90 mg this is approx 2 cups of coffee.

Drink 15-30 minutes before repeated action. (OK = I made up the repeated action)
THEY say "before lifting things up and punting them down repeatedly'

Very small print
--------------
This flavor has the same ingredients as their Miami Vice =
Pina Colada / Strawberry Daiquiri which i also think is good.
https://www.amazon.com/dp/B09SQ8KGJ6

title: apparently 660nm and 850nm can NOT be used separately
text:
This is an attractive well made belt that will go around up to a 46" waist.
The controls are on the belt which is easy access if it's on he waist =
not so convenient if used on other parts of the body EG: back / shoulder.
Can be used with a power bank (not included)

The timer is three times ten minute - up to 30 minutes
but the belt turns off with each time the timer button is pressed to get to 30 min.

Although this product info is the usual 660nm and 850nm they apparently
can NOT be used separately with this product which is a really big disappointment.
OTHER products we have are THREE MODES = 660nm / 850nm separately and the 3rd together.

I'm guessing here - but I would imagine they're other folks like me that would want this for
the 850nm to penetrate deep to relieve pain / muscle stiffness / joints / swelling / etc.
And not have to deal with avoiding the red light which is extremely harmful to eyes.

But there's no mode that you don't see red light.
So I assume the 850nm is here but it's together with the 660nm and can't be used separately.
That pretty much ruins the usefulness for me.

>>> The belt gets a decent warmth on constant.
Comes with instructions - but could be more through.
Includes wall plug (2 types ) and USB cable.
A cloth to keep the center of the wrap clean.

((( OTHER PRODUCTS= Usually =
> 660 nm of RED LIGHT can be seen and targets skin cells = gently warm
but not as warm as near infrared light
> 850 nm of NEAR INFRARED LIGHT can NOT be seen and targets deep tissue.=
gets very nice and warm - much more than red light )))

Doesn't seem there should neg's at the current $148.00 price point.

title: almost no heat - nice looking / well made - use directly on the body

Expected life span ONE YEAR ((( other brands 50,000 hours )))

title: contain the usual ingredients

they don't have very much ACV taste.

At any rate - I'm not a fan.

The gummies are a bit firmer, they don't stick together nor to teeth.

title: LARGE screen - common sense - user friendly
text:
Of the half dozen different TENS units I've recently been checking out
this one is the most common sense, user friendly - in several ways.

This is a TENS + EMS Unit. The first 16 modes are TENS > the last 8 EMS.
The size (5" T - 2 1/2" W) allows for a larger, easier to view screen (3 1/4" T - 1 3/4" W)
which allows for the 6 main mode icons also much larger.

EACH button is for ONE CHOICE (not multiple commands)
>>> There's no joy button to have to figure out how it works. (Thank You!)
> The power button and separate screen lock button are on the side. (like a cell ph)
> One (center) button chooses back and forth between channel A & B
> One button 'M' is the mode = and continually pressing it moves you one mode number
at a time = through all 24 modes of the six main mode icons. Then starts over.
> One button "T" - each press is 10 min (up to 90 min)
> One button '+" for more intensity = 20 levels
> One button "-" for less intensity = 20 levels
>>> I found this getting intense at level 6, don't think I could go very much more.

And to boot - this is a richer / classier design which is handsome on all sides
including the back which is all black with the company name.

Includes - 4 channel unit
Six sets of electrodes
Four snap leads - each include Velcro band
Charging cable (no wall plug)
Storage bag = kinda tight fit for all pieces.
Instructions.

PS = these electrodes & leads fit and work with two other TENS units I have.
I'd give this unit more than five star if I could.

title: plain bags = work well - monthly maintenance
text:
This is a good set for those who prefer NO labels.
None of the 8 bags have any company info / tags.
These bags are completely plain except for the two small bags
which have a string hanger and button.

Four large 5 1/2" x 7" x 1 1/2" thick = weights 7.9 oz
Two medium 4" x 6" x 1" thick = weights 4.5 oz
Two small 6" x 2 1/2" x 1" thick = 2.9 oz.

The set DOESN'T include the green hangers pictured.
> Had I known the black bag they came in was the only bag there was
I would have been more careful opening it.

As is with these charcoal bags == there's some maintenance for continued use.
These are considered fully reusable for a couple years.
BUT they need rejuvenate every month by laying them in sunlight for at least 2 hrs
to expel what ever the bags have absorbed.

The bags don't have much eye appeal = but do work well.

title: GOOD hydrolyzed / good value
text:
This may be one of the better values as far as price goes. (currently $26.00)
This is one pound (454 grams) types I - III bovine collagen from grass fed cows.
A servings is one 10 gram scoop. Container = 45 servings - scoop included.
It's non GMO with 9 gram protein per serving.

Although I prefer 5 type combination and/or marine collagen
those are generally more expensive.
> And Puridian may be more bang for the buck.

This is HYDROLYZED collagen so the inherent amino acids can be more easily absorbed.
I can't smell any odor in the container = but it has a bovine smell while mixing.
> And has a stronger bovine taste (in water) but is easily covered in coffee / smothies.

CONS

title: Good for emergency food as vegan, could be great if Splenda was removed
text:
I've known about Soylent for years and I love the idea of it. I'm vegan and have food allergies and it's always nice to have options in the case that I'm in. This ends up giving you more calories than the average random energy bar and since it's powder maybe a bit easier to carry around too.

The idea behind Soylent is that technically you could eat this for every meal and still have all your nutritional needs met. Kind of like pet food for humans, and the name is a play of course on Soylent Green (although there's soy in it, there are no lentils!)

This is vegan and gluten free. It's not however organic and my number one issue with it is that it uses Splenda (sucralose) as a sweetener. I heard that Soylent can't be sold in some countries due to this and Splenda is being tied to more health issues such as messing with your gut biome and such. I wouldn't be comfortable using this full time and I think a lot of people have a negative connotation with the term "Splenda" but don't realize sucralose is the same thing.

I tested this in a real world scenario, no fancy mixing cup, just a cup with water, to see how it blended and if it was chalky. The chocolate flavor was nice, and as for the taste beyond that it had a bit of a mild oatmeal type taste, so overall good and palatable. I was really surprised by how well it blended in with the water. It's not perfect but it wasn't like huge chunks that refused to blend along with some chalky mouthtaste which I've had with other drink powders. Some powders are basically only doable if you literally have a blender or coffee frother, or if you heat them up. I found this to be totally drinkable and could see myself bringing this on flights and stuff to get some variety from meal bars.

title: Not what I was expecting - lots of ingredients other than the 3 listed
text:
I wanted to try this blend because the main oils that were listed are scents that I like and Spearmint has been tested to show effects on focus.

However I was unclear that this blend has a ton of other stuff in it than the main ingredients, I'm going to list them below:

Bergamot, Black Pepper, Caraway, Cinnamon Leaf, Clary Sage, Coffee, Eucalyptus, Frankincense Carterii, Ginger, Grapefruit, Holy Basil (Tulsi), Juniper Berry, Litsea, Melissa (Lemon Balm), Nutmeg, Organic Jojoba Oil, Peppermint & Sugandha Kokila

Especially the inclusion of coffee is kind of concerning for me, if it could have caffeine I wish they would mention it. I also really dislake citrus sent and although it is very muted I can smell the bergamont/grapefruit.

The smell is minty but I think due to the inclusions of a bunch of other stuff it does smell a bit more artificial. I can tell it's not artificial though because otherwise I'd be getting a migraine. However I just don't understand why it's needed to throw in that many additional ingredients. Just stick to the 3 listed and jojoba oil. As others have said the scent dissipates pretty quickly. I do feel that I feel a little more awake with this but I think that you can get a similar effect by putting peppermint oil in a diffuser.

I would say just do a higher percentage of the main oils to make it last longer and cut all these extra random oils that don't add to the scent.

title: Carefully crafted antioxidant red blend
text:
I have a bunch of "Greens" blends but wanted to round things out and try a "reds" blend. I've tried probiotics by this company before and they are unique in that they don't just resell some random blend but actually research and make unique, science based supplements. Given my experience with their probiotic and what I knew about the company from then I was excited to try this.

This blend basically has 4 components: a phytonutrient/antioxidant blend with a variety of red berries and beets, some medicinal mushrooms, some gluten free grains, and a small bit of probiotics. In addition this is sweetened with monkfruit, my favorite sweetener. You can tell they really put care into these ingredients because for example they do mention they used fruiting bodies, and they could have used stevia or even some junk coconut sugar and they did not.

I have tried this a few different times and it is just a neutral pleasant beet type flavor maybe with a bit of a berry undertone. I wouldn't recommend this just on its own but I don't think many of these powders really are meant to be just thrown in some water and washed down. If you are thinking of it being particularly "berry-y" it's more of a beet type powder. In any case I haven't had any problem with things I've mixed it in with as long as a beet and sweet taste is OK in that food.

The reason I took off a star is because it is pricey and I'm not sure if I'd get it again due to this but I do think it's justified in this case as they used premium ingredients such as fruiting body mushrooms, went of their way to get GF grains, sweetened with monkfruit instead of stevia, and so on.

title: Fresh smelling and Japan sourced chorella, company cares about veganism and sustainability
text:
This seems to be one of the more decent companies selling chorella.

The smell and color of these tablets is good compared to others. I also contacted the company to determine the source of the chorella. These are apparently sourced from vat-grown Chorella in Japan which I'm going to trust wayy more than the places that stress "MADE IN THE US" but source the Chorella from China. In addition they do provide a COA on their website, although I would have preferred to have seen a scanned PDF rather than just a table. In the end though all that stuff is pretty hard to verify, but the fact that they went out of their way to put it on the website is a good thing. I also appreciate that this company pushes the sustainability and vegan angle.

I'm going to be using these in conjunction with cilantro for detox. I'm early in but no issues yet and I feel better about using these due to what I mentioned above over a random brand that doesn't have a COA, is sourced in china, and doesn't care about veganism/sustainability.

I am taking off a star because the marketing was using some kind of annoying tactics - for example, " it also can contain protein, vitamin b12, iron, vitamin C, vegan omegas, fibre and small amounts of magnesium, zinc, copper, potassium, calcium, folic acid and other B vitamins.* " Note "can contain"... classic "weasel wording"... Ok, well if you value third party COA's, why not actually verify the nutrient percentage in these batches?

title: Cheap benadryl
text:
It's Diphenhydramine, which is the generic for benadryl. It comes in those bright pink hard tablets similar to the benadryl you can get at the store but they're not individually foil wrapped which I always hated when I really needed a benadryl.

I'm not going to do spectrometry on this (I would if I had the equipment!) but it seems to behave internally as Diphenhydramine would.

The price is much cheaper than you would get at the store and again comes in a convenient bottle. The company is US based and has been around for 5 years. I could not find any negative press on them.

title: Powerful
text:
Just one quick smell of this turmeric supplement and you'll know it's powerful. The scent is strong (in a good way) and robust.

I started taking turmeric a few years ago, on the advice of a friend. It's an excellent anti-inflammatory (which I need because of my heavy workouts and roller-coaster medical history), and also has many other proven health benefits.

These capsules are easy to swallow and I really like them.

title: Pleasant taste
text:
Every day I take some sort of magnesium supplements. Typically that's a capsule or pill, but decided to try this powder variety.

Good choice. It makes a pleasant-tasting before-dinner drink -- just add hot water, let it fizz a bit, then add some cold water. It helps get me into a deep sleep.

I've had other magnesium products that helped a bit more with digestion than this one. Still, this is a good supplement and I'll continue to take it. The nighttime beverage I make from it is very soothing.

title: Perfect for take-to-work lunches
text:
Taking my lunch to work each day right now. Real silverware is great, but then I have to bring it back home and clean it. These compostable forks are just what I need for my daily lunches, which include assorted small entrees and veggies.

These don't feel cheap or flimsy like some disposable flatware. And the 150 pack will last me quite awhile.

title: No label = what the heck?
text:
I took this collagen powder a couple of times without realizing there isn't a package label on the front. (There is a small label on the top of the canister, which includes the word "New Item." Hmmmm.)

It's billed as "unflavored" but I did notice some not-great flavor to it when I mixed it with water.

Got this because I take collagen regularly and I usually prefer a powder over capsules (powder seems to work a bit better, for me). Based on the lack of a legitimate label, and the "meh" taste and scent, I'll likely not use this again.

title: Improves complexion
text:
If age alone doesn't affect a man's face (I'm 54), then the current stressful world certainly does.

I've been a fan of collagen since last fall, when I started taking a collagen powder supplement daily. These multi-collagen pills work just as well as the powder, I think. I take one serving (3 pills) per day, with a full glass of water. They're easy to swallow. I also add a Vitamin C supplement when taking these, since collagen reportedly works better in conjunction with that.

I've noticed my face looks a bit plumper (good) and my skin is less dry. Haven't noticed a pain reduction (I'm frequently sore from exercising), but I never expected collagen to help with pain. For me, collagen is for improving one's appearance and this brand does that.

title: Good probiotic
text: Probiotics are an important part of my daily supplement routine. This probiotic is a bit different than my usual capsule or powder, but after a little bit of a learning curve, its easy to take. The box comes with 3 syringes and ach syringe comes with 10 doses, 1 ml is one dose. The taste is not bad at all, a bit orangey tasting. I usually measure one dose out onto a spoon and swallow it down. The idea is that this form of probiotic leads to better absorption by the body. The more probiotics are absorbed the better it is for the gut.

title: Love the chia seeds, not the price
text: These chia seeds are great, exactly what I would expect from Bob's Red Mill, as I am a big fan of a variety of their products. But, the price on this set it way beyond what I would expect for this product. It comes with a nice measuring spoon set, which is nice and good to have, but that does not make this price worth it. In terms of the chia seeds, they are great. I love that they are organic. I have used them in a few different recipes and I really love them. Great product, price needs some consideration.

title: Useful for short periods of use
text:
I decided to try the "DmHirmg Upgraded Silicone Bracket" since I need to use a mask for at least 8 hours daily.

If you use the thicker cloth masks they do make it a little bit easier to breath since they provide you some extra space between the mask and your face. Since they provide you with more space to breath the masks don't get as wet from your own breathing. The silicone material is very soft but I still find it to be a little uncomfortable after the first couple of hours.

I guess if you just use it for a quick trip to the store or something like that they are useful but not if you need to have a mask on for a long period of time.

title: Great way of taking your probiotics
text:
The Digestive Advantage Dark Chocolate Probiotic Bites are a great way of taking your probiotics.

I am normally pretty good with taking pills to begin with but these Dark Chocolate Probiotic Bites make it so much easier and fun. I feel like I am having a snack and not a probiotic but they do work.

The only negative aspect I have, and that happened with a package I got from a different retailer during the Summer months, is that they might melt during transport so take that into consideration.

title: Did nothing and confusing labels
text:
So this detox pills wants you to take 2 in the morning, 2 in the evening with dinner, then 2 at bed time. There are 60 capsules in the bottle. So by my math - that means these are good for 10 days. The bottle says it's a 30 day supply - so that was one confusing aspect.

Now these pills smell really weird. They are extremely strong smelling but at least I can swallow them quickly. I took this for 3 days and lost about 2-3 pounds. HOWEVER, I was also working out and watching what I eat at the same time. I gained all my weight right back after 3 days. The other thing is that this really didn't suppress my appetite. If anything, I felt hungrier. I also had a stomach ache on the 2nd day - not sure if it was related or not but figured I'd mention it. So I don't think I will be getting more once I'm done with the bottle.

title: Nice work light with a suggestion
text:
This light is suppose to generate what is more natural light into a dark room and we have found that it is great personal light for a desk. My husband uses it every night when he wants to focus just on the item he's reading or working on and it provides a good amount of light on the one object. It's shorter than an average person but has a neck that can crank up if you need the light to be higher up or if you're just focused on something on the desk, then ti can be pointed more down. There's a switch that allows you to switch between two different settings. I find that the high and low settings do not have a very noticeable difference.

I do see how it shines the natural light but what would be nice is if the range that the light touches is larger. Or maybe they could put a setting in where you can adjust the length of the spectrum and how wide of an area you need lighted up. It is really just for lighting one small area.

Overall, we're satisfied with this light and find it better than a lot of other floor lamps. It has lasted at least a month without issues.

title: Did nothing and confusing labels
text:
So this detox pills wants you to take 2 in the morning, 2 in the evening with dinner, then 2 at bed time. There are 60 capsules in the bottle. So by my math - that means these are good for 10 days. The bottle says it's a 30 day supply - so that was one confusing aspect.

Now these pills smell really weird. They are extremely strong smelling but at least I can swallow them quickly. I took this for 3 days and lost about 2-3 pounds. HOWEVER, I was also working out and watching what I eat at the same time. I gained all my weight right back after 3 days. The other thing is that this really didn't suppress my appetite. If anything, I felt hungrier. I also had a stomach ache on the 2nd day - not sure if it was related or not but figured I'd mention it. So I don't think I will be getting more once I'm done with the bottle.

My husband uses it every night when he wants to focus just on the item he's reading or working on and it provides a good amount of light on the one object.
