This formula is gluten/soy/chemical free and seems to be made by a reputable company in the USA. Happy with this product so far, I recommend probiotics to everyone and this seems to be a very good one based on my experience.

title: Taste is good, works well
text:
I haven't used a lot of non fluoride toothpastes but I've been wanting to switch and this brand seemed good because I am a fan of Tea Tree oil. The paste is translucent, almost clear and has a fresh minty taste to it. Abrasive particles are used to clean deposits off teeth and gums and it works well with my Sonicare brush.

The tube is a bit smaller than other brands I've used but you only need a small amount as it's very strong. I overwhelmed myself the first time I used it and was sneezing for a few minutes from one of the ingredients. I reduced the amount of paste I used and that didn't happen again so I have no side effects to report when used properly. Good product, and a nice alternative to fluoride toothpastes.

title: Very nice reusable storage containers
text:
These storage containers are fantastic and work just like the name brand ones we've all used. Clear bottom with a see through blue top, and a really nice 24 ounce size that can hold soups or a salad but it's also big enough to hold a sandwich to keep it from getting crushed in a backpack.

The lids seal fairly tight and don't leak under normal conditions. You can microwave these and they made from BPA free plastic. You can also freeze them. I think the best feature with these is they cost less than a dollar each so if you are in a situation where you need to throw one away or leave it at someone's house, it's fine. Or you can use them for years, since they don't really fall apart. They can get scratched up over time but they still work and I put mine in the dishwater with no issues.

It's hard to give these storage containers anything less than 5 stars. They work well, are inexpensive, and are a great size for a variety of foods. You can even use them as storage containers for crafts and hobbies since they stack fairly well. An all around great product, practical and useful for so many things.

title: Decent substitute when you can't have fresh juice
text:
I love juicing and my wife and I juice with fresh fruits and vegetables as often as we can. But sometimes we don't have time or are traveling and can't make or buy a fresh juice. This container has 20 servings of powder that you mix with water to make a pretty good juice drink. It tastes better than expected to be honest, and seems to have the same antioxidants and other benefits of fresh juice. I use about 12 ounces of water, they recommend 8 but it's whatever you prefer.

The product seems good so far. I've used half the tub already and I'm happy with it as a real juice alternative. At about a dollar a serving, it's also a lot less expensive than fresh juice, but I still prefer the real thing whenever I can get it.

title: Saline nose spray
text:
This is a 1 .5 ounce bottle of saline spray for your nose to help with dryness and irritation. It's very basic but it works. There are no drugs or chemicals to worry about, and it works well, similar to other similar nasal sprays.

It's been really dry this time of year where I live and my nose has been especially dry. This spray has helped a lot, and I've been using it throughout the day and at night before I go to sleep. Good product, I can't tell the difference between this and the name brand.

title: Too small for my head, work well
text:
These reading glasses have aspheric lenses and are lightweight and come with pretty nice storage cases. Having 3 pairs of them is great, I can leave them around the house for my wife and I to use when we sit down to read. Quality is good, the main problem I have with these is they are a bit small for my average adult male head and so they are a little tight. The arms have springs on them so they do flex outward, and for the most part they are ok. At least I can see what I'm reading.
Arm length is good, they are just tight on the sides of my head.

I usually use 1.25 strength and I received 1.50, so if I ordered more of these I would probably order the 1.00 strength, since I'm just starting to use reading glasses now. Overall this is a good price for 3 pair of reading glasses with cases.

title: beautiful polished hearts
text: I don't use these in a healing way, but just because they are beautiful to feel and have in a clear glass jar. They feel nice to hold and I sometimes put then on my desk during work, just to have something to fiddle with during a long meeting.

title: great to give as a gift
text: I am always looking for interesting gifts to have around in case my kids need a birthday gift for friends. These are very pretty and gift great.

title: great gift for tween
text: These come in a nice box and are great as a gift for a tween. The price is just right and the colors are super fun.

title: Leave white marks - don’t clean
text: I tried using these tablets on several different occasions but I never had a good result. The tablets usually leave white marks that need extra rinsing later which defeats the purpose of using the tablets at the first place. I tried washing my kids cups as suggested and that was a fail but it further and tried cleaning ice machine which was another “no result” situation.

title: Great combo
text: I am about to hit 40 and lack of collagen is starting to show on my skin and joints. I take this supplement daily. These are capsules, no smell and easy to swallow. I used to take powder drink collagen but the flavor was horrible and I found myself cheating just because I was dreading tasting it. This is much easier and works better for me. Additional Vitamins are always a bonus. Good for immunity and skin.

title: Not pain but tedious process
text: Using this whitening kit is a little tedious because molds are large and cause your mouth to salivate, then the gel from molds get mixed with saliva. Then you have to put the light against your teeth and hold it with your lips which further increases salivating 😑 I honestly think the gel gets diluted with all that saliva and have a hard time telling is there any difference. My teeth are sensitive and I usually have to deal with pain when using whitening kits but this one wasn’t painful at all.

title: No foam - under average quality
text: I’m not too crazy about these bath sponges. The scrubbing part is similar to used up sanding paper. The spongy part is VERY DENSE, no matter how much soap I pour in, I can’t get it to foam up like my loofah or my other bath sponge. Yes I add water 🙄 but I just can’t get that foaming effect. Lastly, chunk of scrubbing part tore AND the top nearly completely separated from the rest of the sponge. 3 uses only!  I would only get this at a dollar store, because, well it’s a dollar store and you can’t expect much for $1.

title: Great wipes - unexpected scrubbing power from perfectly smooth wipe - need a dispenser
text:
I almost said these are just a very durable disposable towels when the table I am supposed to review arrived. The metal legs were covered with something that looked like dried up boogers ( or a glue?) but I wasn’t able to remove it by scratching off with my finger nails. I tried dipping paper towel in water just to see the reaction to water, was it gonna soften or something but no, 0 result. Then I saw these and decided to give them a try. I dipped in water and pressed hard... it was COMING OFF! It wasn’t the water, it was the wipe a d I could tell by the way it wS coming off. It wasn’t melting, it was sort off coming off in tiny chunks. Regular paper towel didn’t do anything, nada! I don’t know much about fibers and exactly were these made but they are thin yet VERY DENSE. You can literally wash it, rinse it and reuse it. I really think the density of the fibers is what gives them scrubbing power. I then sprayed my bathroom sink with a bathroom cleaner and used this to wipe off..OMG! I didn’t use anything to scrub like usual (scotch scrub sponge), I just wiped with this wipe which scrubbed the sink and absorbed cleaner at the same time leaving my sink looking clean and shiny after just a few wiping moves, seriously? I then went onto my kitchen cabinets that were ahem kinda due for a scrub... did great.

The only downside is the packaging. It’s a plastic bag with a stack of large square towels. That’s it. It takes large space to lay flat and you need to keep it flat so it’s easier to remove one wipe at the time. That’s another part of the same problem, it’s not easy separating and pulling one out. Some sort of dispenser would be 100x better.

title: Excellent ingredients , I would go for a 2pack for better price!
text: This is a great zink supplement with significant addition of other vitamins, antioxidants and immunity boosters. Excellent quality ingredients,  Well rationed. From some reason 6pack is so much more expensive per serving then a 2 pack of the same brand. I would go for a 2 pack, it’s better value, just make sure to plan on a refills accordingly.

title: konjac sponge is the most natural and gentle exfoliant
text:
Konjac sponges are made out of konjac root, a porous root vegetable that grows in Asia. They work great to exfoliate the skin gently. When soaked in water, the konjac sponge becomes incredibly soft and almost feels slimy. Because of its texture, you can exfoliate every day. I have used konjac sponges for my babies too. These are six sponges in different colors, all infused with other ingredients:

White - Pure konjac powder,
Black - Bamboo activated charcoal,
Yellow - Turmeric,
Dark pink - Red clay,
Green - Aloe vera,
Pink - Sakura (Cherry Blossom)

Each sponge has a little string, which is very helpful to hang it dry. Out of the bag, these sponges are hard as a rock and need to be submerged in water for a couple of minutes. My other konjac sponge came with the instructions to microwave on high for 2 minutes to sanitize, but this brand doesn’t ask for that. After use, it’s important to rinse, squeeze out the water; your sponge will last longer and be cleaner. That should be routine with any washcloth, though, so this may be an unnecessary comment.

These are great, I scrub my face EVERY DAY with my Red Clay konjac sponge, and my skin does not get irritated. They are recommended to change every two months, but I first have to see if they can live for two months.

title: Best for babies
text:
Dreft Newborn smells better than any other laundry soap in the world, period.
It’s gentle and doesn’t cause any skin irritation to my baby and her clothes smells amazing. It cleans the clothing well although for heavy stains from baby food I have to use dish soap to rinse the stain first. Honestly, no laundry soap I had a chance to try was able to wash the bibs without pretreating the stain first. I love this new packaging, it is very practical and I love that I don’t have to screw dispenser cup back on, this version is a cartoon box and there is a insert for the cup on the top so it’s easier to just place the cup there. I keep my soap on the shelf above my kids reach so there is no safety concern. I am also very pleased to see more environmentally friendly packaging. I definitely appreciate the opportunity to preserve our planet for the sake of our children and grandchildren.

title: Practical way to add protein to your diet (or your kids)
text: This protein powder has a consistency similar to almond flour. It dissolves quickly and completely, does not lump up at all. I mixed it with water and it’s practically flavorless. I mean, I can “taste” little something but it’s like a different tastes of water. I am adding to cookies and most of our food because my boy doesn’t want meat or beans so this is a good protein addition to his diet without fighting at a dining table. I am very happy with this product. I received this free of charge for the review but will definitely continue to buy. If this is offered on Amazon subscribe and save I will definitely add to my subscriptions. 👍

title: Tested positive before missed period but overpriced comparing to leading brand
text: This pregnancy test by Natalist comes with detailed instructions and is easy to use. Pee on the stick, wait for couple minutes and read your results. 2 lines are pregnant even if the second line is less visible. Packaging is nice and discreet. Reason for star down is the price. I never heard of this brand before yet is costs more than leading brand. Clearblue early detection costs $8 for 2 tests or $15ish for 4. If I was buying unknown brand I would look for the cheaper price but if I was spending $16 I would buy Clearblue and get 4 tests instead 3. That being said, both Clearblue and this test tested positive before missed  period!!!

title: Seeds compressed into a bar - label states 13g carbs per bar NOT 3g as in product description
text: These bars are made out of seeds, bunch of different seeds compressed into s bar. Similar to granola bar it can get a little messy but not as messy as granola. They are not too chewy considering it’s all seeds. I first had nutmeg and I could definitely tell there is coconut before reading the label. They are sweet but they are not sweet, it’s just the tease. They make me anticipate for more sweetness but it’s only 2g so it’s really just the hint. They do have 13grams of carbs though. Description here says 3g of carbs but the bar label says 13g of carbs. I don’t know which one is wrong. I am not overly impressed but I won’t dismiss these either. I suppose if I was following strict diet and these bars would fit in my diet plan I would get them but otherwise no.

title: Big difference 😍
text: This device is super easy to use. I have a lot of lashes but they need curling, I usually apply mascara on the top of the lashes then use traditional curler and apply mascare from the bottom up. This heated curler gives mu lashes different dimension, they are not as curled like with the regular curler but they are lifted and they look great, like there is a volume and the difference is big. I really what this little tool does! It has different heating options and it’s really easy to use, at first I felt uncomfortable about putting something hot by my eyes but now I realize that was silly. This is going to a main makeup bag where all the favs are.

title: I still have sensation in my hands! Great gloves with grippy surface
text:
I was afraid these gloves are going to be very thick and I will hate using them then probably completely void because I can’t get a good feel and I just never feel things are clean unless I get a good sensation in my hands. I hope this makes sense. However, these gloves are not one of those thick rubbery gloves that numb your sensation for touch. They are still thick and durable but feel more like a silicone then rubber and allow my hands and fingers to have a good sensation to touch. I have medium sized hands and M fits me well with a little extra room too. The fingers are not too long and the overall fit is very good. They are even decorated and have a little trim design around the hand opening. They are not too deep, see photo. They come about half way to my elbows. The palms and fingers are textured in a cute way and this allows for a better grip when holding something in a soapy water. I received 2 pairs, white with blue fingers and plain purple and both colors are cute if that matters.

Bottom line, I always hated rubber gloves but I use these without dreading it, it’s a first. Good pair of gloves.

title: Helps controlling anxiety
text:
My husband is getting ready to go to Afghanistan and I have young babies so needless to say the stress is on! I spend night tossing and turning and worrying about him and also about how am I going to manage our babies being by myself for months at the time. I nurse our youngest so any sort of medication is out of the question.

For those reasons I decided to try this stress relief supplement and I honestly think it works. I still have exact same worries and stressors but I sleep a bit better and overall dealing with everything feels a bit easier. It might be due to the simple fact I get more sleep and rest but ultimately it all goes back to taking this supplement.

title: Highly recommend!
text: Thos trimmer set is pretty great overall. I wish that the heads where easier to swap but other than that I love it. I can use it to groom my husbands beard, trim nose hairs, trim eyebrows and so much more. The foil shaver is another really great feature that alot of the other shavers don't include. The battery last along time after fully charged and the holding base is convenient and organized. All in all, I would highly recommend.

title: 5 stars!
text: This scrubber is amazing! I like the silicone material as well as the exfoliating nubs. It does a great job at giving me a deep clean feeling. I like the slot for soap and love how easy it is to suds up. The loop is great for hanging it up and it stays clean too. I like that I don't have to worry about porous surfaces and bacteria etc. All in all, I would highly recommend this!

title: Works great!
text: This works great for helping clear my nasal passages from allergens and colds. I like that I can use this on my kids and myself. Its gentle and doesn't irritate and it's super easy to use. I like that its reusable and easy to clean. All in all, I would highly recommend this!

title: Too wide for my small hands but still nice!
text: This octopus shape facial brush is a bit too wide for my small hands to get a good hold of it. I wish it came a little smaller in diameter as far as the handheld part goes. Other than that I really like this. I've used it in the shower to wash my face and it worked great and is waterproof. It's easy to clean after using and even comes with an extra brush head. I like that its rechargeable so no expensive batteries to replace. The bristles are soft and it does a great job exfoliating and deep cleansing. The first time I used it my face was a little sensitive afterwards but I used it again a few days later with lighter pressure and it was much better. All in all, I really like this but I would change the diameter of the handle if I could.

title: Quality ingredients but the bag isn't very full.
text: This fruit powder is actually pretty decent. It doesn't have any sweetness to it which is a little disappointing since its bitter but it works great forixing with yogurt and in smoothies for an extra kick. I feel like they could've packaged it in a much smaller bag since it's only about 1/3 full, giving the illusion that you get more for your money. Other than that it's fantastic and the quality of the ingredients is 5 stars.

title: Could not sleep!
text:
I'm a little upset because I had a cup of this after work and I could not fall asleep for 2-3h after my usual bedtime. I'm very sensitive to coffee and tea, I can't have any after lunchtime or I won't sleep. I assumed because this is "soothing" it would not contain any caffeine, theine, or any other stimulants. I'm not sure which ingredient in this concoction kept me awake but it did :(
Regardless of my bad experience, I'm not sure I would recommend this. The taste is pretty bland. It's not terrible but it's not good either

title: Super cute but not a lot of scent
text:
The sunflowers are even prettier in person! If it wasn't for them, I'd probably give this 1 star.
The scent is nice - reminds me of artisanal soap. It is very week however. You can only smell it if you put your nose on top of the air freshener.
I wouldn't recommend unless you plan to use the sunflowers for decoration.

title: Burns - Chaffed skin - Cuts - Overpriced!
text:
This is my go-to ointment for any cuts, burns, dry skin or anything else.
It helps lock moisture into your skin so it can heal.
It's quite overpriced though - you can get the bigger size at walmart for less

title: Affordable and effective
text:
I've tried a few Mountain Falls products already and I'm quite happy.
They offer more affordable items that are similar to big brand names like Coppertone Ultra GUARD in this case.
The ingredients are very similar and so is the effect so I think I'll start opting for the Mountain Falls products from now on.

The sunscreen itself is quite good. SPF 30 protects gives you just enough protection from sun burn while allowing you to catch a tan at the same time. It's perfect for your body but you should use something stronger for your face.
The lotion has a good consistency, it absorbs easily into the skin without leaving a greasy residue.
Reapply every couple of hours or after swimming (it's not water resistant)

title: Oh wow, what on earth?
text: Ok, Omega 3/6/9, gotta have it, check.  Gummies, check.  But the flavor.  What were you all thinking?  There is some citrus taste, some sugar taste, but the other taste going on there is very strange, I can't even describe it.  It is not a good taste, tastes very weird.  What were you all thinking here?  This is a fail.

title: Wow
text: I try a lot of memory support/cognition/nootropic supplements.  This one is one of the best formulated I've come across.  Omega 3 Fatty acids, Ginkgo Biloba Extract, Co-Q10, Vitamin E, ... and... DHA EPA.  I take all of these but having them in a single pill is an outstanding idea.  Each of these support your mental function. If you add coconut/MCT oil, lions mane, and niacin, you have one super regimen.  RECOMMENDED.

title: Mostly good combo
text: Elderberry gummies.  At just that these are worth trying.  Add Vitamin C and Propolis and it gets even better.  It does have Echinacea which makes you pause.  You should ONLY take Echinacea when you are actually sick.  This is because it raises the white blood cell count AND if you just take it all the time then the effect wears off.  This is a mistake in the formulation that I hope will be remedied.  Otherwise, good stuff.

title: They are really good
text:
2020 seems to be the year of gummies, especially anti-viral gummies. Wonder why that is? :-)
But seriously, these are well made, taste good, include Vit C and Zinc. Very well packaged and a good buy.

title: Tumeric - Ancient secret of health - these are big bags
text: Very well done product here.  Tumeric is one secret of staying healthy, and as a spice it just works well in a wide variety of dishes.  At first impression for the package is that you get three hefty size packs in an overall clear packaging.  Its got a nice heft, this is a lot of tumeric.  The processing is good and you can tell the product is pure.  You can cook with it, package it in gel caps and use it daily as a tonic.  Just don't take raw tumeric after dinner to ensure you don't have digestion issues because it does have some heat.  Good stuff.

title: Resveratrol - a super supplement
text: Resveratrol was discovered to be one of the key ingredients in the health benefits of red wine.  Is even claimed to slow down cell aging and support longevity.  This seems like a good supplement.  Would have benefitted by including more information like whether is non-GMO, vegetarian capsules, etc.

title: Nice, but no lining
text: These are very nice gloves.  A medium will also fit an average mans hands though barely.  Material is nice and colorful.  The non-slip ribs/treads are also a nice touch.  Very servicable.  Now to see how long they last.  :-)

title: Maltodextrin - not organic at all, heavily processed and potentially dangerous
text:
Red flags abound here. At 3.8 g carbs per teaspoon its not KETO or dieter friendly.

And elsewhere on the internet you will find warnings like this

"The high GI of maltodextrin means it can cause spikes in your blood sugar level, especially if it’s consumed in large amounts.

Because of this, you may want to avoid or limit it if you have diabetes or insulin resistance. It should also be avoided if you’re predisposed to developing diabetes. Another reason to limit maltodextrin is to keep your gut bacteria healthy.

According to a 2012 study published in PLoS ONE, maltodextrin can change your gut bacteria composition in a way that makes you more susceptible to disease. It can suppress the growth of probiotics in your digestive system, which are important for immune system function.

The same study showed that maltodextrin can increase the growth of bacteria such as E. coli, which is associated with autoimmune disorders like Crohn’s disease. If you’re at risk for developing an autoimmune or digestive disorder, then avoiding maltodextrin may be a good idea."

This product tastes really good, but you are better off with regular sugar if you don't mind carbs OR the much safer erythritol if you are KETO/reduced carbs

title: WELL done
text: All natural ingredients.  Chlorella is one of the most underrating foods/supplements there is.  Both a superfood and fights abnormal conditions, possibly also cancer.  Packaging is top rate.  Buy it.

title: hey are very useful bags for any storing needs.
text: These Daarcin 3 Sizes 60pcs mixed resalable foil pouch zip locks bags are nice quality and are very well made. I am using these to store dry nuts and also to organize my Jewelry, so far they are holding very well. The sealing strip is really tight and they can be reused several times. I love the clear window design so I can see what’s inside without opening it. Three different sizes fulfill the different needs. They are very useful bags for any storing needs.

title: Works well, bottle did break
text: I used these on a few pairs of wool slippers that I have and are really starting to stink. Initially, I felt the mint scent was very intense and I left my slippers outside to dry. Over time, I have really come to love the scent and the product really does work. After the first round of sprays, there was still a slight odor however after one or two more rounds the odor was gone and stayed gone. One problem I did encounter was that I screwed the top off once and ever since the bottle has been leaking a bit. When I go to shake the bottle small droplets start flying off and onto my hand, I have started putting the cap on before shaking however when spraying occasionally a few drops get on my hand. However, overall I think this is a great product and a definite life changer that I would recommend picking up.

title: Love it
text: I tried the espresso clif minis and I am very impressed. As far as the caffeine it is defiantly quick boost of energy, I don't drink coffee or other caffeine drinks often so I can still get a jolt from small doses of caffeine and this does the job. I love the size its only one or two bites and whenever i'm felling a bit groggy I can eat one of these and get going.  The flavor was surprising, I was expecting a very bitter caffeine flavor but while it is still a bit bitter its actually not only bearable but enjoyable. Overall I am very happy with this product and would recommend it.

title: High quality gloves
text: This mixed glove package comes in 2 Pair Pacific Unlined PVC dish wash gloves & 2 Pair Flocked Cleaning Gloves. They are very thick and very nice bright colors. They are very comfortable and high quality gloves. They are great for dish-washing and gardening so far; I haven't had problems with ripping. They are very durable and protects your hands.

title: Great product
text: Very nice ladies shaver and epilator system comes with a nice caring bag. Colorless you can use wet or dry this is a very nice shave it shaves very well it is also reasonably priced I would definitely recommend

title: Great product
text: This is a very nice nose and hair trimmer. It’s very easy to use and easy to clean comes with detachable heads one for the nose and one for the hair trimmer. I feel it’s very reasonably priced I like that it’s a combination of the two I would definitely recommend it is very reasonably priced

title: Great product
text: First off directions say to take 2 with breakfast 2 dinner and 2 before bed a total of 6 a day this is not a 30 day supply. This is only a 10 day supply if you follow the directions. So I am a little bummed about that. However after taking for a couple of days I noticed a decrease in bloating, and it help get the bowels moving in a good way. I didn’t really think it helped with appetite suppression however taken longer than 10 days a person would possibly notice if that change would take place. If your looking for a quick fix on water weight and bloating in general this would be the way to go I would still recommend this even though it’s not a true months supply

title: Great gloves
text: Great household gloves. They held up great through the dishes and spot washing on the floors. They also survived the toilets and showers. So yes they are very durable with lots of life left. Price is a little more than the dollar store gloves but these would hold up longer I think. I would recommend

title: This is the best
text: I am not sure why, but this helps me to sleep more deeply. It's amazing. I don't sleep poorly, but i can always tell when I didn't take it.

title: Love The Company
text: The packaging is eco-friendly and ensures that the contents will stay as fresh as possible. It gives the company story which makes me feel good about using this moringa. It's a good value. There are 30 servings in the package. Unfortunately, this is not the freshest tasting product I've ever had. I love that it's organic. I love other things about it though.

title: Tiny Amounts of Supplements
text: What's not to like about gummies? They are like candy, right? Except that they are EXPENSIVE so you want them to be more than candy. unfortunately, these have really low amounts of supplements in them. I'm not sure there is enough here to do you any good at all. Since the recommended dosage is 2, this is a 30 day supply.

title: New To Moringa
text: So, I am new to moringa. I don't have diabetes, heart issues, or brain issues, so I can't say if it helps with that. If it does the other things it says it does (reduces inflammation, fights free radicals, and acts as an antimicrobial and antibacterial agent), I am a happy camper and will drink this every day. Taking it as a tea tastes like spinach water. Not exactly the tastiest thing I can think of, but definitely not impossible. I think it's a keeper.

title: Really does help me to calm down and destress
text: I put a couple drops under my tongue and just let it seep into my system. Doesn't taste bad, not great, but sweet. Helps me start to feel less stress and anxiety. Like talking a few deep breathes and then you're on the right track.

title: Good, not great, snags on caps
text: I have tight space between my teeth and several caps on my teeth. This works in between the regular teeth but it catches and snags on the edges of my caps were the teeth are tightly packed. I like the environmentally friendly features, but I can't say I would purposely get this since it catches too much.

title: Great for stress relief
text: Smells soothing, rolls on easily, helps reduce stress and anxiety for me. Works on pulse points. Great price for something so soothing.

title: These are really nice and can be gifted as well
text: These are nice bath bombs. Each one smells a little different and since they are individually wrapped inside the box, you could gift them out or make them as stocking stuffers as well. The colors are fun, and they don't stain the water or your skin. These smell very nice and leave you feeling clean.

title: Do not suds up as much as others
text: These are nice and big and thick, but for some reason the suds don't get as foaming or bubbly with this brand scrubby. They seem well made,  but maybe there is an oil or residue on them that causes less suds to appear?

title: Quite tasty but pricey
text: I really like the taste, even if it does have a Gatorade type flavor. Not overly sweet and great over ice. The lack of a full ingredients list is odd so I wonder what it's really made of...... That said, I like the premise of the product. Only drawback is the price. At $40 for a twelve pack, this is outside the range I am willing to pay.

title: Passed the husband test, 31 year old son wants one, too
text: Husband is actually the one who wanted this as he loves to fall asleep to the sound of rain. Before he ended up with that one, I checked out the other sounds. Crickets, frogs, water, birds, storms, etc.  It can be set on a timer or turned off and on at will. A ring of light appears in the dark on the top of the machine, turns off by tapping the top of the machine. The light is muted, doesn't light up the whole room.

title: Great product
text: Sprays out in fine particles.  It is not cloying in aroma, doesn't sit heavy on the skin. I found no residue on my skin or in the surrounding area after I spritzed myself.  There is a slight aroma, but nothing that sticks in the air or on the body. Love this brand, been using it for years.

title: one set ok, the other a waste
text: A couple of things about these inserts.  The pair for the higher heeled shoes are a mystery. I wasn't sure where to place them, but I'll continue to work on that. The adhesive keeps them in place and obviously, they can be moved. The other set? Waste of rubber.  The padding is ok, but there is NO adhesive on them making it hard to put a shoe on without bunching up the insert. Might work in some shoes, but if they are to be advertised usable in other types of shoes they should work in all, and it should be noted they won't stick to the insole. I tried them in a pair of short boots and they scrunched up when I put them on.

title: My doctor suggested I take this kind of supplement, but I'm lazy taking the capsules.
text:
I've had some other gummies on this kind of supplement and they tasted awful, or barely tolerable at best. I don't like to move from my recliner when I'm doing reviews on my laptop. I keep my daily supplements beside me to remember to take them and to be handy. Occasionally, especially with vitamin C, and ACV gummies, I have to throw them on the couch away from me to avoid overdose. When I sampled these, I found myself taking three days-worth. Since this is a supplement that can build up, I didn't want to consume half the bottle so I had to put it out of reach. This brings up my usual rant about kids and gummies. If adults can't control the consumption of these, what do you expect most kids will do. I'm guessing that's why many gummies have lower dosage than capsule or pills (although it might be to preserve the taste).

Well sources and taking 9 of them at a time on an empty stomach caused me no upset at all a quality product I believe. Recommended.

title: Must be the "pet" designation that allows me to get these, in past I had to show I was a destist.
text: I tried to order a set of nice dental instruments several years back, and ended up ordering so cheaper plastic junk to substitute.  I wouldn't let me order unless I sent proof I was a dentist, hygienist, or student of same.  I guess the pet designation or another policy change allow me to get them now.  I wanted the mirror especially, but I also like to carefully scrape the scale from my lower teeth.  I brush and floss frequently, but it still builds up on the gum line of the lower teeth.  Since I think the scale is calcium transferred by the tongue, that makes since that it would tent to build up there.  I also like the mirror to keep track of a dormant cavity that I don't want to become active again.  I had it filled once, but on the location it sits, the fill fell back out.  Nice professional set, and I suppose it works for pets too, but take care you might get bit if you don't have the trust.  Recommended.

title: With my girth I'm very glad they increased the length, I could probably use it longer still.
text:
Nice, easier to control than a back brush, and gentler on the skin as well. I used it two places I can't reach easily, my lower legs and my lower back area. I was without a shower for several months while they worked to convert my bathtub into one. I can't step over a tub wall without extreme difficulty, and getting out of a tub is near impossible so I don't take baths. This is easy to pass between hands with the dual handles and move in a back and forth scrubbing motion. There are two grades of bristles, some silicon mini nubs that are very very soft, and some stiffer larger nubs for an exfoliate action.

My lower leg skin on my shins started to flake off like shedding a snake skin. After a few showers unable to reach there I was peeling off pieces of dried skin about the size of a quarter. I poured on some body wash with the stiffer nubs and used this to shave off the rest of the dead skin. It did a nice job, my skin in sensitive there, most of the brushed I have will irritate that area rather than exfoliate. It reaches the small of my back rather well, an seems to allow enough body wash to lather up the area to clean properly. I don't have anyone to help me wash my back so this is a nice tool for the bath or shower. It's a little trickier to get the top of the back I have to use on cross angles to do that, but it's still works. I could use this at closer to 35 inches instead of the 29, but it's better than some of the sorter, rough brushes I've used. I get some cramping when trying to reach over the back to scrub the lower area with a brush, and there is no problem with this. The handles make it easy to hang on a hook when not in use and the light weight does not unbalance my shampoo caddy I have on the fixed shower head. Recommended.

title: Contents good, taste bad, not really awful, so you probably don't have to worry about kits overdose.
text: Funny taste, it was not bad enough to spit out, but it was not good either.  A danger many don't realize is if you give your kid some sort of gummy single or multi-vitamin, and they are too young to realize what it it, it becomes candy if they find the bottle.  Child caps may stop more old people than kids from opening, so keep tasty gummy vitamins in safe custody.  This may not have a problem at least by my taste buds, they are tolerable, but definitely not tasty, and certainly not crave worthy.  That said and awesome combo with the Zinc.  Zinc is known to have some degree of prevention of cold viruses from bonding to the throat.  It may even have an effect with COVID19, but there is currently no data on that, but it is one of the few things that has an effect versus viruses.  Of course vitamin see just keeps your immunity strong and provides the building block to repair common cellular damage in the body, so it's a must.  Cold and Flu season are coming soon, so a good product to have even if you can't eat them like candy, fair price.  Recommended

title: A lot of benefits from Elderberry, not all can be integrated into gummies, but safe, easy to take.
text:
It would be nice if you could get a way to preserve all the benefits of the berries, but that's not possible. The berries themselves are coated with a poison that's not too dangerous in small mounts, but the other part of the plants are very bad. Some of the beneficial effects probably lost during the conversion to gummies are fiber for one, that may be an assumption on my part, but they don't list it on the bottle, so it's likely true. I'd say next a certain proportion of the antioxidants are not carried over. Fresh uncooked berries would retain a lot more antioxidants than processed ones. I know from my past history as a juicer, that once the fruit or veggie is juiced the concentration of antioxidants drops very quickly from hours to only a day or so depending on the method.

Still there are a lot of benefits left, from mood enhancing to digestion, to vitamin C, enough of the health benefits remain to want to use an easy way to take Elderberry. This particular version is somewhat unusual as most seem to use blueberry as a flavoring for Elderberry gummies, but this brand uses raspberry. I like that they are sugar coated on the outside as gummies can stick together and be a pain to dig out of the bottle that way. My usual caution is in effect because they taste good and can be harmful if you take too many. Adults should resist eating too many, and put away so your kids don't find a great new gummy candy that can hurt them if they consume the bottle. With these precautions in place. Recommended.

title: Gives decent support for those who have a problem with slouching and others with medical issues.
text:
I'm a bit big to try this out and have decent posture anyway, so I had my friend put it on today. I ordered it with her in mind as she'd been complaining of shoulder pain. She'd had rotator cuff surgery not too long ago, and the pain was back. She had problems sleeping on her side with the pain. I mentioned this to her and she said her doctor has told her about similar devices that helped maintain posture. I've ordered and used compression straps for my forearms to alleviate and allow healing for tennis elbow, so I know how a little support helps. Anyway, she tried it on and said she immediately felt two inches taller. The support was there and it helped with the pain immediately. The device came with two pads, but didn't have any explanation for them. I thought they might be shoulder pads, but later read on the product page they were for the arm pits. They wrap around and velcro the strap there so it doesn't make that area tender.

I think the best thing about this she thought besides the support and pain relieve was how light it is. She is still working and on her feet all day inspecting electronic components for a local firm with government contracts for critical plane parts. With this she can wear under her clothes and maintain good posture all day working while her muscles heal. Thus avoid the bad things of taking NSAID painkillers and other things that become chronic problems instead of solutions. Going on her experience, I recommend this device, it's inexpensive and does it's job well.

title: Feel good antioxident at decent price, a little goes a long way.
text: I sometimes don't know why I get on a healthy kick thats working then get off it and forget about it for too long.  In the 90's I used Spirulina a lot, usually in tomato juice or just plain water.  I got about four ounces from a health food bulk store, and a teaspoon per mix lasted nearly 50 servings.  Other than some coloring of my stools, it did nothing but make me feel better.  I used it for about six months and didn't have a stomach ache or upset the whole time.  The rest of my diet was much worse, but if the pipes work good the digestive system can handle a lot.  This is tolerable, nothing strong about the taste, and it blends well with vegetable oriented juices.  Not recommended for fruit juice, and milk is maybe a toss up.  If your juicing veggies it works well for those veggie blends as well.  Recommended for those who like veggie drinks.

title: Healthy, moderately edible, but definately not cravable.
text: Clif makes some other health, energy, endurance recovery bars, and some are decent.  Unfortunately, this is just barely edible for me, and since I'd not crave it at all, I'll probably give most of the rest away.  The ingredients are fine, non-GMO, some antioxidant, tocopherols, and a high protein content.  It's also a bit caloric, but at least not in a totally bad way.  The taste just isn't there, and I don't like the mouth feel, it has a limp chewiness, no crunch and while you can make out some of the flavors, none of them tells you to come back for more.  Not recommended.  Clif makes better products than this.

title: Color me impressed, I expected not to like this thinking it would be cheap, but it was great.
text:
I have a shower filter by one of the more prominent makers. The problem was it restricted water flow a lot, and the filter replacements cost as much as this whole assembly. I couldn't believe the filtering tech going on here. Fifteen stages , really, and designed in an order to filter out the bad stuff and finish up the purification in the end. It probably doesn't filter our fluorine, bus that is something that some people like and others do not. It generally needs a reverse osmosis filter to remove it anyway.

Like my other shower filter, I thought this (especially with so many stages) would slow my waterflow in the shower to a trickle. It did not do that the flow although slightly restriced was nothing like my other filter. This one lasts longer too 4-6 months per filter cartridge and you get too. I didn't price them, but since the device and two filters cost more than one filter replacement from my old shower filter, I figured I could not go wrong here. The water even tasted good when I rinse my mouth (I usually brush my teeth and shave while showering). I love it, recommended. Frankly if they can get this much water flow for a shower filter, why not use these types for those passive filter pitchers I have in my fridge. It might take a bit longer to filter through, but the result would be worth it.

title: Great product as good as the name brand, and an inexpensive as you could get without being free.
text:
Seems to work as good or better than the leading brand, I use Petroleum Jelly for areas of my skin that gets chafed or irritated due to clothing or skin to skin contact. I use three things actually P Jelly, A&D Ointment, and an antibiotic cream, it all depends on what the redness seems to be caused by and if it's swelling. All three of those products have the effect of sealing the skin from air and moisture. I believe this inhibits bacterial growth on the skin and promoted healing. Amazon's brand here like the big V brand is basically a protectant, it's among the best to be used in areas just starting to chafe. If you are starting to be inflamed, then A&D will do some healing, and if the infection is bad, go with the antibiotic cream.

This earns its fifth star for the price the price Amazon is selling this for seems to me like it's below cost, so if you use the stuff, this is a huge supply for under 8 bucks on the current list price for 4 large jars of the stuff. If I had any complaint it would be that some of the product leached out a little in the shipping, and seeped into the cardboard, but it was little and no harm done except new stuff should be a bit better sealed. The four were sealed in plastic, but it still leaked through that. Recommended, great for covering burns, sores, any type of skin issue, with no chemical effects.

title: Fair price and a good cleansing and conditioning shampoo, not for everyone, don't recommend with children, or allergic.
text:
The odor takes a bit of getting used to, but all the aloes, oils, extracts and especially the activated charcoal, which since it's listed first meaning it's the most prevalent ingredient, do a nice job of cleaning and conditioning the hair. I have to use a dermatologist prescribe shampoo to take help take care of a scalp skin condition, and I like to follow it up with something, but my dandruff shampoo is a bit harsh for use after that. This is milder than you'd think and contains a number of things that act as a conditioner. Activated charcoal is often used with pets, and sometimes humans to negate and get rid of poison if swallowed. It works equally well as an outside purifier, often you find it in those Brita or other water purifying pitchers because of the cleansing effects.

This shampoo is gray and smells very much like medicine, but not as bad as lye soap, and the natural barks and other substances give some temper to the smell, it's no worse than a strong anti-dandruff shampoo, but milder and better for your hair. I think this would work better than my swim shampoo to take out the stiffness and effect of pool chlorine as well, so I'll try it next time I go swimming at a hotel. The cost is no bargain, but on the other hand, it's not much more than many dandruff shampoos. From what I can see a little goes a long way. It didn't bother me, but there is a caution that you might be allergic to one of many ingredients, there are about 25 of them listed, and a very diverse list of natural substances, so a bit of testing should be in order. Although it seemed mild to me, it cautions about getting in open sores or your eyes. If you have lice or other conditions make sure the scalp is headed before using. I recommend this because it worked for me, and is worth trying. Almost all organic compounds and free from petroleum distillates, glycol, and other unnatural compounds.

title: Very useful in these times to protect your hands..
text: In times like these, keeping your hands from not getting infected by virus has become very important since most of the germs spread by rubbing the hands to the nose or face. So I got these disposable gloves. I wear them before cleaning up a trash bin, picking up mails from mail box or unboxing online orders.I also wear them before washing the vegetables and fruits that have come from a store to home. Once used, just remove and dispose them easily. They come in a pack of 100 and would last for innumerable uses. They could be used while gardening and planting too. These gloves are reasonable for the price. They are very useful, especially in these times to protect your hands.

title: Great immunity gummies for kids to munch on..
text: Now that the fall is approaching and there would be more viruses in the air, it is of utmost importance to have immunity to fight these airborne microorganisms. I got this vitamin c gummies for the same purpose. They come in a bottle of 60 gummies with a serving recommendation of 2 gummies per day. Each gummy supplies 125 mg of vitamin C. You can taste the flavor of orange In the gummies. I also like that these gummies don’t have gelatin in them. Since they are in gummy form, the kids would love them and they are good for adults too.

title: Provides relief for my dry lips and face
text: I use this jelly more especially during the winter months where the skin is prone to dryness. I use it for my chapped lips, around the face and legs. It is a sticky jelly that absorbs to skin in 10-15 minutes after application. I helps in moisturizing very dry areas of the skin and removes redness due to extremely dry skin. I works great on chapped lips and face.

title: Bit greasy but works well..
text:
During the summer months, our family does lot of outdoor activities like hiking, biking, swimming, boating,beach fun etc. It is important to protect our skin from ultraviolet radiation of sun. We use sunscreen a lot.
Some of the features are as follows:-
1) Spectrum SPF 30 provides protection from harmful ultraviolet radiation (UVA/UVB) of the sun.
2) It is made with vitamin E that hydrates & revives the skin and prevents sun burns.
3) It is water resistant up to 80 minutes.
4) It is dermatologically tested safe.
Con:-
It is a bit greasy and sticky while applying but absorbs to skin after some time.

title: Didn't Fit My Face - Silicone on Band Pulls Hair - Calming Music
text: Current price $59.99. Not sure where to begin. First off let me say the concept is nice and the music is nice. However, the silicone hurts my hear. I can't see when I'm wearing them so I loosened the strap so it wouldn't pull my hair so badly. When I initially put the glasses on with the strap tightened it pulled my hair and hurt my face and eye sockets. I couldn't get it to feel comfortable. After I loosened the strap it felt better on my face. But all in all, I do not like it and wouldn't be using it - just didn't fit my face correctly. 3 stars. Hope you find this review helpful. I did find the music relaxing.  :)

title: Feels Great! Nice and Soft! Fits Perfectly!
text: It does exactly as described, and just makes the massage bed slightly more comfortable. It provides the feeling of floating instead of feeling stuck to the leather of the bed. 4 Stars! Hope you find this review and pictures helpful. Fits GREAT! Nice and soft!

title: Great Selection - Excellent Price - Very Versatile!
text:
Current price $38.99 - Securely boxed and wrapped. Each bottle has a tamper-proof lid that you have to "unseal" when you open the bottle. There are 20 bottles of incredibly nice essential oils - basically $2 per bottle. Very good deal if you like the fragrances that come in the box. I think they are all great except maybe citronella though it does have its uses! ;)

I recently started making my own reed diffusers oils. I love that I can change up how my house smells often. I just take a bottle of carrier oil and add some of the essential oils and add my reeds. Once the jar dissipates, I just create another fragrance. Way more economical then spending $15 to $30 per refill plus my house smells lovely! 5 Stars! Hope you find this review and pictures helpful! I especially like the large selection in this box!

title: Smells Mentholly like Mint! Feels Cooling On Your Skin!
text: Love this hemp sport roll-on lotion. The lotion spreads on evenly - a thin, clear layer when you roll the ball over the painful parts of your body. The picture of the hand is showing me applying the lotion on a finger that was previously dis-located and causes a lot of pain. I also use it on my knees. I have been an avid runner my whole life and my knees have taken a toll. This works great - just roll it on and let it dry. My dad had hip replacement surgery and sometimes it causes him pain. He said it helps him to forget all about the pain...until it comes back! ;) So I take that to mean it works but it's not permanent! 5 Stars! Smells good, easy to roll on, and it relieves muscle soreness and pain!

title: Smells good - Light Fragrance! Non Irritating!
text:
Facial Toner for Women and Men by IQ Natural - Vitamin C Toner for Face - Hydrating, Anti Aging Skin Toner

Nice toner. I like that it has vitamin C in it - the bottle is spray on so you don't need cotton balls or pads. The toner is non-drying. It has a very light fragrance that smells a touch citrusy. My face feels smooth and soft after using this toner! I like using vitamin c toners since it really helps with sun damage! 4 stars! Made in the USA! Big WIN! Hope you find this review and pictures helpful!

title: 36 Sounds - 30/60/90 Timer Functions - Breathing Night Light!
text:
Sound White Noise Machine with 36 Soothing Sounds and Night Lights Sound Machines with Memory

I love this sound machine! there are 6 buttons and each button has 6 sounds for a full 36 sounds! You have fans, wind, water, outdoor, white noise and 5 lullabies or baby womb heartbeat. The light has a cool feature too. It doesn't change colors but it is like it breathes! It goes dim, then out, and then turns on again - like it's breathing Very easy to operate. The volume control works great too! There are 30, 60 or 90 minutes timers. The unit will automatically shut off after this time. Love this machine. 5 stars! Hope you find this review and pictures helpful!

title: Did not Curl - Tangled Hair - Scary Device!
text:
YEEIN Auto Hair Curler, Wired Automatic Hair Curler for Long Hair Anti-Scald Rotary Curling Iron Temperature

Not sure if others were able to make this work but my daughter and I tried for hours - she finally gave up but not before I scared her when her hair got tangled and stuck inside. That was enough for her - luckily I was able to untangle it without having to cut it. If I started at the end of her hair - nothing happened. The hair didn't get pulled inside and rolled around the iron - it just stayed stuck inside but not doing anything. But if I started it closer to the scalp, the hair started spinning but got tangled inside. Bottom line - it is a scary device that did not curl her hair! If anyone has any better luck with these things, they must know the trick that I didn't figure out. But for me, it is one star - my daughter and I are both educated individuals and neither of us were able to curl hair with this device. We surrendered and admitted defeat! 1 Star! Hope you find this review and pictures helpful. I would have posted a picture of her hair but it didn't look any different and she had "HAD ENOUGH" at that point! Others have said it is easy to use; but I did not find this to be true for me!

title: A bit Dry - Strong Smell - Convenient
text:
Ultra Clarity Eyeglass Cleaning Wipes - 30 Pack | Safe for Use on All Coated Lenses and Electronic Screens

Price has just dropped from $6.99 to $4.99; maybe at this price it would be acceptable. The box was very securely wrapped. Then each package is sealed with a "tear here" tab. The wipes smell strongly like ammonia or something similar. The wipes were quite dry - seems like the wipes should have contained a bit more moisture. They did work though. So, at $5.00 - perfect to keep some in your purse or briefcase. 4 Stars! Hope you find this review and pictures helpful!

title: Pleasant Smell - Not Overbearing!
text:
OOPEE Toilet Room Spray | Odor Eliminator Air Fresheners & Bathroom Spray | Air Freshener Poop Spray

Two small bottles of bathroom seasalt spray. The fragrance is a bit floral but it's not overbearing. It takes care of the odors in the room! I would recommend this spray for any of those unpleasant odors lingering in your bathroom. I'm glad there are two bottles since I have two bathrooms! 4 Stars! Hope you find this review and pictures helpful!

title: No Smell - Works As Described
text:
HS Health Supplements, Sam-e 500mg (S-Adenosyl Methionine) Promotes Positive Mood and Joint Comfort,

It is always hard for me to write supplement reviews - work as should. I know some other reviewers said there was a smell - the container I received does not smell at all. Works as SAM-e should work. I like it for body aches! Highly recommend. 5 Stars! Hope you found this review helpful! Swedish Company.

title: Pretty blue, warm.  Simple controls.
text:
Wife saw this and immediately insisted on stealing it for work. Neat.

Soft and gets warm. Definitely nice. I would prefer if it covered my ankles while seated. The cats politely request that I leave this out and turn it on.

Does what it says it'll do.

title: My cats think this is a water dish...
text:
Pro:
Great packaging.
Awesome looking product.
Maneuverability, especially for small hands/children.
Pretty lights.
"big" tank.

Con:
Missing a lot of tips. This only comes with 2 basic tips and a tongue tip. No ortho, no brush, no varied sizes.
Open-top means my cats think this thing is a water dish for them with a string-toy on the side. Probably going to get chewed through at some point.
While you can flip the water tank over, you cannot secure it without unlocking and removing the hand unit/tubing.
When in travel pack mode I was unable to get the pick(s) to fit inside, and they were awkward lumps inside the travel bag.
Stiff cord makes it's length less lengthy. (hopefully it'll soften up a bit)

Verdict:
I can't say this is a bad unit, I just wanted so much to love it and it has quite a few drawbacks. I missed that it was open-topped (that's on me, it's clearly advertised) when I got it and thought it would be cool to have this thing ready to go at any moment, filled with water and a splash of germ-killing mouth wash to keep it from growing anything inside. That got dashed the second I realized it would be a water dish for my cats and would be ruined fast since one of my cats washes her paws (kitty litter mouth-wash anyone?) in the water dishes.
If the lid were flippable on the fly it would be great, but the cord attachment blocks the tank from sitting properly upside down.

It's still a nice unit, just less versatile than it seems. It is a little premium in price and certainly shines/looks premium but delivers average instead.

In the end ask yourself if this open top is for you. It's easier to fill for sure, and more maneuverable. Probably good for braces (but why no ortho-tip?) I think a simple lid and additional tips (perhaps they sell them, I'll have to look later) would make this well worth the money.

title: 5 for build quality, 1 for effectiveness.
text:
Really well built neat concept, clean components and obviously not built for someone with my face shape.

There's really no point in me going into elaborate detail, these things provided a mirage of "heat" that didn't reach my eyes, just warmed the silicone that didn't touch my skin a bit. The massage was 80% making the bridge of my nose feel like a child was tapping and squashing the sides in an unpleasant way, and the other 20% was kinda massaging the top of my brow, but only on the inside.

The entire outside half of my eyes barely got touched. Obviously my face isn't wide enough and my nose is too prominent. As far as I can tell there's no way to adjust these to suit your face so... Guess I'll be letting my friends/family play with them and see if anyone finds them useful.

title: Lets enjoy some TMI time...
text:
What you get is a box just like the one in their picture. Inside are 50 individually wrapped NOT CANDIES. I swear you could probably toss these in a bowl at halloween and kids would think (until they tasted it, I assume) that these are lemon candies of some sort. As you can see the individual pieces don't have any indication that they are NOT for consumption, or even what they are.

This is great for discretion I suppose, and the lemon smell doesn't smell like food lemon, but more like cleaning supply lemon, so hopefully no kids will eat these.

Anyway, you plop one into the toilet and it seems to kinda fizz a bit like a weak alka-seltzer and the smell of lemon is there. It's mild. Not overpowering at all, which gives concern for it's effectiveness after an Irritable Bowel meets Dairy Allergies evening of discomfort.

First, if you're in a rush (which I sometimes am due to having IBS) grabbing a pellet and ripping the (pretty sturdy plastic) packaging off and dropping it in the toilet might be the last thing on your mind.

Furthermore, it states if you get this on your skin to wash it off immediately. Easy enough at home, but why bother there? Isn't this for when you're at work and don't want to embarrass yourself after the company chili pot-luck takes it's revenge? I suppose if you're just at a friends house trying not to peel paint in their guest bathroom it's fine?

Anyway, it plop-fizzes before you plop-whiz and to it's credit I would say that I mostly smell just the faint aroma of lemon. Occasionally a whiff of my own brew would break through, but nothing too shocking.

Also to it's credit I allowed my last creature feature to stew for a solid 5 mins after I was done and came back to a still mostly lemon smelling bathroom. NOT BAD!

On the not so great side, is if you have ever used a Bidet, which I do, I'm assuming others have also noticed while it's spraying your dark side after a particularly unpleasant deuce-drop, the spray can kick up the smell as it splashes those particles off you and into the bowl. I can attest, these pellets being in the bowl and not up where the Bidet sprays, they do NOTHING to combat that aroma besides jazz it up with a hint of lemon.

At the time of writing this review the price is about 32 cents per potty break. I'm not convinced that this is something I'd use often, but perhaps if you're still young and dating and trying NOT to scare off a potential future spouse, or if you have exceptionally foul aromas.

title: At least it's not green.
text:
Packaging is fine. The box is clearly designed to be ripped open and act as a display, possibly for a store to sell individuals? Or maybe for your cabinet?

Nutrients seem good. Vegan is great if you're vegan. I'm not, but cutting back on meat/animal products is always welcome by me if the product is good.

I've never had the pre-made Soylent shakes, so I cannot compare to those. I have however, had other pre-made shakes AND THE IDENTICAL POWDER MIX of said other brand. The big complaint I've had about that other brand was "the pre-made is smooth and tasty, but the mix has a permanent GRIT in the shake. Like, I've shook it in a shaker bottle HARD, even let it soak for a while if needed. Tried it room temp and refrigerated, nothing makes the grains of sand feeling go away. Its' UNPLEASANT to feel while drinking.

Soylent powder does this same thing. (You can even see the grains that just won't dissolve, even in extra water) Its' got a decent flavor but it's like someone dumped sand in my drink. It'll do in a pinch but I am not clamoring to buy more.

At least it's not green.

title: Takes some getting used to.
text:
Pros:
Rechargable battery.
Strong pressure.
Stronger pressure.
Strongerest pressure.
If you like compression massage to your hands OMG so nice.
Turns itself off after 15mins.
Can be manually turned off.
3 modes focus the massage differently, but I didn't feel too much variation.
Heats up... sorta.

Cons:
Will not function while plugged in.
Makes noise. Not much, but it's kinda like "hmmmmmmmm tsssssssssssssssssssss" as it compresses and then releases the pressure.
Probably not good for BIG hands. I'm a fairly average guy and it worked fine but was pretty tight.
Doesn't... release? Not sure if this is a hand-size issue or not, but turning this thing off doesn't seem to release the compression of your hand. I was still able to easily wiggle my hand out but I really felt like it would/should "tssssssssssssssssssssssssss" and release all pressure. It doesn't.

Verdict:
I can't say if this is worth the price. I like it, and will absolutely use it again if I do some yardwork or whatever and my hands are sore/beat. Probably a cool thing to pull out at a family get together and let some folks get a hand massage. Certainly a cool gift idea.

it's a bit bulky and I can only describe the "heat" as "mild". To be fair I am not 100% sure the heating part did much of anything as my hands were already warm. It warns it "may" leave dots on your hand that will go away. It does. Lots of them.

This is probably more geared towards women or persons with smaller more dainty hands. I do think it does it's job.

title: Very good food storage containers
text: I like these work out as well as any other food storage container. They're also your good walk away take containers to not your real good expensive one so if you want to give them away to somebody with a bit of soup in their stew you won't feel so guilty if they don't return them so these are excellent for walk away and give away containers as well. They're also good to heat up well in the microwave with soup in them leftovers. They store food real well no leaks in the refrigerator. And use them in the craft room for storing dry items in no problem there they work out really well and that are decently priced and easy to use and they're just a food container they do what they got to do and that's all I do and I do it well

title: Best bath poufs I've seen
text: These are some really good bath poufs. They are smaller and that's a good thing. As a result of being smaller there tightly made and they don't pull a part like some of the bigger ones do. You're not sitting there and all of a sudden your bath pouf is gone it's pulled apart and it's no good you can't reuse it anymore. You stay together gutted you get some good leathering and sudsing with us. They're good for exfoliating to do the job.over my years of being a person that loves taking baths and showers frequently has a larger person I have to I've gone through lots of badly made bath poufs and I'm not having none of that here this is well made and these are nice and I'm going to be a customer break early this brand of bath poufs.

title: Works real well
text: This is a very good well absorbent facial tissue. For a person like myself with a lot of sinus and nasal issues I gotta have a good facial tissue like Kleenex. The aloe and the coconut oil and vitamin E.Seems to make it so my nose doesn't end up chaffed. I have had the dried Chapped skin from cheaper brands as I'm constantly blowing my nose due to the allergies and sinus issues. This Kleenex here is very nice to keeps my nose and my skin nice and soft.It doesn't flake and go all over the place it's holds up.Helps avoid chafed skin Which can be very painful irritating. These New Kleenex Excellent I recommend him to folks with nasal and sinus issues and especially with cold season coming in up

title: Horrible 👃 smell afraid to try it
text: We opened it,and myself and spouse noticed a rotten smell. Never tried it we're afraid too .afraid itd would make us ill.  Not supposed to smell so we knew it went bad somehow.

title: USDA certified and easy to throw in recipes
text: Lots of fun recipes can be used with this stuff - it's healthy (ie boosts mood and energy), USDA certified, and has little to no flavor when you add it to energy bites, for example. I like having this in the pantry to throw into quick snacks and smoothies to make me feel healthy :)

title: This thing is STRONG
text: First-time water flosser here, and I do have to say, it is taking a while to get used to. I have it set to the sensitive setting and it still stings my gums! Granted, I am pregnant and haven't had the best dental hygiene during my pregnancy (I throw up constantly and sometimes, gagging while brushing my teeth just isn't worth it) but I have been pretty surprised by how painful this feels. Does it have enough strength to blast away gunk stuck in my teeth? YES. As others have mentioned, the water basin is kinda small and doesn't last but more than a full cleaning, but I also would be the type to change out the water anyways, so it doesn't bother me. Because I am new to water flossing, I didn't expect the setting to shoot out water in sporadic episodes, ie, it's not like a constant outflow of water hitting your teeth. I'm guessing this is so you can move from tooth to tooth without a flow but I haven't mastered doing it quick enough yet. The first time I did it, I sprayed water all over my mirror, sink and face. I'm still getting used to it and not totally sure this method is for me, but I think it's a very powerful, well-made option for those looking to water floss.

title: Absolutely delicious roll-on oil
text: I am a yoga teacher and I use this in my classes. We do hands-on assists and I like having a yummy scent on when I go near students, to help relax them. I roll this on and usually get asked what the scent is, because it's really unique and smells sweet but also earthy. Highly recommend!

title: So far, so good
text: Reasons I bought: could help with my slight tinnitus (ringing in ear). I read that I should have K2 in my diet and since I am not super familiar with that vitamin and this has it, I am trying it. Reasons I like it: pretty decent taste, really easy to squirt and go. Things it could improve on: label! It's TINY print. It took me a while to find out it is 8 pumps a day. Other than the tiny font, I haven't noticed anything terrible. I will keep this updated if ringing changes. So far, it has not.

title: So nice! Heavy duty and literally heavy
text: [[VIDEOID:67bb50b838509162dfc8cd1041d0631a]] Though this blowdryer is a lot heavier than expected I still love it! The tip is magnetic and has the 2 slide in tips. They are very snug and I needed to find something to help pull it out to change it. Guess it's good it won't be flying off while I'm drying though. This is so sturdy and small but I would not say lightweight.

title: Only in Celsius, only one speed
text: The blowdryer and attachments are nice quality, but the temperature only displays in Celsius and it's only one speed.  The brush that came with it is nowhere near the quality of the dryer. It dries well and has good power but I don't like that theres not a Fahrenheit option and I don't always need it so high power to style. Think I'll stick with my dryer brush.

title: Like this scrub, but vibe modes could be better
text:
I feel like this is pricey but I really like this scrub. The rollers don't turn on their own (for some reason I thought they were going to.. 🤦‍♀️) but I love the size and the feel of this scrub. The bristles are the perfect length and the rollers are so nice around the bridge of the nose and cheek and eye bones. Took me forever to figure out where to plug it in. (pics) it didn't say in the instructions and I didn't want to poke through the silicone if I wasnt supposed to! Wish they would have covered that. Over $30 is a bit of a stretch but.. Would recommend
Update: I thought my battery was just low, but it's not. On any of the vibrate modes after a minute it stops does a couple short vibrates then continues with the mode. I keep thinking it's about to die or something is wrong with it..

title: Less than a week and it's tearing up
text: I have twins and each of them got one of these.  It has been less than a week and they both are already tearing up. Granted, this one has held up a bit better than the blue one, but my kids are not hard on these pillows. They are 9 and not rambunctious.  They mostly play their tablets or game systems and just chill out on these pillows. There is no reason for them to have torn up especially so soon.  The stitching is one single Seam. Not sergered or reinforced in any way. The interior pocket is not secured and made of a material that ripped at the seams.  The vibrating mechanism on this one just ends up against the side of the pillow there's such a large hole in the interior pocket.  Our blue one is even worse..

title: Where is quality control?
text: We received these Thursday or Friday night and by Sunday one has a hole. After looking at the way it's sewn I can see why. It's only one Seam.  Not a double seam, not capped off with a serger.. a single Seam throughout. One Seam pop and your ball is coming apart.  I went to remove the vibrating piece to sew the first hole closed and ran into more problems. The interior "sock" pocket is not connected within or across to the other side of the ball inside.  This makes it just twist and twist and I still haven't been able to untangle it to remove the vibrating mechanism. Also there are holes ripping at the side of this pocket where it meets the zipper.  This is ridiculous especially after 3 days.  My twins are 9, and mostly lay on these and play their tablets. They are not rough on these items at all and even if they were the product should be made to handle more "play" than this.  We really liked these and have enjoyed them for the few days it didn't tear up. I'm very disappointed in the seams and quality of how this is put together.

title: Smells so good!
text: This room spray smells so good and has a nice mist when spraying it. It is actually strong and with just a few sprays make a house smell so fresh and clean. It's a good size bottle and will last awhile for me. It arrived fast and was packaged well.

title: Perfect for that time of month
text: This is a great device for that time of month. With cramps and bloating I can't catch a break, but this handy belt works so well to sooth my pain and discomfort. I like how easy it is to use and how much better I feel after using it. It arrived fast and was packaged well.

title: Amazing facial machine
text: I love this facial machine. It is very easy to use. It was packaged very well and arrived fast. The attachments all work wonderfully. The wand is well made and fits my hand perfectly. The machine is a great value for your money. I have had noticeable results already. Definitely a great addition to my skin care.

title: Mild taste
text: This maca root powder has a mild taste and mixed well in my morning oatmeal. It mixes great and doesn't clump. It comes with many servings. Great value for your money. I like that it's vegan. It's packaged well and can seal back up.

title: Spicy
text: Came packaged in a plastic bag. Roller ball took a long time to prime and then was glitchy (sometimes a lot of oil came out, sometimes barley anything rolled out). Scent is heavy on the bergamot- which is a spicy orange and reminds me of cloves. It’s a very warm and cozy scent.

title: Pleasant scent
text:
Was packaged loosely in a plastic bag. Roller ball took awhile to prime and continues to either dump oil out or not provide any oil. I have never, to my knowledge, smelled spikenard or helichrysum, but I can definitely identify top notes of ginger, which gives the blend a nice, spicy scent.
The ad makes claims that this blend is “doctor approved” to support wellness and alleviate aches and discomfort. Well, as a nurse with hand arthritis, I would disagree. It did nothing for my hands except make them smell nice.

title: Works
text:
This supplement comes as a white capsule that is easy to swallow. I have been using D3 5000 iu for months and have noticed no changes in effectiveness between this supplement and my previous supplement of a different brand.

Current price is $12.95 (or $0.14 a pill) for 90 capsules. In comparing prices to other D3 5000 iu, this supplement is, on average, more expensive then others. I removed 1 star due to this fact, but would overall recommend.

title: They Work Well!
text: The Moon teeth whitening strips work great! I’ve now used them all and my teeth are at least about 3-5 shades whiter than they were when I started. I used to have whitish yellowish teeth and I really wanted something that made my smile a little more confident so I tried Moon. They include top and bottom strips that dissolve after 15 minutes or so. After a week I could already notice a big difference in the color of my teeth. After using them for a month I can say my teeth are much whiter and these work! The taste is nice and minty and tastes pretty good! I spit out the formula just to be safe instead of swallowing it but it leaves you with fresh breath for quite a while! I can easily recommend these strips!

After the first use my teeth were whiter and within 5 uses, about 3 to 4 shades whiter, removing most of my stains! Love this product!
