title: cushy!
text: super cushy and pillowy! Nice and thick so it actually gives some support, but because of that, don't put them in shoes that are tight.

title: great!
text: This smells so great! Works wonders on odors and replaces it with a nice and light scent. Not too perfume-y, its great

title: a bit of luxury
text: This roller is a great addition to add a little bit of luxury to your skin care routine. I love the three different options for the interchangeable heads. Will be curious to see how it lasts longevity wise, but even if the vibrating mechanism stops working it will still be a useful tool!

title: This is great!
text: I grew up dancing and so my feet have always been calloused and covered in dry skin. I used this the morning after doing a foot mask and the dead skin just melted away! Be careful not to push down while you use it because that will stop the stone from spinning and I imagine that could burn out the motor, but honestly, pressure is not needed for it to work!. There is also a slower speed option I would guess it is if you want a more gentle exfoliation. All in all though, this is a great product.

title: Broken cell-wall chlorella in vegan capsules
text: This chlorella supplement comes in vegetable cellulose capsules with no other additives. These are nutrient dense algae supplements that help allkalize and detoxify the body. This is somewhat expensive for the amount you get, so you may wish to look out for a discount or buy in volume if you plan to use it a lot.

title: Natural cotton feminine pad clothes, colorful designs, storage bag included
text: This is a set of all cotton decorative cloth pads for women's menstrual support. For any woman seeking additional aid with absorbing the monthly flow this makes a nice gift. For cotton cloths that are just worn underneath your clothes it is a little expensive, but if you like these colorful, attractive designs it is worth it.

title: Nutrient dense wheat grass juice powder in resealable bag
text: Wheat grass juice powder is a more nutrient dense super food than regular wheat grass powder, which is why it is more expensive. This package provides a pound of the organic certified powder, which is easy to mix in a beverage. This gives you a boost of vitamins, minerals, and amino acids from a safe plant based source. Even people who are gluten sensitive can usually handle wheat grass OK, so this is a valuable supplement for almost anyone to consider.

title: Nice option for organic turmeric powder
text: This package includes 3 resealable bags of organic turmeric powder. The bag labels are easy to read and the contents are reasonably fresh. For organic turmeric spice powder this is not overly expensive, and getting the smaller bags is an alternative to getting a single larger bag.

title: Beta glucans immune support, vegan capsules
text: This bottle contains concentrated beta glucans from a couple different sources to support immune health. The capsules are vegetable based and have a couple flow agents but no other additives. This is a one month supply at the recommended dosage, a little expensive but worth trying if you are looking for isolated beta glucans.

title: Mushroom blend in vegetable based capsules
text: This supplement combines Lion's Mane with Reishi, Chaga, Shiitake, and Maitake mushroom species for a range of health benefits. The capsules do include silicon dioxide and magnesium stearate so this isn't free of flow agents. For this combination of mushroom extracts this is reasonably priced and this supplement is worth trying for supporting immune health and cognitive functioning.

title: Good natural immune support formula with natural vitamin C, minerals, and herbs
text: This formula provides capsules with a blend of nutrients and herbs that support immune health. Fruit based vitamin C along with zinc and magnesium are combined with several fruit and herb extracts to help enhance immune functioning. The capsules are vegan and have a natural raspberry flavoring. These are a fairly good value for this type of formula.

title: Easy to use roll on essential oils blend
text: This is a small roll on bottle of therapeutic essential oils with a coconut oil carrier base. The aromatic oil blend includes sweet orange, lavender, cedar, and bergamot. The roll on formula works well and is gentle on your skin. This has a pleasing scent and is good to use if you want a scent that is refreshing. This is a little expensive for the amount you get while it is worth considering if you like roll on oils.

title: Nice electric facial massage roller, rose quartz stones
text: This facial massage roller includes a pair of attachments suitable for the massage function as well as a manual roller tip. The stones used are genuine rose quartz. This works as well as other electric facial massage roller devices I have used and it comes in a box that would make it ideal for giving as a gift.

title: Good quality liposomal vitamin C in ascorbic acid form, vegan capsules free of additives
text: This is a liposomal vitamin C supplement in vegetable based capsules made with sunflower oil and sunflower lecithin. This uses the ascorbic acid form of vitamin C, which is the more natural form. The recommended serving is 2 capsules, so this would last about 2 months. This is a practical way to increase your vitamin C intake. I like that these capsules are free of any additives. This comes in a dark bottle to help protect the capsules from light.

title: All natural skin cleansing sponge with bamboo and activated charcoal
text: This sponge is designed to be easily gripped and to rub your skin for a thorough cleansing. It functions as expected and makes a useful addition to your bathing routine.

title: Formula with vitamins, minerals, herbs, and a probiotic for immune support
text: These capsules contain a variety of ingredients to support immune health. Antioxidant vitamins along with minerals and herbal extracts are included, plus the lactobacillus acidophilus probiotic. Each of the ingredients have a link to immune health, which shows how complex immune functioning is - it depends on a variety of elements to prevent illness. These capsules are made with vegetable cellulose and no additives. There are multiple companies now selling immune formulas that are pretty much identical to one another, perhaps capitalizing on the current wave of infectious illness and public interest in natural remedies for prevention. This one is reasonable priced and has a good combination of ingredients. Using this type of supplement while maintaining a healthy lifestyle and avoiding overeating or other stresses on the body can certainly help prevent illness.

title: Spirulina tablets with no filler
text: These organic spirulina tablets are just pure spirulina blue green algae, no additives or fillers are included. This product is from Myanmar, the first time I have seen spirulina sourced from that region. This tastes similar to other spirulina tablets I have used. It isn't too expensive and it is a practical way to consume this nutrient dense super food.

title: Superfood chlorella in capsules
text: This green superfood is a type of algae that is full of nutrients. The broken cell wall makes it easier to digest. These capsules are vegan and free of any additives. This is manufactured in the USA and sold by a company in Miami Beach but it does not say where the chlorella is sourced from. If you want a nice nutritional boost that helps with heavy metal detox then these capsules are a nice option.

title: Bitter melon powder, great for blood sugar balance and cardiovascular health
text: This is a resealable bag with bitter melon (karela) herb powder. There are no other additives. This mixes easily in beverages and can help a lot with some common health concerns. The taste is of course bitter, which is why it helps the digestive system balance sugars similar to how other bitter herbs may work in that way. The bitter melon fruit looks like a wrinkled cucumber and is something you can find fresh at some grocers. This particular item isn't organic certified. This is a good supplement to use and if you don't have access to fresh bitter melon then the dry powder is something to consider, although it is a bit expensive to buy it in this small amount.

title: Pure Triphala powder - Ayurvedic blend for digestive health
text: Triphala powder mixes a few different fruit extracts with a slightly bitter taste and helps with digestive issues and other health concerns. This is a pure, natural powder that can be mixed in a beverage. The bag is resealable. This is a time tested Avurvedic remedy and this bag is a good value for the amount it contains although the bag I received does not appear to be organic certified, so the item listing that says organic may not match the product correctly.

title: pure haritaki powder
text: This herbal powder is free of any additives (not sure if it is organic though). Haritaki is used in ayurvedic medicine as a laxative and is fairly safe to consume in small amounts. This comes in a resealable bag and is a good value for this herb.

title: neem seed oil supplement in veg capsule form
text: This is a neem seed oil supplement in capsule form. The capsules are made without gelatin using a banding solution as well as ethyl alcohol, titanium dioxide, and a coloring compound. Neem seed oil is a powerful and versatile seed oil with many uses, and this supplement is fine for those seeking a vegetarian friendly capsule form, though not as pure or economical as just getting a bottle of the liquid oil that hasn't been encapsulated.

title: A quality hydrolyzed collagen powder supplement
text: This is a powder supplement with multiple types of bovine collagen to help with skin health and anti-aging support. It has a pleasant vanilla flavor and no additional ingredients besides the flavoring and citric acid. This is a fairly small sized container compared to some other NeoCell collagen powder products. If you want a pure collagen powder without additional ingredients or sweeteners then this one is a good option.

title: A multivitamin style supplement with additional ingredients and plant extracts for joint health
text: These tablets are a nutritional supplement that includes vitamins, minerals, and other ingredients that can support overall health in addition to helping maintain joint health. The dosages of most of the nutrients here are pretty low so this is for general support and not adequate to address a deficiency. This does not have magnesium which is surprising since that is one mineral most people need. These tablets contain ingredients that come from seafood so they are not suitable for strict vegetarians (since many yoga enthusiasts are vegetarian I think it would be wise to create a vegan version of this). This does have ingredients such as MSM that help reduce joint pain and promote joint repair, so it does have benefits that some users may notice fairly soon after starting to use it. This supplement is a good idea though it could be improved in some ways. Also, the label is pretty hard to read due to very small print as well as lack of contrast in the section where white text is printed on a light green background.

title: A broad spectrum of nutrients and extracts for vision support
text: These capsules contain a combination of herbal extracts and nutrients to help maintain eye health. These are free of unnecessary additives and they include ingredients that complement one another fairly well. The only thing that surprises me is that they don't include Zeaxanthin, a flower extract commonly found in vision supplements. This supplement has seemed fine for me, no adverse effects and easy to use. I would recommend limiting your screen time with LED devices to reduce eye stress and get the most benefit from this type of supplement.

title: A dual purpose selfie stick with wireless bluetooth
text: This selfie stick has a built-in tripod feature so it can be used either as a selfie stick or tripod. Of course, if it is extended then it isn't as stable to stand as a tripod. This has Bluetooth wireless remote control for taking pictures. The stick function is pretty easy to use. It does have some plastic parts that could break if you drop it, so you'll want to take good care of it. This will work fine with most current generation and recent era mobile phones. The tripod is a simple one for flat surfaces, not the kind with flexible legs that bend. Overall I think this is pretty good if you want a tripod and telescoping selfie stick combined in one device.

title: Resealable bag of raw, organic maca powder
text: Maca is a nutrient rich super food from South America that has become popular as a supplement for boosting vitality and overall health. This bag contains a powder that you can mix in recipes and drinks. This is raw maca (not heated) and it tastes like other raw maca powders I have used. This has a zip lock type seal so you can reuse the bag. For organic maca powder with nothing else added this is a fairly good value.

title: Organic moringa leaf powder - great for a superfood smoothie
text: This resealable bag provides an easy to use Moringa leaf powder that is certified organic and seems fairly fresh for the dried leaf powder. Moringa is full of nutrients and is a fast growing tree that can support a healthy environment and nourish people with its leaves. I actually have a couple moringa trees I have grown from seed and like the leaves for teas and smoothies. This powder is convenient to use and makes a great addition to a superfood smoothie.

title: Nutritious organic wheatgrass powder
text: Wheatgrass is a popular nutrient dense superfood, and the powder is great for mixing in juices and smoothies. This organic powder is a half pound bag that you can reseal after each use, keeping the powder fresh and dry. This tastes just like other wheat grass powders I have used and is reasonably priced.

title: Pure ashwagandha powder in a resealable bag
text: This is just what was expected - a pure ashwagandha powder, certified organic. It seems fresh enough and comes in a plastic bag that has a silver colored surface that blocks (reflects) light. The bag has a resealable zip lock closure. Ashwagandha is a valuable herb that is good for the endocrine system and other aspects of wellness. For a reasonably priced organic herb powder this is a nice option.

title: A good organic turmeric powder
text: This turmeric powder is certified organic and contains no other ingredients or additives. It comes in a resealable bag and seems fresh. If you use a lot of turmeric then this powder will be useful. The whole turmeric root is used to make this powder, so this is not a concentrated curcumin supplement although it could complement using a curcumin supplement.

title: Baby oil made with soy and coconut oils plus vitamins and fragrance - OK, but not all natural
text: This baby oil is a gentle oil with a bit of added fragrance. The ingredients seem to be mostly naturally derived with the exception of the fragrance and a lab-made vitamin C. It seems unfortunate to me that an otherwise pretty natural product has a synthetic scent added. While this is better than some other baby oil products it is a bit expensive and has the added fragrance, which is not too strong but not a purely natural scent. The oil comes with instructions for massaging a baby with it as well as a note that you may need to pump the container multiple times to get the oil flowing. This is a Johnson & Johnson product made in Greece. Hopefully this big consumer products conglomerate will commit more fully to some all natural products in the future.

title: Great Product
text: This product is 3 shower sponges.  One is pink, one is blue, and one is purple.  I tried out this product, and it is wonderful.

title: Great
text: These shoe inserts add great comfort.  They are gel.  I love and appreciate these inserts.

title: Amazing, Magnificent, Wonderful, Outstanding
text:
I love this set of bath fizzies so much! It has 12 big bath bombs, each a different scent. I use these bath bombs to soak my feet in, because I need to baby my feet, because they do so much for me. I tried out the first one, and my feet loved it so much! My feet stayed in the pan of water for over an hour, reading. I felt like a queen! These bath bombs are the best! My feet feel pampered and cared about. My feet appreciate these bath bombs!

These are the 12 scents: (Even though I love all the scents, I tried putting these in order from the one I like least to the one I like most. And it wasn't easy putting these in order. But with my personality, I wouldn't be happy listing these randomly.)

Green Tea
Lemon Sherbet
Grapefruit
Mango
Ocean Breeze
Vanilla
Sparkling Apple
Eucalyptus Mint
Lavender
Cherry Blossom
Lily
Rose

I love, love, love this bath bomb set so much! It is a very great and wonderful product!

title: Great Foot Pads
text: These foot pads work wonders.  I am trying them out, and they are making my feet feel so good and they are giving so much comfort.  These are just what I needed.  If you have feet problems, then I highly recommend these foot pads.  They bring a lot of much-needed comfort.

title: Perfect Insoles
text: These gel anti-slip inserts are good quality.  They provide comfort.  I highly recommend these.  They are perfect.

title: Sleep Mask
text: I had to adjust the straps so it wouldn't be too tight. This mask does me a lot of good, and I love it. I have sensitive eyes and sleep near a window. And it is comfortable. I just cannot say how good it is.

title: Smooth heel
text: I love this to smooth my cracked heels. It was easy to use and I love that it comes with extra foot file heads. The grinder is lightweight and rechargeable. The foot files are rough enough to smooth out my heels. I used it dry and with water. Worked well with both.

title: Nice face massager
text: This feels so good! I love that it warms up too! It makes my skin feel like it’s refreshed and tightens it up a bit. My skin feels firm after use. I didn’t realize how to turn it on at first but you just have to press the power button and then touch your face with it.

title: Good
text: This brush is lightweight and love the silicone bristles. It took some getting use to because the bristles felt weird at first.

title: Wasn’t sure how to use
text: Great for improving skin but there were no instructions. I kind of had to figure it out myself. After I figured it out I tried it and liked how my fast looked afterwards. At first I didn’t think it would do much but my face has a glow to it and appears a bit smoother. Very soothing spray.

title: Was skeptical at first
text: Never used a sleep mask before but after using this one I felt so refreshed after my work nap. The mask  was so comfortable and relaxing. I liked that it doesn’t feel like my eyes are squished. The only thing is that not sure if I wore it right but I can see a little like coming through by the bridge of my nose.

title: Great for skin care
text: Ordered this to help shrink my pores and tighten my skin. Love love this! Feels very soothing. Great for my at home spa facials.

title: Good for household chores
text: Got these  for cleaning and washing dishes.

title: What a delightful light product!
text:
This as part of a skin care regimen to combat skin cancer which is quite prominent hear in the SouthEast Coastal area, and I find it to be light and airy yet nicely firming and youthful vigor inducing.

It doesn't sting at all and in fact, it is quite soothing. It is tightening yet comfortably so... I use it twice a day after washing, before applying vitamin C serum... It has become quite a pleasant ritual.

title: Small but awesome!
text:
I was using a streaming sound machine and truthfully, I am less than excited to have a WWW link open the entire night during my sleep. I know, not likely a biggie, but I just don't like it.

This little machine has battery power as well as plug in power when the juice is available. That is really convenient for camping! Although, when camping, you often hear REAL Crickets and such! Speaking of REAL.... This sucker is as real sounding as REAL!!! You cannot tell the difference, and I am a country boy!

There are many sounds available and the truth is, they are all really good. My only nick on this setup is the the buttons are touch buttons that their feedback isn't as accurate as I would like, as is the light actuator... Not as predictable as I would like because I hate fussing with the light or the on off or changing sounds to get it on the setting I want.

That said, this thing is tiny but awesome!

title: Q is a must do!
text:
I like the heart and blood pressure benefits of QGel but I found with this brand that my joints also get a little bit of relief. I don't know if that is normal but I like it.

Now, it must be said, these are big gel capsules but they are easier to swallow than I thought possible. I take it by itself with a glass of water and take my time. I like this formulation and it seems to help a lot of issues.

title: They work well while challenging in the area of comfort.
text:
These earplugs are much better than the foam disposable earplugs and they don't need to be thrown away at the end of the night. What I think these earplugs need is some fine-tuning of size. I tried the small for my left ear (the smaller of the two) and the small was too small. My right ear canal is larger and the medium-sized earplug fits well.

I can generally sleep 5-7 hours with the earplug in, but by the 5th hour, my ears hurt pretty badly.

Nonetheless, they do an adequate job of quieting the environment in general, however, the snorer next to me seems to be insurmountable. The earplugs mute the snoring slightly, but not quite enough. I am a very light sleeper, so your results may vary.

title: Good economical choice
text: This shaver does a really nice job. The blades are sharp and you can cover a decent amount of area with each "pass". I deducted one star because the battery life isn't quite what I would like but it did get the job done without needing to be charged. Just don't expect to go multiple cuts without charging. The price is reasonable and I would definitely recommend as an economical choice to keep your head free from hair.

title: So far so good
text: My husband has been using this for a couple of weeks and while it is too early to see long term effects, so far so good. It mixes well with water and does not leave a chalky aftertaste. His recovery time seems to be better and he has had no ill side effects thus far. You only use a small amount at a time so this container will last a while. He has been pleased and said that he would definitely purchase again.

title: Wonderful neck massage!
text: This neck massager is glorious. It has a long enough cord that you can use it on a bed or a couch/chair and be able to relax while doing so. There are different settings and I really appreciate the option of heat. There is a wall plug and also a car charger although I feel like it would be very awkward to try and use it while driving. It does however work wonderfully at home! I do not have a current listed price to compare value but it would definitely make a great gift. I highly recommend!

title: Super cute but tight at the top
text: These polka dot masks are super cute and stretchy. My one complaint is that they're tight across the top of my face and I feel like it's going to leave a mark. For this reason, I don't wear it for an extended period of time. Other than that I would highly recommend for quick trips or stops.

title: Great value and quality
text: These compostable forks are a fabulous deal. They are sturdy and strong and the huge package will last my family for a good while. I really like that they're better for the environment too. Every little bit helps and you can feel good about this choice. I would definitely purchase again.

title: Spa-like experience
text: This fizz smells amazing! It turns a regular bath into a relaxing spa-like experience. My skin felt very moisturized afterwards which is a huge bonus.  It would make an awesome gift for anyone on your list that likes to feel pampered. The price is also fantastic! Great find.

title: Not the best quality
text: These gloves are true to size, maybe even a little on the small side.  I have small hands and the fit was a bit snug. I used them to chop onions and my finger poked through the tip on one hand before I could finish. I would recommend these for cooking or cleaning but definitely not for PPE.

title: Awesome loofah!!
text:
These loofahs are wonderful! The weave is tight and it gives you an excellent lather in the shower. Afterwards, my skin felt smooth and exfoliated.

I really like the set of 4 because I am always forgetting to replace my loofah regularly. This way I have an extra available and the price is great compared to what you would pay in stores. Awesome product!!

title: Lovely gift
text: These bath bombs arrived in a lovely, heavy-duty gift box.  They are all individually wrapped and can be given as a set or broken up to use in individual gift bags or baskets.  I really like the scents but did find that a couple of the bombs were already starting to crumble.  Not a big deal since they will be dissolved in a bath anyway but it could be an issue if you are opting to give this as a gift.  The candle design would not be my first choice, especially if you want to give this as something other than a birthday gift but not a big deal if you’re purchasing for yourself.  Overall, this is a great set at a reasonable price.  At roughly $1 per piece, these are definitely a better deal than many others that I have purchased in bath and body shops.

title: Smell awful
text:
I was super excited to try these dryer balls because I love the idea of not having to throw away countless fabric softener sheets while using something that is much better for the environment. My excitement was short-lived however because right out of the package these smelled awful. I left them out of the plastic for a few days hoping that the smell would dissipate but they still smell like a stinky sheep. So much so that I cannot bring myself to throw them in with a clean load of laundry for fear that my clothes will smell the exact same way and we will all smell like we've been rolling around in the barnyard.

I really wanted to love these but I just can't get past the smell. It seems that the other reviews are very positive so perhaps I just received a bad batch??

title: Minor Flaws, But Does The Job
text: Having three small long hair dogs that need groomed frequently gets expensive. While I am by no means a professional, these are easy to use with a small learning curve to getting used to it. The clippers are smaller and lightweight, so you aren't holding a heavy clipper while near a small dog. They don't pull or snag the hair and the noise level is really low. The dogs don't get scared by the noise thankfully. The fact they are cordless makes them easy to use on dogs. I can't speak to cats because I've only used these on small yorkies, but I'm sure they work for cats too. I'll be saving us money each month doing standard grooming at home.

title: Homesteading in the 21st Century
text: With all of the inflation and shortages across the country, this is actually the best way to ensure you have laundry soap for cheap. The two bags are 10 lbs and that provides you months upon months of washing soap if you want to save money and make it yourself. The bags reseal easily too, so you can make small batches when you need them. I use these as a deep cleaning as well as an ant killer for inside the house because the spring rain has brought ants. You can use these for so many purposes; bath bombs, detergent, cleaning agents, and so much more. It's cost effective too! There aren't any impurities in the bag and I've enjoyed using it to make laundry soap. Even the little ones like helping out because it's natural and it's like a science experiment for them. I definitely recommend these, especially if things keep going the way they are.

title: Add More Water Than Suggested
text:
We live in the south. You need all the help when you live in the south in the summer. The humidity and heat are brutal. If you don't beat the heat, you'll need these. The trick I found to these is to do a little more than 32oz of water. I do 4oz with warm water for the powder to dissolve and then I had 30 oz of cold water and ice cubes and shake again. These tastes much better cold, but the powder dissolves easier when it's mixed in warm water initially.

The orange tastes good. It is a bit sweeter than I would like, but sweet is better than salty and the sweetness gets better when you add those extra couple oz of water. It doesn't taste like the fake sugar thankfully. And it doesn't taste like salt which I half expected like other fluid replacement and electrolyte mixes.

They come in an easy to keep package. Grab what you need and stick it back in the closet. These are even good for school sports since you can hydrate a whole team for just over $1 a piece. Still cheaper than name brand.

title: Good Gauze, Okay Medical Tape
text: I've been putting together my jump bag which requires a lot of gauze and bandages. For $14 at the time of review, you get 30 rolls of gauze. These are literally the perfect size for any first aid kit or jump bag. The one thing I like most is that the gauze doesn't stick to wounds nor fall apart. They are multi-ply gauze that are well thread. You can pull this tot without worrying about it ripping. It could be a makeshift sling if needed it's that durable. I find the individual wrapped rolls better to use than a large roll where you have to keep cutting after each use. These are perfect "one time use" rolls. They fit snug in the box or you can stick them all in your kit depending on size. No complaints here!

title: Smells Intoxicating!
text: Oh man these smell so good! Lemongrass is my favorite scent when it comes to essential oils and I enjoy looking for bath bombs and shower steamers that smell like strong lemongrass. The only thing I didn't care for was how difficult it was to actually open. Once I did get the bag open, I was hit with the lemongrass. The smell is literally intoxicating. If you place directly under the shower, they will dissolve quickly. I like placing one on one of the built in shelves where the water just splashes occasionally. I get a longer lasting steamer and the scent is closer to my face. These are $17, which puts them at almost $2 a piece, but this is okay because I've paid far more for shower steamers from name brand companies that weren't as strong. This is really a win for me!

title: More Perfume Scent
text: $12 for 6 bombs is pretty average when it comes to the price of good bombs. I wouldn't say that these are over the top, but I do believe they are decent. The actual bombs are small, fitting in the palm of your hand. The scents are a bit strong, more perfume scented than fruit scented. The orange actually smells like orange, but the others smell like perfume. A little too strong. The bombs do float and fizz longer than the other brands I have tried out. The water is colored with pretty colors and not just a dirty looking bath. I would say these are better for kids than adults personally, but for the price, you can't go wrong. I don't care for the perfume scents, but some do.

title: The Soap Petals Are A Fun Addition
text: I'm using to purchasing bath bombs for nearly $6-10 a bomb at major bath and spa stores, so these bombs are $18 at the time of review are an amazing price. The scent, the size, the colors, and the extra soap petals are a steal! The bombs are a great size. They fizz, spin, and float for quite some time, longer than usual bombs. There is even a very large heart shaped bomb that lasts forever. The scents vary and are not too perfume like nor too fake smelling. They are relaxing and calming. I love that it includes the plastic piece to open the bombs easier too. The box itself has a bunch of flower petal soaps inside. These petals are fun for floating and using the soap to wash with after. You can't go wrong with this box of spa bath bombs.

title: Facial Steamer
text: Facial steamer comes with ozone and helps soften skin for extractions, kills bacteria on my face and easy to transport.

title: Professional
text:
Esthetician Review:
This product is definitely not for unlicensed hands. Infact this is a definite profession product. I would not use on my face without trying on arm first. Product does sting after a while I got used to the stinging.

title: Bath Bombs
text: Bath bombs are very nice and smells good. The only issue is bombs stain the tub. Overall quality is good!

title: Toner and Serum
text: Toner and serum is refreshing after a facial cleansing. Toner tighten pores while the serum moisturizes. Smells a little medicinal but overall product is good.

title: Body Brush
text: Bath brush is everything I need. I am able to clean hard to reach back. Brush exfoliate and is relaxing. I am confident my back is fully cleaned with brush.

title: doesn't include battery
text:
Review: USUIE Red Light Therapy Belt, 660nm & 880nm, Near Infrared Light Therapy Device for Body, LED Flexible Wearable Wrap, with Timer for Back Shoulder Waist Muscle

The only con here besides the high price is that they don't include a power bank/battery. If you buy the $50 or so knee massagers etc, they include a 3000 mAh battery at least and this is more expensive than that.

The controls are very familiar and reused on other massage devices like knee massagers, back massagers, etc.

title: Pretty good
text:
Review for: AW(AidallsWellup) Head Shaver, AW Men’s 5-in-1 Electric Head Shavers for Bald Men, Head Shavers for Men, Anti-Pinch, Ergonomic Design, Cordless, and Rechargeable.

Pros
=Claims IPX7: Can be submerged up to 1 meter in water for 30 minutes.
=USB charging means you can plug it into any USB connector such as a computer, laptop, power blocks, solar panels, power stations, sockets with USB plugs, car chargers, power banks, and more.
=Includes power block, which is rare
=Facial scrubber is great to improve your face combined with a facial scrub, pickup at store
=LCD is functional with all of the info. I'm not a huge fan of it vs. others but it gets the job done.

Cons
=Not a 7D shaver (one more blade) which is the new standard.
=just a bit more expensive than others that are typically around $45
=No USB-C input, outdated USB-B
=facial massage attachment is pretty useless

title: Black and Gold 7D
text:
Review for: 9-in-1 Head Shavers for Bald Men w/ 7 Floating Heads, LED Display, USB Rechargeable, Mens Grooming Kit w/ Rotary Shaver, Nose Trimmer, Hair Clipper, Brush. Cordless Electric Razor Wet and Dry, Gold

I check out a lot of these. This one is a pretty standard design that you will see elsewhere. What's different to me is the look and the price.

Pros
=Great price with the coupon. Great deal
=7D shaver which is the latest thing over the 6D ones they seem to be slowly discontinuing
=IPX6. Can resist high-pressure, heavy sprays of water.
=Great/standard LCD with the basic info of % remaining, clean, low power etc
=Travel lock
=Brush is great to combine with fascial scrub daily to see some improvements to your face
=USB charging means you can plug it into any USB connector such as a computer, laptop, power blocks, solar panels, power stations, sockets with USB plugs, car chargers, power banks, and more.

Hair Clipper : Midrange, nothing special but better than nothing. Consider getting a more dedicated hair cilpper if you need to use this regularly.

Cons
=I say the facial massage brush is pretty useless
=Not IPX7 and there are IPX7 versions
=Nothing to store it in

Just make sure you shop around for the best looking one, price and maybe IPX7

title: ok
text:
Review for: Shallmu Electric Razor for Men Bald Head Shaver with Touch Switch Waterproof Rechargeable Small Shavers 6 Blades Kit 6 in 1

Pros
=IPX6: Can resist high-pressure, heavy sprays of water.
=USB charging which means you can plug it into any USB connector such as a computer, laptop, power blocks, solar panels, power stations, sockets with USB plugs, car chargers, power banks, and more.
=includes comb guides
=base unit is used often so there's some quality to it
=facial brush is a great attachment for cleaning the face, combine with a facial wash

Cons
=facial massager is pretty useless
=Only IPX6 instead of IPX7
=LCD is just the basics, % remaining vs. the better ones out there with colors or that show low battery, cleaning reminder, etc.
=doesn't include a power block
=touch ability is flaky

This wouldn't be my first pick in the $40-45 range.

title: JM-700AL
text:
This item is the Resuxi - JM-700AL. Resuxi is a great if not the greatest brand in hair clippers so it's a solid unit. But it's version 2 of hair clippers and they have a better version 3 out there with better LCD/water resistance.

This is an improvement to some of the earlier designs. The main improvement is the LCD. The previous implementation was just a dot that was red/blue /green or not depending on the power. This one shows you % battery left as is seen on most $30+ clippers.

Pros
=t blade design allowing for 0mm cuts
=USB charging to power it up. USB charging allows you to charge via solar power, power stations, power banks, car chargers, laptops, etc.
=comes with a brush. I don't know how many sets come with a brush
=1500 mAH battery is really good. Typically you see 600 or 900 mAh on these. That allows for a crazy amount of time usage as high as 5 hours. On other ones, you'd see 60 mins or 2 hours.
=includes oil which most sets do not include.
=comes in a nicer, more giftable box. You feel epic when you receive it.
=come with this plastic cover around the base of the blade that the older sets don't include

Cons
=no water resistance. Version 3 has IPX4
=Version 3 of these clippers has a better LCD panel
=The power cord is specific to this set and if you lose one, it's hard to replace
=no power block to recharge with
=this version doesn't have USB-c charging

title: Best tasting
text:
Review for: JYM Supplement Science Plant Jym Oatmeal Cookie, 2 Lb, Oatmeal Cookie, 2 Pound

I have a WALL of protein powder bottles I've collected. So far this one is the BEST tasting one. I just mixed milk and the powder in the blender and it tastes good together without anything else.

24g protein is a major+

The cost works out to be $1.66 a scoop which is pretty similar to the other ones I've checked out. However this one tastes better.

I can recommend it!

title: Huge hit
text:
This was a great hit with the spouse. These massagers are found within a larger chair overlay where the massaging balls move up and down the chair. However with this product, they stripped that out and give you one section you and position on your own manually.

This is smaller than the chair overlays and is more portable for use in the car (don't use while driving) and at home. The heating element is great depending on the time of year (85F degrees in California).

No complaints at all. The price is great and it's much easier to store than my big chair massagers.

title: Does the job
text:
This Blood Pressure Monitor by Antrolife works as good as you could hope for an at home model to work. It gives accurate readings when compared to others I have used. The quality seams to be pretty decent and it’s easy to take your blood pressure. And the screen is nice and large so it’s easy to read even if you have poor vision.

The only complaints I have is using the other features isn’t very intuitive. Figuring out the different users and where everything is stored isn’t easy to navigate. Overall though it’s not a bad monitor.

title: It’s ok…
text:
I have been using the long rod like ones of these types of overnight curl things and while I like it, I did wish I could achieve smaller curls and waves. So when I had the chance to try this Heatless Hair Curler that looks more like an octopus I was excited and hopeful.

Unfortunately I found this much more difficult and tedious to use than the ones I usually use. I used this about 8 times over the last few weeks and it takes 4x-5x longer to do than the other types do. It did give me slightly smaller waves, but honestly I don’t think the extra work is worth slightly smaller waves. Personally I think if you are using this to cut time out of your morning routine than I would pass since it takes just as long as just curling your hair would.

title: Simple but works
text:
Like a lot of people these days I have developed shoulder and neck issues from working from home and staring at a computer screen all day. I have tried two other neck cushions like this one before, but this ComforTrac Wave Cervical Traction Neck Support one is definitely my favorite.

This one has a softer almost memory foam type middle that makes this much more comfortable to use than the ones without this. But it’s also more expensive than others I have, so there is that. But this does help a good bit when your having neck pain overall it’s nice and works pretty well, but it’s on the expensive side.

title: Doesn’t latch properly
text: [[VIDEOID:c88404ff4e543139357eb1b7e8c8466b]] I really wanted to like this Small Pill Box, I have been looking for a cute little pill box like this for a while. Unfortunately mine doesn’t stay closed. As you can see in the video I don’t even have to push the lever on the front to open it, it just pops right open.  Maybe mine is defective… but I can only review what I get! Also worth noting the outside is not metal or anything like that, it’s entirely plastic. Based on the one I received I would not recommend

title: Disappointed
text:
I’m a bit confused about what the brand was going for with this facial steamer. It’s really much to large and expensive for a home unit, but it’s also nowhere near professional quality, so I’m just not sure who the target consumer would be here.

A bit about me, I’m a total skincare aholic and will try anything at least once when it comes to skincare fads. Now I have over the years totally boiled a pot of water, poured in some essential oils and herb blends, and gave myself a steam facial. Not only for beauty but also if I am congested or have a stuffy nose, and it totally helps. So my hope for this product was that it would be something that was quicker and easier, and more comfortable while doing the steaming, than the whole boiling pot on the stove thing.

And it kind of delivers somewhat, but not what I expected for the price point. First the steam does get decently warm, but not hot. More like water that was boiling and you turned it off 15 minutes ago hot. It definitely could get hotter in my opinion.

The overall quality isn’t very great either for the price point. It’s wobbly and you can tell it’s made with cheap materials as well. Setup was fairly straight forward though. Overall I just can’t see how I can recommend this. It’s way over priced, it only gets mildly warm, and it’s huge for an at home unit, for now I think I will stick to my boiling water in a pot on the stove…

title: Fells heavy at first but soaks into skin quickly and no greasy feeling
text:
The first time I used this skyn Iceland Nordic renewal moisturizer I wasn’t a fan of it at all. It felt very heavy and thick on my skin, even with the smallest amount used. Generally I hate moisturizers that are that heavy feeling. However within 10 minutes of using it I noticed it had all sunken into my skin, and my face wasn’t greasy or gross feeling at all. This is honestly the first moisturizer I have ever used that went on that heavy, but soaked up that fast and left my face feeling soft and moisturized without being greasy or gross feeling!

Scent wise this is very very lightly scented. I can’t smell it on my skin and I have to really sniff to get any sort of scent form it at all even in the jar. It’s almost like a sunscreen/summer scent that’s hard to describe. But it doesn’t smell bad and the scent isn’t overbearing at all. I also really like that when you want to buy a refill you get it a little cheaper and just insert it into the original jar. Overall I’m actually quite likening this thus far!

title: very sturdy and I feel like it will last a long ...
text: I bought this for my husband per chiropractor recommendation. I thought it would be flimsy and cheap since it was much less expensive than the other bolsters. Boy was I wrong. Very well made, very sturdy and I feel like it will last a long time. My husband is a large and very tall man and this fit him wonderfully. He uses it under his knees at night while he sleeps so his back is in a better position. Great value.

title: Ingredients
text:
These are firm, moist, chewy, lightly sweet with a little cherry taste. Not much like a candy bar, but pleasant enough.

The sugar content is 19%, compared to 50% or more for a typical candy bar.

A lot of the fat and 260 calories are from the almonds, which are high in what's generally regarded as a healthy oil.

The ingredients: organic whole-grain rolled oats, almonds, date paste, organic honey, pea protein crisps (pea protein, brown rice flour), hemp hearts, vegetable glycerin, cherries, salt.

Allergy info: contains almonds, may also contain traces of tree nuts and peanuts.

The freshness date for mine is October 23, 2020.

title: Goldilocks gloves, M true to size
text:
I like this thickness of glove, with more tactility than the heavy-duty cleaning gloves I've tried, and much more strength than even the strongest surgical-style ones.

These have a cotton lining (flocking) that starts at the wrist. It makes it easier to get the gloves on and off, absorbs a little sweat, and may strengthen the glove. It can be harder to clean, though, so some prefer unlined gloves for repeated use or for use with nasty substances that have to be completely washed out for reuse.

They grip fairly well, not quite as well as bare hands for some things. Some people are saying they're not so great for handling dishes in soapy water. That's not what I have in mind for them, they're fine for general cleaning.

I usually wear medium, and these mediums fit well, snugly in most places. At 8-1/2" my palm is a bit larger than specified for medium in the size photo (upper left of the main produce page), but my fingers are short, even for these. I have some other mediums from this brand without the lining too; these are a little snugger because of it.

I've noticed that this kind of glove, with the right and left fit, tends to be tight between the thumb and palm when the thumb is stretched out, but that hasn't interfered with their practical use. They may wear out faster there.

Cleanbear is a recent brand from China.

title: Goldilocks gloves, lined and unlined, M true to size
text:
I like this thickness of glove, with more tactility than the heavy-duty cleaning gloves I've tried, and much more strength than even the strongest surgical-style disposable ones. I can actually type with these (if a little clumsily), and clean a toilet with them without getting a leak.

This set lets you try a couple pairs with a cotton lining (flocking) and a couple pairs without. I prefer the lining, makes it easier to get the gloves on and off, absorbs a little sweat, and may strengthen the glove. The lining can be harder to clean, though, so some prefer the unlined for repeated use or for use with nasty substances that might get in and have to be completely washed out for reuse.

The solid color are the lined ones, the bicolored unlined. Besides that difference, the bicolored seem thinner (maybe because of the lack of lining) except at the darker-colored parts, which are beefed up to at least match the solids.

They both grip fairly well, not quite as well as bare hands for some things, slightly better than some of the similar gloves I've tried out.

I usually wear medium, and these mediums fit well, snugly. My palm is towards the large end of the large size according to the size chart in one of the Amazon photos (3.5"), but the medium is actually a little larger than some very similar mediums I've got from other brands.

I've noticed that this kind of glove, with the right and left fit, tends to be tight between the thumb and palm when the thumb is stretched out, but that hasn't interfered with their practical use. They may wear out faster there.

Made in China.

title: Work
text:
These remind me of the originals, softer than other third-party replacements I've tried. Softer is said to be easier on gums.

Fit and work just like the originals.

Come with hard plastic covers over the heads, individually wrapped in plastic, all in a small paper box.

Made in China.

title: Feels very nice but needs nose shaper and isn't for largest heads (or biggest hair)
text:
I really like the soft feel of this, and it blocks light very well. Except where it doesn't. As others have pointed out, it leaks light around the nose. What it needs is an adjustable nose fitter like some dust masks have.

The lower strap should be long enough for almost anyone, but the upper strap is only an inch longer than I need. Since I have an average-sized male head, there will be a significant number of people who will find the strap too small.

title: 3 pairs of glasses with soft cases, no bags
text:
The Amazon photos at the upper left of the main product page show the colors and cases. The cases are a little tight, and leave about 1/2" of the glasses exposed to dust, no doubt to make it easier to get them out.

I got the +1.5 lenses, a little stronger than I need but they work fine for book-reading distance. They make my 15" laptop screen look like it's my old 17". I have to sit a little close with these to use them with the laptop. For me they work best for things between 12 and 21 inches from my eyes. (With some +2.0 lenses it's 13 to 17 inches, so these work better for me.)

The optical quality is OK, no distortion except for pronounced pincushion effect (straight lines get bowed inward at the middle) when looking through the edges. It's normal to have some pincushion distortion for reading glasses, and it the lenses are as large as these, you get more at the edges than with smaller glasses.

The current product description seems to be of some other offer. I got three pairs, as stated in the current product title, not four, and no storage bags or cleaning cloth.

The measurements are as shown in the product description. 5.5" or 140mm for the arms (temples) is a little long for me and most other people, but since these are so light and the arms pull inward a little, they fit securely. They should fit most people.

Made in China.

title: Good But Too Expensive
text: My sister-in-law is a physician and has recommended to our family that we take NAC daily as a precaution in case anyone gets Covid.  She believes that it will help to keep symptoms milder and enable our bodies to fare better if we get it.  I'm happy with this NAC supplement, but ultimately wonder if it's worth the very high price.  The capsules are moderately sized and are easy to swallow.  They also have significantly less odor that other brands of NAC I've used - and this is a supplement that can have a really off-putting smell.  These appear to be of good quality and are made to high standards, but the price is really high compared to most other brands.  It's hard to recommend these due to the high price unless you have an allergy to some certain ingredient common to other less-expensive brands.  Very good but very pricey.

title: Good C
text: My physician sister-in-law suggested to our family that we take vitamin C daily as a preventative to combat covid - not that it will keep us from getting it, but she said she thinks it's helpful in maintaining a healthy system to fight it.  I decided to get liposomal C over traditional regular C after reading about it's much better absorption.  Happy with this brand.  The 2 capsule dose is easy to take, with the capsules being of average size and without any noticeable odor.  Haven't experienced any aftertaste or ill effects.  The ingredients seem to be of good quality: vegan, gmo & gluten free, GMP certified, no artificial ingredients, etc.  I also appreciate that it's made in the USA.  Good C!

title: Good Ingredients, Not So Good Taste
text: I like the ingredient combination in this liquid.  I've taken various blends of glucosamine, chondroitin, etc. for quite awhile for moderated age-related arthritis and found it helpful.  Though this is a good formula, unfortunately I am not a fan of the flavor.  It's sickly sweet with a medicinal flavor that's just not very palatable.  I will finish the bottle since I've got it, but I won't be getting it again based strictly on the taste.

title: Okay
text: I like these Zilly ear plugs okay.  They do a good job of making painfully loud events bearable and not painful.  I got them after going to a concert several months ago that was so loud I couldn't enjoy it.  These will be effective to avoid that situation next time.  As far as fidelity and clarity, they're so-so.  They are better than a pair of foam earplugs that just muffle and dampen everything, but they're not noticeably great on clarity and the claims of high fidelity seem exaggerated to me.  Overall they're good for sound reduction but only fair on sound quality.

title: Pretty Good
text: This was my first foray into a keto creamer and I like it pretty well.  I was expecting something that actually seemed like creamer, but this really just feels more like putting oil in your coffee at first.  I have found with repeated uses, however, that it does accomplish what creamer does to a degree.  It makes the coffee a little smoother and less pungent.  It also adds a bit of sweetness, and I'm grateful it's not overly sweet.  One packet seems about as sweet as perhaps a half packet of stevia.  The french vanilla flavor I got is also pleasant.  Ultimately you won't mistake this for heavy cream in your coffee, but it's a pretty decent substitute if you want a non-dairy option that's good for keto.

title: Great Taste & Nutrition
text: I like the keto bars a lot.  They have a very natural taste thanks to the quality ingredients - lots of seeds, nuts, and other such natural items.  The fact that they use monk fruit instead of erythritol or stevia gives them a much more natural tasting sweetness.  The texture is chewy and nutty and the flavors are really good.  Good healthy keto snack!

title: Okay But Could Be Better
text:
I've used breathe-right strips in the past to help get better airflow through my nose while sleeping. They work well but the cost becomes a burden since they're disposable. Decided to try a nasal dilator and got this. I see the potential and it work somewhat, but it needs improvement.
The first issue is the little tab that holds the two dilators together. It's super short and keeps me from being able to insert the pieces far enough into my nostrils. I ended up cutting the strip and separating the dilators, which helped a bit. The second problem is that the tubes need to be a little longer for my nose. They don't reach quite far enough into my nose to completely open up the airways. Thirdly, I find the blue filter inserts to be counter productive. They reduce airflow, which is already the issue they seek to fix. I got rid of them immediately. The last thing is that these don't always stay in my nose overnight. The extra-big ends that remain outside of the nostrils keep them from getting a good tight seal for me.
Despite the above complaints, these still help. They might work better for someone with a smaller nose. Ideally the tubes would come with plenty of length and could be trimmed to size to fit the users nose more suitably. These are okay, but could be better.

title: Good Quality Household Gloves
text: I'm very happy with these household gloves.  I got them for use doing house cleaning and for changing my car's oil (where they keep my hands clean and give me good grip).  These are of good quality, with sturdy durable material that has a nice bit of flex and good grip.  I like that two pair are thinner with a little more tactile response and two pair are lined for added comfort, protection, and/or warmth.  The length is long enough to cover beyond the wrist and to go over long sleeves.  The sizing is also accurate: I have medium-large male hands and the mediums in these fit me snugly  and also work well for my wife and her smaller hands.  Very happy with these all around.

title: Excellent Cleansing and Wonderful Aroma
text: This organic shampoo goes on easily, with a thick, rich feel that lathers up nicely.  It rinses clean, leaving none of the tacky residue that some shampoos do.  I love the fragrance.  It's a strong herbal blend of patchouli, frankincense, balsam, cucumber, and other oils that give it a very natural and unique aroma.  Though strong, once rinsed it doesn't leave behind too much of a scent but just a pleasant hint.  It leaves my hair feeling very clean and manageable without drying it out.  Overall, I like it a lot, and particularly appreciate the organic ingredients that forgo the usual laundry list of chemical ingredients.

title: Misleading
text: There is nothing that frustrates me more than when a supplementanufacturer uses "Servings 1," but then somewhere else on the label recommends you take two-a-day. Let's just be upfront and let consumers know that this 60 capsule bottle will only provide a 30 day therapy. That makes this an incredibly expensive D3 supplement compared to other quality supplements. I don't like to be mislead. I will not recommend this product.

title: THRILL A PRE-TEEN!
text: These HUGE bath bombs completely THRILLED a pre-teen!  They are very large in size and take a few minutes to start releasing.  At first, we thought they were "duds;" but when they started to release, the result was "magical" to a pre-teen.  Her mother was worried about the "cleanup" since the bombs release very colorful trails.  The colors truly did not adhere to the tub.  There was a little residue left on our bather, and unfortunately it did transfer to her bath towel.  But. the color did come out in the wash.

title: Great Formulation!
text: I must take 5000IU of Vitamin D3 per day to stabilize a Vitamin D deficiency.  I recently learned that  Vitamin K aids in the absorption of Vitamin D.  I was thankful to find this XGoldHealth formulation that combines the 5000IU of Vitamin D with a 225mcg complex of Vitamin K1, K2 and K3.  I have had excellent results with the XGoldHealth formulation and look forward to the results of my next blood test which will determine the true effectiveness based on my Vitamin D levels.

title: JUST RIGHT!
text: This KRAFT bags are just the right size!  They are not too small, and not too big.  They are well-crafted of a heavyweight mil kraft paper.  The seams are well glued.  The handles are attached securely and seem to be quite durable for the size of the bag.  I will order these Kraft gift bags again!

title: Greatest Absorbency Rate
text: With an autoimmune condition in the midst of a pandemic, I am taking more interest in the effectiveness of the supplements I take.  After doing some research, I found that Liposomal Vitamin C has been shown to have the greatest absorbency rate.  I spoke with my own PCP who echoed this belief.  I have switched to Liposomal Vitamin C, and have managed to steer clear of ANY illness symptoms since beginning my regimine.  I plan to continue use of Liposomal Vitamin C on the advice of medical professionals.

title: TRAVEL ESSENTIAL
text: I used to use rubber bands and a zippered storage bag to keep my supplements safe and secure when traveling.  When I saw this travel organizer, I knew it would be perfect!  I actually use the organizer every day [not just when traveling]; but when I need my pills "on the go," I just slip the organizer into the pretty pouch and securely slip it in my bag.  The pill organizer is well made with a lever latching system which makes each compartment simple to open.  The compartments conveniently stay open while you are filling them.  However, since I completely fill these containers, I have found that the little lever can actually crush the pills on top when closing.  Even though this organizer is large and each compartment is generous is width, the compartments are much more shallow than my previous organizer.  It is a challenge to fit all of my supplements into the compartments and close the lid.  If each compartment was just a little deeper, this would have been a five star review!  Although some reviewers have said the pouch looks "cheap," I think it is attractive, functional and durable.  The manufactured PU "leather" will keep this pouch looking good for a long time.  I did not think I would have a lot of use for the pretty little matching round three-compartment container.  However, I have decided to keep it filled with several doses of OTC anti-inflammatory pain reliever and keep it in my purse.  It is great to know I always have a little on-hand.

title: Better. Not Perfect.
text: This sleep mask truly blocks out the light.  However, as a side sleeper, I still have issues.  It is admittedly more comfortable than most other mask I have tried when I roll over onto my side, but it has not proven to be the "lifesaver" claimed in the description.  I will continue to wear it and rate it four stars while I continue to search for the "perfect" mask.

title: Excellent Quality
text: Fantastic gloves! Excellent quality. Great fit. FUN COLORS! This set contains one lined and one unlined pair of gloves for different needs.  The lining actually makes the gloves easier to get on and off while cleaning. These gloves are completely waterproof. They provide excellent protection for your hands. These are the best cleaning gloves I have used in a long time!

title: The lining makes the gloves easier to get on and off.
text: EXCELLENT gloves!  Durable quality. OUTSTANDING fit. The lining makes the gloves easier to get on and off while cleaning.  These gloves are completely waterproof.  They provide excellent protection for your hands.  These are the best cleaning gloves I have used in a long time!

title: Excellent protection for your hands.
text: EXCELLENT!  Durable. Outstanding fit. Totally waterproof.  Excellent protection for your hands.  Best cleaning gloves I have used in a long time!

title: Real PROS.  Nasty CONS.
text: These Neem Seed Oil capsules had truly lessened some of my auto-immune symptoms.  I was so excited about the results until I started notice a distinct ODOR in my breath, perspiration, and overall "body odor."  It is hard to describe the smell, but it was NOT pleasant.  I was actually emitting an unpleasant odor that I was able to smell myself.  The odor started within a day or two after adding this Need Seed Oil to my supplement regimen.  After I discontinued the Neem Seed Oil, the odor dissipated within a couple of days.  I did a little research and came to find that Neem Seed Oil is known to have a strong "garlic-like" odor.  Well, it is just too unpleasant for me.  I would love to continue these capsules because I was noticing a difference in my overall well-being; but I can not tolerate the "body odor" it gives me.

title: Contains Shark Cartilage, Sea Mussel, Alfalfa Leaf, Boron, Yucca Root, and Devil's Claw Root
text: Although I do not do Yoga on a regular basis, I do suffer from lack of flexibility, mobility, and movement.  I have long taken Glucosamine and Chondroitin for joint stiffness. I decided to try this particular supplement because it also contains Shark Cartilage, Sea Mussel, Alfalfa Leaf, Boron, Yucca Root, and Devil's Claw Root which are all known for their anti-inflammatory properties.  Beware, this supplement does contain shellfish and soy for those with an allergy or intolerance.  I am excited that this product is Made in the USA; but I am still seeking more transparency on the Best Earth Naturals company.  I am unable to find information about the company on-line.  I would like to know more about the company producing supplements I put in my body.

title: helpful

title: not the best
text: really seen no improvement

title: good product
text: this is extremely easy to use and works great to clean and brighten partial and dentures

title: Cleans better than water alone. As good as others, and more environmentally friendly.
text: I find this cleaner to be fairly average, which does not mean bad or deficient. It gets a star for being more environmentally friendly than others. I found for it to work better with grease type dirt, just like any other cleaners, you need to let it soak into the stain for a little while first, then mop it up. Give it a little time to soak in and then scrubbing won't be so hard. (The packaging does not tell you this, but just basically mop and go.) In the package it smells fresh and clean, but one sheet of it in a gallon doesn't really smell like much. This pack does yield quite a bit so it should last a while. I also tried it on my stove for grease spots and that worked too, but again, I had to let it sit for bit to make wiping easier.

title: Trying something new.
text: I rate it 5 stars becasue I try to take a probiotic everyday and these seem to be a good enough substitute for what I was already taking. I just started with these, and so far not bad side effects. 25 Billion is a lot! I read that at some point the higher (way high) numbers might be overkill, but I also read that this high number can help the gut even more... and I need all the help I can get in that dept! I'll try anything to get my gut to behave! I do find that they are a bit pricey for a 30 day supply. I will report back if these present any difficulties.

title: Delivery system not the best for me.
text: I take magnesium regularly for leg cramp prevention. I try to take it at night before bed to try and head cramps off at the pass, but unfortunately this is not always possible to do. These looked like a good product to try. Twist the top off, and just drink the premeasured strawberry flavored magnesium in one shot. Well, unfortunately I do not find that the liquid easily comes out of the tube when opened, and I have to squeeze and roll it several times to get every drop out. Also it is only about 1/2 of the dose as my other under the tongue formula, so I do not think it packs enough of a punch for my needs. We are all different, so your requirements may be different. I still get leg cramps the nights I use this... but that is me. Sometimes nothing helps me, no matter what or how much. You need to be the judge on things like this based on your experience taking it.

title: I wished this tested more than 45 common foods.
text: As long as you are drawing blood and sending it in, why not test for as many allergies as possible? The instructions are easy enough. They do ask that you have eaten from all the foods that they test for, within a 3 week period, to get better results. Since these are common foods, I did eat from most of them in this timeframe. I only poked myself once, and I was able to fill the number of circles that they asked for, I think 8 samples was what was needed... but it took a long time becasue my initial poke was relatively small and wimpy. I sent the results in on a Monday, and I had results back online in about a week. Mine luckily came back that I am not allergic to any of the foods tested for, so I was happy about that. I am fairly confident that this is accurate becasue I really didn't feel that I was allergic to any food substance... I just like to eat, so darn, it didn't tell me anything I should avoid on this list. THe test was easy enough for me to do myself, and I do not like poking myself to draw blood! It was a matter of 1-2-3...go!

title: There are things I like and things I don't care for.
text:
What I like is that the ease of the roller ball, and the hardness of it, allows you to roll right over your clothing... so if you do not feel like getting undressed (other than after a shower, or any other reason why you are not clothed), it seems like it is still effective even thru "average" wight clothing. I am sitting here with sweatpants and a thermal shirt on, and the rolling motion is still felt thru my garbs. The instructions on the box do not say anything about "skin," and just mentions "affected areas."

Now I will go the opposite direction with this... let's now assume I am now in only my birthday suit, and I want to rub in a lymphatic massage oil, or any other herbal oil or body butter... can I use this roller to roll over or to apply something to my skin that also helps my lymphatic fluids to move? The directions on the box that this ships in do not mention anything about using this product with oils or creams. THEN i did just look at the sales/info order page here on Amazon and it does mention using it with these products. I only checked here to double check it's usage. Good to know, but I with this was printed on the box or came as an inserted instruction. But, now I know and will proceed to try that!

The only other negative that I noticed, and this is probably just me, but I felt my soft tissue on my upper outer arm kind of hurt, like light bruising, after rolling this over that area a few times. That sore feeling did go away after a couple minutes. I got this becasue I have lymphedema swelling and liquid retention mostly in my left leg, becasue I had uterine cancer and 50+ lymph nodes removed 16 years ago. My arms are fine, but I do have fibromyalgia sensitivities, so that is probably why this would have felt like it hurt. (Kinda dumb observation on my part I admit, being that I am the one who controls the pressure! Not the fault to the product! But I guess it doen't take much pressure to use this ball, and that can be a good thing.) THis said, compared to other lymph massagers, like wooden U shaped sticks and wands, they tend to massage up a larger and flatter swath, involving more skin area with each stroke. This one is more like a rolling acupressure point. I an not tell which method moves the lymph better... I am going to guess this is personal preference.

title: These will do just fine.
text: These will work for me, and last a long time. I have really bad water stains and mineral deposits in my toilet, and this got rid of most of it at first try... I got tired (my stains are that bad) and the rest should be easier to tackle. What I was able to tackle came off fairly easily.

title: A good dose of all the ingredients.
text: I am switching around my usuals to give this a try. I never really feel the effect of any of my vitamins, I just know they are things I should be taking. Maybe someday I will feel good, I hope! I am actually only half dosing on these right now because I am also trying some Krill Oil and I don't really want to be double doing it. I do not notice any smell or flavor with these, so that is a good thing! We all react to supplements differently, and there is nothing that disturbs me about these... I just hope they are helping! Still a little pricey when I add it to everything else that I am taking.

title: Nice set of agate heart.
text: Nice little set of green agate polished hearts for decoration, jewelry making, or healing. They look like a combination of natural and dyed agate, but I do not know for sure. Dyed or not, priced well, they are worth the value. Someone spent time shaping them!
