title: Great replacement bottles, but very firm!
text: It is important to regularly replace your sinus rinse bottles as they can harbor bacteria and mold. These are an upgrade over a simple neti pot as they allow more control, but I found them hard to squeeze. They do soften a bit when filled with warm water, but I still needed to apply quite a bit of pressure to get it to spray. My husband really likes these as he doesn't have to bend over the sink as much and can easily squeeze them with one hand. The tip sprays water like a shower nozzle rather than in one jet stream like his old bottle too. Not really sure if that makes a difference in the cleaning of your sinuses, but it feels nice. Overall, for the price for two bottles, this is pretty reasonable and the saline packets are easy to pick up at your local warehouse store or online. With the cold weather approaching and fall allergies in full bloom, these are great to have on hand to keep your nasal passages clean and moisturized.

title: Left my sinks gleaming!
text: So check out the shine on my sinks! I think that speaks for itself, but I will go on for a bit because I love this Power Cleanser and Polisher from The Crown Choice! It cleans to a streak free shine on both my stainless steel kitchen sink and my bathroom porcelain sink! It also removed some really old burned on stains from my enameled cast iron Dutch oven! Made in the USA, this Power Cleanser and Polisher cleans well and rinses easily and leaves behind a beautiful shine! It has the consistency of like a thinner soft scrub, but does not contain bleach and is septic safe. The reusable scrubbers that came with it are pretty awesome too! These sparkly scrubbers remind me of those bath poofs that allow for lots of soapy lather. I used them with dishsoap and they made tons of bubbles! They scrub well without scratching and rinse cleanly,  plus release food particles easily. I toss them in my washing machine inside a garment bag and they come out good as new! I love that I can wash and reuse these over and over and I am keeping junk out of the land fill! So happy I found The Crown Choice line of products! I have also tried their Lemon Zest Naturally Powerful Multi Cleaner,  check out that product as well. It left my granite countertops gleaming!

title: Perfect addition to our dino party!
text: My kid is dino crazy, so this banner was perfect! We all got a kick out of how the letters look like bones in the dinos body. Yes, you do need to string this yourself, but they provide you with plenty matching ribbon to hang it and it takes just a few minutes. Lay out all the pieces on a table or on the floor so you can be sure you have the letters in the right order and do not get mixed up as you go. Pay special attention to the fact that you have letters of graduating size and there are two different sized A's, H's and Y's so before you string these, make sure you lay them out and have the right size in the right place or else it will look disjointed. The letters start small at his head, get big in the middle, and get smaller again towards the tail, refer to the picture on the package for help. Not a big deal, you just need to lay them out first, so do not wait until the last minute to tackle this! It is totally worth any extra effort on your part, he is super cute and will really tie your theme together. I love that I can shop for party supplies from my home. It saves me from running all over town trying to find the perfect thing and the decorative details make our at home Covid parties feel super special and fun.

title: Checks all the boxes for me!
text: I was happy to find a sensitive toothpaste that was made in the USA of natural ingredients and actually works! I have been using it for a week now and so far I m happy! It has helped with my sensitive tooth pain and makes my whole mouth feel clean! This toothpaste has a natural mint flavor that I dig, it leaves my mouth smelling and tasting clean without a sour aftertaste like I get from Stannous Fluoride does. Typically you will find either Potassium Nitrate or Stannous Fluoride as the active ingredient in sensitive toothpastes. Whenever I use toothpaste with Stannous Fluoride, my mouth is left with a sour after taste that makes me feel like my breath is bad even after a through brushing. Not the case with this Spotlight Oral Care Toothpaste, it has Potassium Nitrate and Sodium Fluoride instead. It works to calm tooth pain and still leaves my mouth fresh! As is the case with most natural style toothpastes, this one does not create huge amounts of lather, but it still does a good job of cleaning. it gets the job done without any unnecessary additives. Plus it is made in the USA and comes in a recyclable tube which I appreciate! All in all, I am happy and I would purchase this again for my sensitive teeth!

title: Luxury for Your Feet
text: This Sharper Image Acupressure Foot Massage Ottoman is a luxurious relaxing experience for tired feet. Whether you are just looking to put your feet up or add some heat or have a massage, it is versatile and compact. The convertible feature is convenient and I appreciate the ability to adjust the settings such as compression level and speed. I've used some other foot massages that do not have the top piece to keep your feet snug and it prevents it from allowing a deep massage. Luckily, this device helps to hold your feet in place and allow for a more powerful massage. Overall, it is a great device and I highly recommend it for anyone with tired feet after a long day or also it would make a wonderful gift.

title: Potential Benefits But Mostly Water
text: I have read about the potential health benefits of Humic and Fulvic Acids and was interested in finding a supplement that contained them. Trace Minerals appears to be a trusted and well recognized brand that makes high quality supplements so I was interested in this Liquid Gut Health supplement. Fulvic acid has a list of potential benefits ranging from inflammation to immunity to brain function to metabolic health and more. But there is not a lot of great research comparing dosages and offering proper recommendations. This liquid contains only 10mg per serving of 1 tsp. The rest of it is just water. It tastes and looks just like water. And after taking it for over a week, I can't notice any difference. But if you're looking for a pure and tasteless means of supplementing with fulvic and humic acids, this is certainly a worthy option.

title: Small Bottles But Works Pretty Well
text: These FREY Laundry Stain Remover Spray bottles are small, but they get the job done well and are convenient to pack in a car or purse so that you have a stain remover for when you are on the go. I've used it on several small stains so far and found it to work rather well. There is still a minor outline of one of the stains, but I'm sure it'll disappear in the next wash. Although the bottle seems small, it does contain 325 sprays each so it will last you.

title: Gets the Job Done Right
text: I have a collection of sneakers and they can build up odors over time and pass on that odor into my gym bag or closet. I have used various scent sprays in the past, but have been trying to avoid artificial chemicals and potential exposure to VOCs. I was happy to discover this Natural Shoe Deodorizer Spray from Sprayzee. What really appealed to me is the natural ingredients and essential oils. Rather than being fearful of using a spray, I can rest assured knowing it is safe. Best of all, it really works! My shoes now smell great and fresh.

title: Portable Pre Workout Packet
text: I pack my gym bag and take it with me to work and it can sometimes be a pain to pack pre workout. You can either take the entire container or put a few scoops in a container or bag. Also, some preworkout mixes have caffeine which I try to avoid if I am training in the evening. This VivaStix solves both those problems. It packs 5g of BCAAs, 5g glutamine, and some beet root powder along with being naturally sweetened. It tastes great and is very easy to mix into a water bottle. Quick, convenient, and tasty.

title: Great BCAA Drink that is Naturally Sweetened
text: I like using Pre Workouts before going to the gym but sometimes I work out late and do not want any caffeine. BCAAs are a good way to help my workouts or recovery and are easy to digest. Unfortunately, many products are filled with artificial chemicals, flavors, colors, and sweeteners. I was very pleased to find this amino acid blend by Inno Supps. The ingredients are excellent since it is sweetened with monk fruit, stevia, and some erythritol. I also love that it not only contains BCAAs, but also other essential amino acids and glutamine, therefore making it a more complete protein. I found the taste to be very flavorful and yummy. Definitely recommend it!

title: One of the Best Natural Preworkouts Out There
text: I am an avid weightlifter and have used dozens of different preworkout products over the years. Unfortunately, there is often a dichotomy between high quality ingredients and purity. Many preworkouts are either filled with artificial colors and sweeteners or are extremely weak in their dosage. I have used some potent preworkouts that I love, but do not feel comfortable drinking them on a daily basis if they are filled with chemicals. On the otherhand, many natural preworkouts are so weak in their potency that I do not get much of a benefit from them in the gym. This natural preworkout from Tattle is the best of both worlds. First, it is completely pure thanks to being sweetened with natural monk fruit and colored with purple carrot juice. Then, the potency is on point - 6g of bloodflow-boosting citrulline, 2.5g of betaine, caffeine and huperzine for energy and focus, and the added benefit of nootropics, like Lions Mane & Rhodiola. Taste is great and my workouts have been excellent. Definitely recommended!

title: Pure Greens Powder
text: I like to add a scoop of greens powder into my protein smoothies each day and typically purchase a powder that contains a blend of different greens and other nutrients. Unfortunately, some products have a lot of fillers and only small amounts of the beneficial ingredients. This Organic Wheatgrass Juice Powder is nice because you know each scoop is getting 100% wheatgrass powder that is high quality and organic. You can smell and see the freshness. The taste is certainly mild and tolerable, especially if mixed with other ingredients. The cost is a bit high, but for the amount of servings in the bag, there is decent value. I have not had any digestion issues with it and have noticed improved energy levels overall.

title: Nice, Multifunctional TENS and EMS Unit
text: TENS units have some clinically proven benefits in terms of muscle recovery and pain relief so this Dual Channel unit that also had EMS capabilities definitely appealed to me. The package is compact and somewhat bland on the outside, but inside you will find a nice assortment of pads in addition to the wires and charger as well as a manual and carrying case. As other reviewers have stated, the manual is well-written and easy to understand which is great. I like the fact that it is a rechargeable lithium ion so you do not need to keep replacing batteries. The device is easy to set up and has several different modes. I must say, it is very powerful! Even at the lowest setting, it can be intense on certain muscles. For example, even the lowest power setting on my forearm causes my fingers to fully flex and contract. On larger muscle groups, the higher settings may be more suitable, but certainly start low and assess your tolerance. I enjoyed the different modes and think that each has its potential benefit depending on your goal of pain relief versus muscle strengthening versus massage and recovery.

title: Decent hair dryer, three attachments. Can adjust temp 50-90C in 1 degree increments
text:
This is a decent-quality hairdryer with an atypical feature: It has a LED screen and allows you to adjust the target heat temperature by 1-degree increments, between 50 and 90 degrees Celsius (122 to 194 degrees Fahrenheit). It's rated for 1875W power, which is close to the top end for a home hairdryer (professional models can go up to 3600W).

The controls on this hair dryer allow you to both adjust the target temperature, and to adjust the fan speed. You can also turn off the heating element with a short press of the power button. Note that when you do this and then return to heating mode, it forgets your previous heat temperature setting (annoying).

Also annoying is that temperature readout/setting can only be done in Celsius. There is no Farenheit mode. Weird for a US-marketed appliance.

It feels OK in the hand, although the handle could be a bit wider in my opinion. The airflow is strong.

In addition to the hairdryer, you get three attachments: A finger diffuser and two concentrators. I'm a middle-aged guy, so I'm only gonna use one of the concentrators. But if you have long thick hair, you'll probably want the finger diffuser. The attachments snap onto the end of the dryer, where they are held on by small plastic clips. This appears to be a fragile system that will almost certainly break over time. My recommendation would be to find a concentrator you are happy with and just leave that on.

The kit also includes a cheap travel bag and a cheap comb.

This hair dryer is only rated for US use (120V)--no surprise for a high wattage device.

Overall, it's a decent hairdryer. The LED display and ability to fine-tune the target temperature is interesting--although I wish they'd included the ability to use Fahrenheit. The way the attachments attach to the dryer--small plastic pins that are in the hot airflow stream--looks fragile and may not hold up.

title: Decent shave. Attachments are a mixed bag. 4D model LK-5802
text:
Let me note upfront that I don't have a bald head, and I won't be testing this for bald head shaving. I'm testing it as a shaver for the face.

Like many of you who are reading this, I've used rotary blade cordless shavers for decades--mostly Norelco. These always feature three floating heads. I've always thought there must be something magical about three heads because that's what everyone presents :-)

Well, here we have six heads. Six heads must be better than three, right? I have to say that I wasn't convinced. I figured there must be a reason that the big names don't use a larger number of heads. And after trying this shaver, I think I know the answer.

The answer isn't the quality of the shave. In fact, I was impressed at how well this shaver cleared the stubble on my face at the end of the day. It was comfortable and managed to navigate the nooks and crannies of my face and neck as well as my trusty Norelco. But--and this is huge--the ergonomics of the shaving heads leave something to desire. First off, there's very little reservoir under the cutting heads for shaved hair (see photos). This means you'll need/want to wash the head (it's water immersible) after each shave. Second, the middle head of the five doesn't pop up. To remove it, you have to twist it off. It's a bit of a pain--and there's even less room under this head for hair than any of the others.

The third issue I have with the cutting heads--and this is huge--is that there's no obvious way to replace them without simply replacing the entire shaving head assembly. This can get costly--especially since my experience with these types of shavers is that the heads start to get dull reasonably quickly.

In the kit you get:

** Six head cordless shaver with LCD readout of charge remaining and reminders to clean heads and when power is low.
** IPX5 water-resistant
** Can be put in soft lockout mode by holding power button--good for travel
** Nose hair trimmer attachment
** Hair clipper attachment
** Two face cleaning attachments
** Protective packing guard for the shaver assembly
** Charging cable (requires USB-A power source)

The non-shaver attachments are a mixed bag. On the plus side, the nose hair trimmer works very well. This is in contrast with the nose hair trimmers that come with clippers, which are worthless. The nose hair clipper here works as well as the dedicated nose hair clippers I've used.On the minus side, the hair clipper is mediocre--it operates at a low speed and struggles with any amount of hair. It's not very useful. The face cleaner attachments are probably OK, but I can't imagine using them.

On the whole, I'd consider this a decent little kit useful for shaving your face and for nose hair removal. The remaining attachments are, in my opinion, not very useful. While it does a good job of shaving out of the box, I worry that the shaving heads will get dull over time, and there's no clear replacement path.

Pros:
** 6 head shaver does a good job on the face
** Nose hair clipper works well
** Li-Ion battery: 700mAh, 2 hours charge for 90 minutes run time
** IPX5 water-resistant

Cons:
** Hair trimmer doesn't work well
** Face cleaning attachments not very significant
** Shaver doesn't provide much room for hair and will need to be cleaned after each shave
** Middle head of shaver attachment difficult to remove for cleaning
** Sixth (central) head in shaver assembly does not float like outer heads
** Charge port on shaver is not USB-C

Note that this same shaver is under various names on Amazon. Shop around for price.

The same manufacturer that makes this kit also makes shavers with 5 and 7 heads. (And the attachments, including the shaver heads, for the two models are interchangeable). I did not find that adding a sixth head (as here) added much value in terms of how quickly or well the shaver was able to shave my face. And, since the motor in the 5,6,7 head models appears to be similar, a sixth head means a bit less power to each of the heads.

title: 7 head shaver. IPX7 Waterproof. Decent feel in the hand. Attachments of varying value
text:
First off, I'm going to review this for face/beard shaving. I don't have a bald head (yet, anyway), so that isn't my focus.

I have used rotary floating blade shavers for decades (usually Norelco). They work best on my face, especially for the neck region. These shavers have always featured three heads.

Well, here we have seven heads. Seven heads!! I have used very similar shavers to this one with five and six-head shaver attachments. This is one more. The question is: Why do the high-quality venerable brands stick to three heads, and these shavers use so many more?

The answer isn't quality of shave. In fact, I was impressed at how well this shaver cleared the stubble on my face at the end of the day. It was comfortable, and managed to navigate the nooks and crannies of my face and neck as well as my low-end Norelco (if not better). But it's no match--not even remotely close--to my top-of-the-line Norelco (though that costs about 4x as much, so that's probably not a fair comparison). But--and this is huge--the ergonomics of the shaving heads leave something to desire. First off, there's very little reservoir under the cutting heads for shaved hair (see photos). This means you'll need/want to wash the head (it's water immersible) after each shave. Second, the middle head of the seven doesn't pop up. To remove it, you have to twist it off. It's a bit of a pain--and there's even less room under this head for hair than any of the others.

The third issue I have with the cutting heads is that there's no obvious way to replace them without simply replacing the entire shaving head assembly. Based on my experience with other shavers quite similar to this, expect the blades to get dull after a bit of use, and factor in the cost of an entire replacement head unit when they do.

In terms of seven vs six vs five heads? Well, the motors in these shavers are effectively the same. So if you have seven heads, the amount of power you provide to each head is less than it is in a five head design. That's going to affect the maximum speed and also the ability to easily tackle heavy stubble. Given that I don't sense a huge amount of improvement with seven vs five (or six) heads, I'd be inclined to veer towards fewer heads.

In general, I'd suggest that you can interchange the 7/6/5 head assemblies if you want to get a replacement.

In the kit you get:

Seven head cordless shaver with LCD readout of charge remaining and integrated activation lock
IPX7 Waterproof
Nose hair trimmer attachment
Hair clipper attachment
Two face cleaning attachments
Three length guides for the hair clipper attachment
Charging cable (requires USB-A power source; USB-C port on shaver means you can use cables you already own).
Small cleaning brush

Shave is controlled via a simple on/off button. You can lock the shaver by holding the button for 3 seconds (unlocking is accomplished by holding for 3 seconds, as well). This is convenient for travel.

The non-shaver attachments are a mixed bag. On the plus side, the nose hair trimmer works very well. This is in contrast with the nose hair trimmers that come with clippers, which are worthless. The nose hair clipper here works as well as the dedicated nose hair clippers I've used. On the minus side, the hair clipper is quite mediocre--it operates at a low speed and struggles with any amount of hair. It's about as good/useful as the clipper that's integrated into some shaver handles. Those can clip a bit of trim hair, but they are an exercise in frustration for any serious hair removal. Same here. The face cleaner attachments are probably OK, but I can't imagine using them.

On the whole, I'd consider this a decent little kit useful for shaving your face and for nose hair removal. The remaining attachments are, in my opinion, not very useful. While it does a good job of shaving out of the box, my experience is that the heads get dull somewhat quickly, and you need to buy a not-inexpensive replacement assembly. Also, cleaning the assembly is a nuisance.

Pros:
** IPX7 waterproof
** 7 head shaver does a good job on face
** Nose hair clipper works well
** Comfortable in your hand
** Li-Ion battery: 1.5 hours charge for 90 minutes run time
** Attractive styling
** Can lock the power button for travel

Cons:
** Hair trimmer has limited usefulness
** Face cleaning attachments not very significant
** Shaver head assembly doesn't provide much room for hair and will need to be cleaned after each shave
** Middle head of shaver attachment difficult to remove for cleaning
** Must replace entire shaving head unit when one/more blades get dull
** 7th (middle) head in shaver assembly does not float like outer heads

Note that there is a dizzying number of similar 5/6/7 head shavers sold on Amazon. As far as I can tell, having reviewed many of them, they are all made by a handful of companies and work pretty much equivalently well. The snap-in attachments even work across different models and brands. There are variances in features like level of waterproof and how the power switch works (and the body shape), but the function is pretty similar. So shop around for price.

title: Interesting kit includes both irrigation and toothbrush functionality. Non-standard brush head
text:
I was intrigued by this kit, which promises to be “portable” while also offering the unusual combination of both oral irrigation (Waterpik type function) and brush mode.

What you get in the kit is a rechargeable handle, two irrigator heads, a toothbrush head, and a periodontal probe, a short charging cable, and a rubber hose that connects the handle to a water supply for irrigator mode. There’s also a cheap soft-sided carry bag.

The function of the handle changes depending on whether a toothbrush head is attached or an irrigator is attached. For toothbrush mode, you have Low and High settings. For irrigation, you have a a few different settings (Normal, Soft, Pulse and DIY).

The handle is pretty chunky, but no more so than a low end Sonicare toothbrush.

What I liked:
** Both toothbrush and irrigator modes
** Toothbrush mode works fine
** Irrigator tools are small and can be packed for travel

What could be better:
** For irrigator mode, you need to run the rubber hose to a glass of water. The hose isn’t that long, and the first time I tried it, I accidentally pulled the glass to the ground.
** The handle is a bit too clunky to be attractive as a portable toothbrush
** The toothbrush head uses a non-standard connection to the handle, and it isn’t clear where you will get replacements.

I didn’t try the periodontal probe. I mentioned it to my dental hygienist, and her response was: “Put something like that, vibrating rapidly, near your teeth? You’d be crazy! But I’m sure the dentist will like the extra business when you chip a tooth or damage your gums…”

On the whole, I’d say that if having a portable version of an irrigator is what you’re looking for, this may fill the bill. But if the brush is your main interest, look elsewhere—the handle is chunkier than I’d like, and the brush heads are non-standard.

title: Decent inexpensive replacement heads, but not as good as genuine Philips heads
text:
If you're reading this, then you know that Philips uses the razor model for their toothbrushes: Sell the body for a decent price, then charge like crazy for the replacement heads.

I've been around this block a few times, and I've tried other non-Philips replacement heads before--usually to great disappointment. But I like to save money, so I keep trying.

These brush heads are far better than some I've tried. I mean, at least they are attempting to create a brush head that looks like the real thing. The brush head is about the same size as the genuine article (see photos). And it connects stably to the toothbrush itself.

In terms of feel, these feel a bit less soft than the genuine replacement brushes, but the difference isn't dramatic.

One key difference between these heads and genuine Philips is that Philips includes a metal ring at the base of the head. These don't (and most cheap heads don't--not sure if that's for price or patent reasons).

What I like a lot about these is that each comes with its own plastic brush cover, suitable for travel.

In the end, these are OK for the price. They aren't perfect replacements, but certainly good enough and far cheaper.

title: Produces strong red light at useful wavelegths
text:
The whole field of home-based red light therapy is one that is continually debated. Useful or not? There are plenty of studies to suggest both answers. Still, there are enough reasonably well carried out studies that demonstrate some red light / beneficial effect, photobiomodulation, that a lot of people have tried it--and many swear by it.

The development of high-powered, low-cost LED light sources has made it possible to develop red light therapy devices that are small and relatively inexpensive (compared to the cost of a useful device just a few years ago). This particular device promises a combination of 660 and 850nm red light in something the same size as a regular flashlight.

While I can't attest to any amazing abilities of red light therapy in general, I can affirm that this device is capable of generating a very very bright red light, providing irradiance of 200 mW/cm^2 at at start of the external beam. (See photos).

In the kit you get:

** Red light therapy flashlight, produces light at 660nm and 850nm in a 2-to-1 ratio
** 1 x 18650 Li-Ion battery , 2600 mAH
** Cheap tripod with a plastic adapter to hold the flashlight
** Small travel bag
** Charging cable
** Cheap sunglasses

To turn the light on, you just push the button at the end of the device. Push it again to turn it off. It will automatically turn itself off after 10 minutes.

I am not sure I can attest to the value of red light therapy, but if you're a red light believer, this kit offers a way to bring that technology home for a reasonable price.

title: IPX7 Waterproof combination body clipper and vaccum -- a novel solution to hair everywhere
text:
There is a huge number of options for hair trimmers on Amazon, some marketed specifically as body hair trimmers. But, honestly, any trimmer can be used as a body hair trimmer as long as it is maneuverable enough. That includes all the T-Blade trimmers and smaller head standard clippers.

That said, if you're trimming body hair, life gets a lot easier if the trimmer is waterproof (so you can use it in the shower). Because trimming somewhere else inevitably results in a ton of hair getting everywhere.

Well, until now. Someone decided to combine a medium-sized clipper with a small vacuum. The idea is that the vacuum will pull in the hair as it's cut. So the hair winds up in the device, not on your sink or floor. It's not a bad idea.

In practice? I found that this clipper DEFINITELY pulled in most of the hair when I used it. But it's not the world's most powerful vacuum, and some still wound up on the sink (or floor). So, in the end, this will help keep things cleaner, but you'll still want to do some cleanup.

In terms of functionality, you have one speed (on/off) and two speeds for the fan (low and high). Low seemed worthless--you'll definitely want to run it on high. As I mentioned, this is a lower power fan and you'll want all the power you can get.

In the package you get:

** Clipper/vacuum device with superior quality ceramic cutting blade
** Three clipper length guides (two of which are double-sided)
** A cleaning brush
** A USB charging cable (requires USB-A connection; connection on clipper is USB-C so you can use any USB-C charging cable you have)
** Cheap body sponge
** Cheap plastic hair cutting bib

Honestly, I am of two minds about this. While the vacuum is nice, it doesn't catch all the hair. As a result, I would still be more inclined to step into the shower and run the clipper (where the stray hair can be washed down the drain). But if you are the kind of person who runs the clipper outside of the shower, even though the vacuum does not catch all the hair, it catches enough to reduce the clipped hair mess. So this might be the extra cost over a standard clipper.

title: Basic IPL hair remover works well. FIDAC Model T2. A bit pricy for the basic functionality
text:
The latest craze in hair removal is IPL: Intense Pulsed Light. Owing to improved light technology, handheld devices that can provide the requisite intensity light to perform IPL at home and at an affordable price are now available.

I've tried a number of these IPL (Intense Pulsed Light) devices for hair removal. Compared to the others I've tried, this is one of the more expensive ones and doesn't seem to offer much in the way of differentiating functionality. As is typical, you get a IPL hair removal tool rated to around a million flashes. This one has a LCD counter of the number of flashes and the indicator of the power setting (1-5).

Operation is pretty trivial: You plug in the power supply, (the hair removal tool is NOT battery operated; you must have it plugged in), you choose the power level (five settings, chosen by rapidly pushing the bottom of the power button)) and then you aim it at a body area with hair you'd like to remove. It is recommended that your body is freshly cleaned and that the hair be shaved before starting. You can choose either on-demand flashing (via the button in the middle of the body) or else automatic flashing when skin contact is detected. Switching between the modes is accomplished by a long press of the flash activation button. The mode is indicated by a symbol in the middle of the screen.

The light is extremely powerful and could damage your eyes with continued direct exposure. Therefore, you should never look directly into the light and a cheap pair of folding protective eyeglasses are included in the box.

The light is triggered by a touch-sensitive metal area in the front of the device. Using very slow-motion photography, I was able to capture a snapshot of the light (see photos). But the light duration is extremely short.

You run the tool over the area where you want to remove hair, and make sure you exposure all the hair follicles in that region. You will not see any immediate results. The light signals your hair to stop growing, but it requires multiple treatments over several weeks before you will be expected to see results. Eventually, you should find a substantial reduction in the hair in the treated areas.

In the box, you get:

** IPL tool
** Power adapter
** Cheap pair sunglasses
** Inexpensive disposible shaver
** Instructions

This device only offers one mode: Hair removal. Other IPL devices offer other modes (skin rejuvenation and acne treatment). Whether that's a loss depends on whether you believe those other modes really work anyhow. The jury is out. Another thing you don't get with this tool is any attachments that can make it easier to address certain body areas. Some IPL removal tools include these. The actual value of such tools is subject to debate and the fundamental functionality (which is a flash of high-intensity light) does not change.

Overall, the device does what it promises to do. It's worth noting, though, that for a basic functionality IPL device, this one is priced higher than many. It's probably worth shopping around and comparing.

Pros:

** Hair removal IPL, simple to use
** LCD readout of number of flashes left and power level. Also indicates the mode (automatic, manual)
** Rated for 999,999 pulses (longer than you'd ever use it)

Cons:

** Somewhat expensive relative to other devices that only do hair removal IPL
** I prefer gun-shaped IPL tools to those, like this one, which are oblong

title: 7 head shaver. IPX6 waterproof. Model LK-6808. Unusual touch switch is not my favorite
text:
First off, I'm going to review this for face/beard shaving. I don't have a bald head (yet, anyway), so that isn't my focus.

I have used rotary floating blade shavers for decades (usually Norelco). They work best on my face, especially for the neck region. These shavers have always featured three heads.

Well, here we have seven heads. Seven heads!! I have used very similar shavers to this one with five and six-head shaver attachments. This is one more. The question is: Why do the high-quality venerable brands stick to three heads, and these shavers use so many more?

The answer isn't quality of shave. In fact, I was impressed at how well this shaver cleared the stubble on my face at the end of the day. It was comfortable, and managed to navigate the nooks and crannies of my face and neck as well as my low-end Norelco (if not better). But it's no match--not even remotely close--to my top-of-the-line Norelco (though that costs about 4x as much, so that's probably not a fair comparison). But--and this is huge--the ergonomics of the shaving heads leave something to desire. First off, there's very little reservoir under the cutting heads for shaved hair (see photos). This means you'll need/want to wash the head (it's water immersible) after each shave. Second, the middle head of the seven doesn't pop up. To remove it, you have to twist it off. It's a bit of a pain--and there's even less room under this head for hair than any of the others.

The third issue I have with the cutting heads is that there's no obvious way to replace them without simply replacing the entire shaving head assembly. Based on my experience with other shavers quite similar to this, expect the blades to get dull after a bit of use, and factor in the cost of an entire replacement head unit when they do.

In terms of seven vs six vs five heads? Well, the motors in these shavers are effectively the same. So if you have seven heads, the amount of power you provide to each head is less than it is in a five head design. That's going to affect the maximum speed and also the ability to easily tackle heavy stubble. Given that I don't sense a huge amount of improvement with seven vs five (or six) heads, I'd be inclined to veer towards fewer heads.

In general, I'd suggest that you can interchange the 7/6/5 head assemblies if you want to get a replacement.

In the kit you get:

Seven head cordless shaver with LCD readout of charge remaining and touch activation
Nose hair trimmer attachment
Hair clipper attachment
Shaver attachment
Two face cleaning attachments
Three length guides for the hair clipper attachment
Charging cable (requires USB-A power source).
Small cleaning brush

You turn this particular shaver on/off in a very unusual way. To turn it on, you hold both of the ribbed sides with your fingers. It turns on. If you take your fingers off the sides, it turns off. There is no way to keep it on without your fingers on the sides. I didn't find this very appealing and don't see the advantage over a clipper with a standard on/off switch. I also found myself occasionally accidentally turning it off when I was using it.

The non-shaver attachments are a mixed bag. On the plus side, the nose hair trimmer works very well. This is in contrast with the nose hair trimmers that come with clippers, which are worthless. The nose hair clipper here works as well as the dedicated nose hair clippers I've used. On the minus side, the hair clipper is quite mediocre--it operates at a low speed and struggles with any amount of hair. It's about as good/useful as the clipper that's integrated into some shaver handles. Those can clip a bit of trim hair, but they are an exercise in frustration for any serious hair removal. Same here. The face cleaner attachments are probably OK, but I can't imagine using them.

On the whole, I'd consider this a decent little kit useful for shaving your face and for nose hair removal. The remaining attachments are, in my opinion, not very useful. While it does a good job of shaving out of the box, my experience is that the heads get dull somewhat quickly, and you need to buy a not-inexpensive replacement assembly. Also, cleaning the assembly is a nuisance.

Pros:
** 7 head shaver does a good job on face
** Nose hair clipper works well
** Acceptably comfortable in your hand
** Li-Ion battery: 2 hours charge for 90 minutes run time

Cons:
** The odd system for turning on/off the shaver is not ideal
** Hair trimmer has limited usefulness
** Face cleaning attachments not very significant
** Shaver head assembly doesn't provide much room for hair and will need to be cleaned after each shave
** Middle head of shaver attachment difficult to remove for cleaning
** Must replace entire shaving head unit when one/more blades get dull
** 7th head in shaver assembly does not float like outer heads

Note that there is a dizzying number of similar 5/6/7 head shavers sold on Amazon. As far as I can tell, having reviewed many of them, they are all made by a handful of companies and work pretty much equivalently well. The snap-in attachments even work across different models and brands. So shop around for price.

To be honest, this shaver would not be my first choice, because of the weird on/off system that requires touching the two ribbed sides. Your mileage may vary.

title: Suttik T-Blade Clipper Model JM-700AL. Zero-gapped, works well. Kit has all the basics.
text:
There is a boatload of so-called T-Blade clippers available on Amazon. The secret is that a very large fraction of these is made by a handful of manufacturers. Some carry different names in the listing, but they are mostly just a small number of different models with moderate cosmetic differences.

The good news is that they are mostly quite decent. They feature 0-gapped heads (or at least close to it), 600 mAh batteries, a cutting head that can be rinsed in water to clean (although you should not submerge the body of the clipper), and a small number of cheap length guides you can snap on.

The only significant differences among most of these different listings are:

1) The charge level readout. The best ones provide an LCD display of the percentage charge left. The cheap ones do not.
2) Some provide a collar that can protect the shaft going to the T-blade. This can either be a plastic collar that snaps on, or, in some cases, an extension of the metal body around that area (hiding the shaft)
3) A ceramic cutting blade. This is unusual, but a few offer a premium ceramic cutting blade
4) The pattern/design of the body

That's pretty much it. Any descriptions or reviews that try to suggest other differences are usually mistaken.

This particular set of clippers is made by Suttik (one of the common brands), and comes in a Suttik-labeled retail box. The model is JM-700AL.

Specifics of this kit:

** Rechargeable cordless T-Blade clippers
** Zero gapped cutting head (cuts close)
** Three lengths of optional length guards
** Plastic collar ring to protect the rotating shaft
** Charging cable
** Cleaning brush
** Clipper oil
** LCD readout on clipper provides charge status, but not oil reminder (not a big loss)
** Metal handle
** Ornate pattern on the handle
** IPX4 water resistance (can be cleaned under the tap, but do not submerge)
** 1500 mAh rechargeable battery (per listing)
** Retail box suitable for gifting

Common items NOT included in this kit:
None. Pretty much a standard "complete" T-blade kit.

Clipper operation is trivial: There's an on/off on the bottom near the top of the handle. That's it. The clippers work well. The clipper feels comfortable in the hand.

Personally, I find the design of the handle a bit juvenile--it's not my taste. But, to me, that's a trivial issue. A 1500 mAh battery in a T-blade clipper is on the large side.

As mentioned, there are a number of sellers selling this same Suttik JM-700AL (or similar) clipper under various listing brand names. This is a good option for this type of clipper but shop around for the best price, as they can fluctuate pretty drastically depending on the listing. A typical price for this clipper would be in the range of thirty dollars.

title: Decent tasting low calorie (15 cals/glass) electrolyte+caffeine drink; contains sucralose
text:
I drink a lot of fluids during the workday, and "just water" gets really boring, really fast. I could go with all coffee, but that also gets old after a while. So I figured I'd give these Quench "Island Ice Hydrating Eletrolyte Rip Sticks" a chance.

I filled a glass with 8oz of cold water (and some ice) and stirred in one packet. The mix creates a cloudy yellow/white drink. It tastes fine--reasonably dissolved, not grainy.

The taste is good--strong and sweet. The flavor comes from the prickly pair, but if you've nevr had one of those, here it's pretty similar to pineapple. There's caffeine in these, and I did notice a little bit of a caffeine jolt in the mid-afternoon, but not like a stiff cup of coffee.

Now, at 15 calories per glass, I am not sure what they're talking about with respect to "replenish drained energy". But, honestly, at this stage in my life, I don't need caloric energy replenishment as much as I need a good-tasting drink that is low cal and gives me just a bit of a mid-afternoon bump. These seem to do the trick.

Note that in the fine print, the note that these contain sucralose, along with fructose, guar gum, and silicon dioxide. I'm OK with all that, and it does taste good to me. But if you're averse to sucralose, be aware.

I got these in 09/21, and the best-before date on the packets is 01/22.

title: Nice Smell. Expensive.
text:
These have a nice smell, but are kind of expensive.

These shower steamers smell good. They don't last very long if you put them on the shower floor, but that's expected. These steamers work really well. No issues with how well they work honestly.

My only issue is that you're getting 6 for $13.49. That's about $2.24 a piece. That's kind of pricey.

Overall, a nice set if you don't mind the higher price.

title: These Work to Perfection.
text:
My current wool dryer balls are getting a bit long in the tooth but have served us well. These wool dryer balls stepped right in and picked up where the old ones left off. No complaints whatsoever!

If you have never tried wool dryer balls, then you need to. I stopped using dryer sheets a long time ago when I found out all they do is coat your clothes with chemicals. I highly recommend these dryer balls.

title: Small Facial Scrubber and Massager All in One.
text:
A unique and small little vibrating brush, perfect for travel.

This facial massager and scrubber is about the size of your palm, give or take. The scrubber part of this is soft and soap lathers quite well. The facial massager part is nice and the little balls roll well. The balls don't vibrate, the device itself does. That being said, it's an average massager that is still nice to use. The main feature of this brush is the cleansing brush part.

Overall, this is a nice scrubber. It took a minute to figure out the charger. I was expecting a cover that flipped up, so I was trying to pry it up. Well, all you have to do is just push the charger into the hole, that simple. There are no instructions so there's a little learning curve, but this is pretty straight forward to use. It's perfect for travel or camping, which is what I'm using it for.

title: Sturdy Boxes. Finicky Closure.
text:
We got these boxes for gifts at Christmas time. They are nice and sturdy so they will hold up well. I like that the boxes are white so you can decorate them as you wish. Just be aware, these are smaller boxes for jewelry etc.

My only complaint is the magnetic closure, it's a bit finicky. You have to mess with it, and press a bit hard to get it to close.

That issue aside, these are quality boxes. I just wish the closure was a little easier to use.

title: Fast Drying But Noisy
text:
This is a quality built hair dryer. It drys your hair real well and I like how you can change the temperature. It comes with a few attachments, a brush, and a carrying bag.

The negative, it is loud! You definitely know you used this hair dryer because your ears suffer for a little while afterwords. I also got an attachment that had some teeth missing and ready to come off, seen in the picture. The buttons for adjusting temperature are in a horrible spot too. It is really easy to press them when using because they are placed right where your hand needs to be.

This is a perfect size for traveling just do not use it when people are sleeping, everyone will wake up when you fire this bad boy up. It does what it is suppose to do really well, just at a higher decibel level than most hair dryers.

title: Focus and energy boost without the crash
text:
I admit that I'm a caffeine junkie and most energy drinks in our fridge are packed with sugar and the crashes are absolutely horrid. This is definitely an amazing morning booster without the sugar crashes!
These being sugar free, they are still sweet without that syrupy flavor of artificial sweeteners.
Most of the energy drinks I've tried usually contain substances that dehydrate you, mainly sugar but not these!
Overall these give a substantial boost of energy while increasing my mental clarity/focus.

title: Pure shimmer
text:
[[VIDEOID:10867f21ca0df6f6c8e80b20f72b7091]] These bath bombs have a strong but not overpowered scent.
Each bath bombs is labeled with the scent and each one has a metallic shimmer.
The bath bombs dissolved slowly and tinted the water without staining the tub.

title: Visible improvements!
text:
[[VIDEOID:6dd9eda293e76eb45c395848d44d6fb4]] I love the cordless design which makes this handheld device portable!
It is comfortable to hold, easy to use with one touch clicks to switch operations.
After using this approximate 5x a week I noticed vsible improvement in as few as 4/5 weeks. The battery life is very impressive.
My favorite use is to combine this with my morning or night serums. Definitely impressed and happy with the results thus far!

title: versatility of this 2 in 1
text:
I've used this quite a bit this week and I can say I really enjoy the versatility of this 2 in 1.
If you’re like me, you probably have a drawer full of hair tools and products, I was able to declutter a bit with this versatile gadget. Ive noticed incredibly even heating within fifteen seconds. While this isn't the best straightener I've used it is good value for the price.

title: Elongated design
text:
Decent.
Comes with everything needed.
Easy charging.
Heats up decently fast just doesn't work quite well for my eyeshape. I have a few other heated eyelash curlers but they are battery powered whixh is sort of a pain and they take longer to heat up but the curve of those compared to this one makes it easier and more efficient for my lashes.

title: Better than manual callus remover
text:
It works better than manual file or stone. It works faster and you have more control as you don't have to scrub and position at the same time.
The grinding rollers come in 3 different coarseness but I find that only the fine roller is needed as you really should not remove too much callus at once as you can damage the skin.

It comes with USB-A to micro-USB cord. It does not come with a charger.

Pros: It is effective. Performance is same as similar looking other brands. Sturdily built.

Cons (especially compared to my other unit):
1. It turns on at full speed first. The button has to be pressed to go half-speed. It should start at half-speed. Really don't need full speed anyway.
2. The switch is too easy to turn on accidentally. Often it came on while changing the roller -- ouch! Not good for packing with travel stuff.
3. Kind of big. I have another one which is smaller and easier to handle.

Note:
One of the roller was defective and would only spin idly because the spindle was too short to engage the motor. See in the photo.

Overall, it works. There are others with better usability for a bit more, though.

title: Natural way to purify air
text:
It is just bags of activated charcoal which is an effective way to purify air naturally. I think these bags look better than in photos. The 2 bags with buttons are kind of cute.
I was surprised these bags came thrown in the Amazon shipping bag without its own packaging and without instruction or information sheet. Perhaps this was a returned item, but the bags smelled clean and immediately had the effect of deodorizing the air.
The 2 tubular bags are suitable for inserting into shoes. I am using the rest in small clothe and towel closets and they are working well.

The web page says to rejuvenate by pacing the bag outside in the sun once a month for at least two hours. I am not sure how that is going to work in the winter time and during rainy period. Well, the bags are reasonably priced so I could buy more and rejuvenate when possible. I guess it also depends on how bad the air is. We will see, but it works well for now.

title: Low-cost way to touch-up
text:
I have been using magic markers to touch-up wood scratches, but it is expensive to buy a large color set and most colors are not applicable. This repair kit has colors that match better for most wood.
The pens work well, especially on fake printed wood like those on cheap furniture. It fools the eye and hides flaws amazingly well.

The crayons are used for deep scratches. Unfortunately the crayons are soft and not for permanent repair. They also melt in the sun, so not for things near the window. What they really need to provide is some kind of putty instead that can harden permanently. Then the filled location can be color matched using their pens. This crayon stuff is not good when it smears.

title: Works well, but ...
text:
Hydrogen Peroxide is a good way to clean without using long lasting chemical residue. It has a slight fresh fragrance which dissipates quickly. I would rather buy these things by the gallon and refill spray bottles to reduce plastic waste. It cost more to buy by mail because of shipping and handling (double wrapping in plastic to prevent leak, etc). Coming in spray bottle is convenient, though.

I have been using hypochlorous acid, instead, for most of my cleaning. That seems to work faster and more effective for me.

title: Works well despite low quality
text:
Bad uneven stitching and low-quality material may be seen in the photos and it looks cheap. Not sure how long the item can last after repeated washing. Having said that, the product does work well in cleaning. Any microfiber cloth does a good job cleaning. However, this product does several things better:
First, this microfiber has a finer weave which is better for glass polishing as opposed to coarser one for dusting.
Second, the firm base puts even pressure against surface which makes for even cleaning. Third, the palm straps allows you to reach tight areas such as car windshield bottom.
So, this works pretty well for cleaning glass and other hard flat surface. I would recommend it despite its low quality and relatively high price for a low-cost production item.

title: Good, but weak packaging
text:
I really like the idea of biodegradable drinking straws because plastic ones are currently not recyclable.
They are strong as plastic ones and do not soften for hours even though they are made of paper.
As paper they do not have sharp ends like plastic ones, so they are physically safer.

It is not so good for drinking plain water at room temperature because you can slightly taste the starch from the paper. You won't notice it if water is flavored or cold/hot.

What is not good is the packaging. Safety seals were broken on both ends upon receipt. They are not taking the shipping and handling well. At first I was not sure if someone had repackaged the straws. The seller is excellent and will replace the damaged goods, but that does not insure you will get a good one because my second one came with good seals but with a broken box with straws exposed. I would not go through this hassle until they improve packaging.

title: Pretty, Nice Sound, Very Limited Selections
text: This Orein Assoupi 3-in-1 Sleep Sound Machine has three different functions. With the color changing lights, it functions as a pretty little lamp. It also functions as a sound machine. Its third function is a a bluetooth speaker. I'll discuss them in turn. The power button, light button and three volume controls ( - , pause/play, and + ) are all located on the front of the machine. The sound button and the timer button are located on the bottom of the machine. LAMP FUNCTION: As a lamp, there are five programs, accessed in sequence by pushing the light button on the far right of the front of the lamp. The programs are: 1) fast color change, 2) move to the beat, 3) slow fade color transition, 4) night light, and 5) lights off. Though there are many light colors, you cannot stop on any particular color but instead can only see either a fast or a slow continuous rotation through them all. The exception is #4, the night light, which is only available golden yellow. As a stand alone light, my favorite setting is 3, the slow fade color transition. It is so peaceful to watch, and is absolutely mesmerizing to me, especially when the house is dark. Setting 2 works best connected to bluetooth, but will also change colors and intensities to the sound machine selections, and it's definitely cool to watch on the rain/thunderstorm setting. SOUND MACHINE FUNCTION: There are five sound programs that are accessible by using the controls on the bottom of the speaker. The programs are 1) rain, 2) fire, 3) meditation, 4) fan, 5) ocean, 6) sound off. They have to be accessed in order. The fire program doesn't sound anything like a crackling fire to me, it sounds like very high pitched tinkling. I didn't like this one at all, although I would have liked it if it had actually sounded like fire. The meditation program is a very soothing new age kind of sound that I like a lot, and I also like the rain which includes lots of thunder, and the ocean. I'm not much for white noise, but the fan would be pleasing to those who are. I thought the sound was amazingly clear and sharp for such a tiny little machine. Sound can be played continuously, or the timer button on the bottom of the machine can be pushed to choose an auto-off of 30, 60, or 90 minutes. BLUETOOTH SPEAKER: It was amazingly easy to connect bluetooth, and I tried it on a number of different types of music using my iPod as the music source. I was pleased with how this little speaker sounded with each music selection I played. While this is obviously not going to match the high fidelity sound of my expensive home sound system, I feel it performed quite well. Note: if the power button is held for two seconds and the blinking blue light is on, indicating the speaker is ready to pair to bluetooth, the speaker will automatically shut down after two minutes if it is not paired with bluetooth. If I change my mind about connecting to bluetooth after the blue light is flashing, I can just press the power button rapidly and the blinking blue light will go away and I will return to normal speaker mode. Also, if the speaker is paired to bluetooth and is paused for 15 minutes or more, the speaker will automatically shut down. I find that the more I use this little sound machine, the more I like it, and am content with its limitations. The slowly fading lights and a soft mediation program in the background with this little machine sitting on the corner of my computer desk at home is just perfect for me, and I am glad I ordered this machine.

title: Breakthrough Chemical Odor that Was Very Potent
text: I love shower steamers, and it's rare for me to find some I don't care for. Unfortunately, these shower are definitely not ones I like. Both the menthol & eucalyptus and the lavender scents have an additional scent that has a very strong chemical smell almost like some sort of industrial solvent. It totally overpowers the smell of both the menthol & eucalyptus and the lavender shower steamers. The fumes were not only unpleasant, they actually started to give me a headache each time. I don't know if I just got a bad batch of these or what, but after trying one of each scent on different days and having the same thing happen each time, I'm not about to try any more. These six shower steamers come wrapped in shiny foil, three eucalyptus (green) and three lavender (purple). They lie on a bed of lavender filler paper, and there is a mesh lavender drawstring bag with an adhesive-backed hook to hang the bag on. The cover of the box is pretty and has a printed lavender ribbon with a bow on it. Two of the sides say "Make your bathroom different!". This has all the right stuff to make a beautiful gift, but the intense, unpleasant scent of these steamers make them something I don't even want to finish using for myself, much less gift to anyone else. I"m giving them a three star for presentation and the benefit of the doubt, based on other reviews, that the box I got is the exception and not the rule.

title: Very Pleasant Vanilla Scent
text: This 3.3 fl oz (100 ml) bottle of Natures Philosophy vanilla essential oil smells absolutely wonderful. The glass amber bottle and the glass eyedropper were packaged well to prevent breakage or leakage, and arrived totally undamaged. There is also a plastic Euro dropper included as an option to the glass eyedropper. This vanilla scent fills my house nicely when added to my diffuser, and should last for quite some time. The enticing scent of vanilla never fails to raise my spirits and lighten my mood, and I am pleased to have such a large bottle to use. I consider this vanilla oil a good value and also very giftable.

title: Works Great, Easy to Use
text: This Jazznap Electric Callus Remover Kit comes with the callus remover, three heads (coarse, medium, and fine), a USB charging cord, and an instruction manual. The white head is the coarse one, the dark black is the medium one, and the lighter black is the fine one. Each works well, and I can visibly see the dust as my callus on my heel is being smoothly ground down. This callus remover arrives already charged, so I was able to test it immediately, which was great. To attach a head, simply pop it into place. There is a sliding switch on the left side of the machine that will release the head when the switch is pushed down. I spend as much time as possible either barefoot or in flip flops, so dry, callused heels are a constant with me. This machine totally resolves that problem. This Jazznap foot callus remover kit currently sells for $25.99. I consider it a very useful item, and I am thrilled to have it.

title: Some good, some not so good
text:
I'm not going to provide a description of the kit, you can read the product information page for that. I'm going to give my opinion on each of the items.
The good:
1. This is a complete system. Everything you need is provided in the kit.
2. The instruction manual is the best I've ever seen with a TENS/EMS unit. Well written and thorough.
3. Also has a "quick start" guide that goes over the basics so you can get up and running quickly.
4. Battery operated. Unit uses 3 AAA batteries. No cords, no recharging, goes anywhere just take extra batteries.
5. "Large" pads are unique. Set of two 3.5' by 5" pads, great for larger muscle groups like lower back.

The "not so good":
1. The price. Current price of $72 is definitely on the high end. Kit is nice but $72, no.
2. Lack of extra pads. Using both channels, there is one set of pads for both the large and small pads. At $72 there should be extra pads. High quality pads are usually good for a max of 10 uses, usually less. iReliev's replacement pad kit, with 8 small and 4 large electrode pads, costs approx $20.
3. iReliev pads use a "pin" type connector. My experience is that pin connectors tend to come loose more easily than "snap" connectors. If one comes loose and touches your skin, it hurts.
Bottom line. I really wanted to give this kit a 5-star rating. As is I was wavering between a 3 or 4 star rating. I was expecting more based on the price. Although good, it's not $72 worth of good. I personally think there are better options available. This review is strictly my personal assessment.

title: Good Dose, Easy to Swallow
text: Before I go into how much I genuinely like this product, be aware that I ordered these Jan 26, 2022. They arrived Jan 31, 2022 with an expiration date on the container of Feb 2022. I began using them immediately, since this is a 30 day supply, and will still have a few that I'll be taking after they technically expire. Since I don't know with all the supply chain issues lately how much of this was actually in the company's control, am not docking any stars for it, but check your expiration date as soon as it arrives. This is a good policy for any product, anyway, but especially these days. Also be aware if you have allergies that this is a curcumin-whey product and contains milk. That being said, I really, really like this OrangeDuzi turmeric curcumin. The capsules are easy to swallow. I like the dose, I like the 100% natural ingredients, and I even like the flip top lid on the container. The addition of turmeric to my daily supplements a while back has made a huge improvement in my chronic back pain, and I definitely appreciate a high quality turmeric product like this one.

title: Magnets Work Fine Once Appropriate Pressure Applied
text: Several readers have complained about having difficulty with the magnetic closure, but here is what I did and it worked like a champ. Assemble the box. Bend the crease between the top of the box and the magnetic flap sharply to form 90 degrees. With the box formed and the lid closed, place the side with the magnetic flap down on a solid surface. Press firmly (but not hard enough to break it, of course) for 10-15 seconds on the opposite side of the box, pushing it "toward" the side with the magnetic flap. After I did that with each box, they each closed easily and tightly with an audible click each time as the magnets connected. I opened and closed each one repeatedly, and not once did any of the flaps fail to perform properly. These little boxes are nice and sturdy, and are great for small gifts. The glossy white surface is easy to wipe clean, and also easy to decorate and personalize. At the current price of $12.99 for five boxes, I think this is a good value.

title: Beautiful Set of Essential Oils, Nice Presentation
text: I am not an expert on essential oils, nor do I pretend to be. I know what I like to smell and what I don't, and I genuinely love the scent of these essential oils. That is enough for me. This Sality Essential Oils Set comes with 20 essential oils, each in a 10 ml amber glass bottle and each nicely labeled as to what's inside. The box these oils come in is black with beautiful flowers, a bird, and a butterfly artfully decorating the cover. Inside, each oil is in it's own cardboard display section. There is a foldout set of instructions that has a cover with the same design that is on the cover of the box--flowers, bird, butterfly, etc.--and it's quite pretty. The instructions cover far more oils than are present in this particular set, and explain the benefits of each oil. As a personal gift to myself, I am quite happy with these oils. I also consider them very giftable to others.

title: Good Supplement to Healthy Diet
text: My wife uses these. This SMNutrition Women's Multivitamin Gummies bottle contains 60 gummies. A serving is 2 gummies, so this is a 30 day supply. These gummies are soft, tasty, and easy to chew and swallow. They place a strong emphasis on the B vitamins, while also providing 25% of the daily value of iodine and 20% of the daily value of zinc. They don't provide much vitamin C, just 20% of the daily value, but my wife take a separate supplement for Vitamin C, anyway, so that's not a problem for her. It also only provides 8% of the daily value for Vitamin D, but during most of the year she doesn't need it in supplement form because she spends enough time in the sun to meet her Vitamin D needs, and in the winter she takes a separate Vitamin D supplement during the times where she's not going to be outside in the sunshine. Also, she eats a pretty healthy diet which meets many, if not all, of her vitamin and mineral needs year round. For my wife, these SMNutrition multivitamin gummies are perfect for adding to her diet and making sure she is meeting her nutritional needs.

title: My new favorite for non-power bank operation
text: My cat and I are fighting over this heating pad!  I keep a heating pad on my favorite recliner at all times.  Our cat likes to sit in my lap in the evenings and he's discovered that when I get up he can snuggle up on the heating pad which falls to the seat of the chair.  The fight happens when I come back, he doesn't want to move.  I've had a bad back for years and years and heat has been the one constant that helps ease the pain.  This heating pad is very easy to place exactly where you want/need it, it warms up quickly and has a digital control that lets you set the exact temperature (86 - 158 degrees F) you want, it remembers your settings and you can set it to turn off between 1 - 5 hours.  The heat generated by the pad seems to penetrate deeper into my back and is very soothing.  It doesn't cure the pain but it makes is lessen temporarily and that all I can ask.  I do have another hearing pan that I can use with a power bank that comes in handy when I need to be moving around (especially handy when baking Christmas cookies) but his pad now has a permanent home on my recliner.  Oh, and while the heating pad appears exceptionally large and somewhat bulky, it isn't.  When I looked at the pictures on the product information page I thought "that can't be the same heating pad" but it is.  While it is big it's very comfortable to wear/use. Highly recommend.

title: Some good, some not so good
text: Things I liked:  #1 - The price. At $19.99 I think this is the least expensive water flosser that I've seen.  A good value for the price.  #2 - The handle, it has a couple hundred little bumps on it to make it easier to grip while wet.  #3 - The power cord, its a standard USB to micro USB cord.  I've got tons of those so I don't have to worry about losing the cord.  Most flossers have specialized power cords.  Things I'm not fond of: #1 The water tank - it's unique in that you pull it down from the unit to remove it.  It's awkward to remove/replace and it doesn't have a large opening for filling the tank.  I have to question how long it's going to last since the wear and tear seems pretty heavy; #2 the hose connecting the tank to the flosser. The hose in my unit was about !/16" too long.  It wouldn't move, it was stuck in one position in the tank.  I cut off just enough to free it but it's still too stiff to allow it to move around to get where the water is when the tank is low.  Summary: A good choice for an inexpensive flosser.  Doesn't have some of the nicer features found on some higher priced units but good for the price.

title: NON-Sterile Gauze Rolls but Good for Outer Wrapping
text: This package contains 30 rolls of non-sterile 100% polyester gauze and a small roll of paper tape. Each roll of gauze is individually wrapped and measures 4 inches wide and 4.5 yards long. The roll of paper tape measures 1/2 inch wide and 5.5 yards long. Since these gauze rolls are not sterile, I personally would not use them in direct contact with an open wound of any kind because of risk of infection. However, I would feel comfortable using the gauze to help hold a sterile dressing in place or to wrap something besides a wound, such as a sprained ankle or to hold a finger splint in place. This gauze is very elastic and extremely soft and comfortable. Even though these are not sterile, these gauze rolls certainly have a place in my medical supplies and will prove useful for many things. The paper tape is particularly beneficial for anyone like me who has extreme skin irritation or other  reactions to regular tape when it touches the skin. Paper tape is the only type of medical tape I can tolerate without getting blisters and huge reddened areas on my body, so I always keep some of it on hand. This package of 30 rolls of gauze and the roll of paper tape currently lists for $14.89, and I consider it a good value.

title: Interesting, Pleasing Fresh Scent
text: This Focus essential oil roll on is a blend of rosemary, spearmint, and cardamom in a 10ml (0.33 fl. oz.) dark glass bottle. I applied some to my wrist, and was immediately captivated by the light, fresh, wonderful scent. The scent fades very quickly, but I can still smell it if I lift my wrist to my nostrils, and that's actually about the strength I want when I'm in public. This is for my personal enjoyment, it is not meant to be a cologne. Something unusual happened when I put the cap back on and brought it into the living room to take pictures. When I removed the cap again, the bottle was totally open and the entire metal roller ball with the applicator top was stuck inside the cap. I shook the cap, and the applicator top wouldn't come out, but I was able to remove it with needlenose pliers and pressed the plastic applicator containing the roller ball firmly back into the top of the bottle. I've taken the cap on and off a number of times after that to test it, and it hasn't happened again. I had not planned to downgrade my rating because of a fluke occurrence, especially one that was so easily fixed, but I see many other reviewers have had the same problem with the applicator initially coming off. While it is easily corrected, it is a flaw that needs to be addressed by the manufacturer, so I dropped my rating to 4 stars. I like the scent of this rosemary-spearmint-cardamom blend, and I consider this Focus roll on a good value even with the initial hiccup.

title: Boy Do I Feel Stupid
text: I'd forgotten that I'd ordered an assortment package of these hydration drinks a few months back.  When I tried the various flavors back then I liked one of the flavors but I did not like the orange citrus flavor.  I tried to put my previous experience aside and mixed up a new glass.  That's when I noticed that the packet is supposed to be mixed with 32 ounces of water.  I think I mixed my previous try with 8 ounces.  That's where the "stupid" comes in.  Once I actually mixed the packet with 32 ounces the result was completely different.  It's still not the best tasting drink out there but it's a whole lot better than it was with only 8 ounces of water.  Mixed correctly the orange citrus taste is weak and the mixture seems a bit sweet.  I use hydration drinks during the hotter months here in Central Arkansas, which means from April through October.  Although not my favorite hydration drink, it does taste reasonably good and now I have to go back and modify my previous review.  My dad always said: "If brains were gunpowder, you wouldn't have enough to blow your nose."  I guessing he may have been right.

title: Tasty When My Own Creamer Added
text: I'm not on a Keto diet, but I got this Keto coffee because I love coffee that is French vanilla flavored. It arrives in an interesting box. To open the box, you slide the top part of the box to the right, revealing the tray underneath. There are 20 packets of instant coffee in the box. Each packet contains added vitamins and other nutrients in addition to the coffee itself. To make a cup of coffee, mix a packet with 6-8 oz of hot or cold water. I mix mine with hot. By itself, the coffee is just so so. However, I drink all my coffee with French vanilla coffee creamer, and once I add my creamer, this coffee is absolutely delicious. While I will gladly enjoy the rest of the packets in the box, the current list price of $44.95 is a bit too pricey for me to want to reorder it.

title: Almost Too Cute to Use
text: This gift set consists of six cute bath bombs in assorted shapes and colors. The cover of the box has pink on the left blending into lavender in the middle and blue on the right. It has a white silhouette of a female soaking in a bathtub getting ready to pop one of the many bubbles floating out of the tub. The sides and back of the box have the same color scheme. The back includes directions on how to use the bath bombs and a generic list of ingredients, which are sodium bicarbonate, citric acid, sodium sulfate, organic shea butter, sea salt, essential oils, and FDA approved colorants. When the box is opened, the contents are covered by bright pink crinkle cut paper. Removing the paper reveals the six bath bombs, each individually wrapped in plastic, resting on more pink filler paper. There is no plastic opening tool. The six bath bombs are each different shapes and colors. One is a green and yellow doughnut with lemon scent. One is a pink. blue, and yellow star with cotton candy scent. One is a blue heart with gold glitter brush strokes that has a rose scent. One is an orange macaroon with a white center and with a "milk" fragrance (smells floral through the wrapper). One is a cupcake with a lavender cupcake wrapper, white icing, and tons of multicolored sprinkles on top that has a lavender scent. The last one is a round ball with blue icing and a rainbow on top sprinkled with blue glitter. The scent for this one is sweet orange. These bath bombs have natural and organic ingredients. The bottom of the box clearly cautions "Do not eat!", although the online information says the ingredients are "edible grade." I suppose this is just a reassurance in case I accidentally get any glitter or other ingredients in my mouth. These little bath bombs are almost too cute to use, and I'm going to put them on display in my bathroom for a bit before I indulge myself with them in the bathtub. This set of six bath bombs currently lists for $16.99, and I consider them a good value and very giftable.

title: Nice Scent, Instant Cooling, Prompt Pain Relief
text: Like many people these days, I tend to develop lower back pain after being on the computer all day. It's not something I want to take a pain medication for, so I usually just suffer through it and hope that it eases up somewhat throughout the evening. This BIOLabs PRO Herbal Soothe product is the perfect solution for me. This comes in a 3 ounce (85g) bottle with a pump dispenser, and the label says the bottle will deliver 60-70 pumps. One pump for each side of my lower back provides plenty of creamy ointment to completely saturate the area. It absorbs quickly, so there is no concern of greasy stains on my shirt after I apply it. The cooling effect from the menthol and camphor begins immediately and lasts for quite some time. I can feel my lower back muscles relaxing and the achiness simply melting away. The camphor and menthol can be smelled, but the scent is mild and pleasant, not like many other muscle rubs. So nice to have such quick relief in a topical format that I can use whenever I need it without having to worry about the side effects of an oral pain medication. This all natural cream currently lists for $19.97, and I consider this definitely worth it for the wonderful relief it provides for my aching lower back.

title: Great Rainbow Color Display, Lasts a Long Time
text: This box comes with three huge rainbow cloud bath bombs. Each bath bomb is 6.5 ounces and has a cloud face that is smiling and winking--very cute. The minute a bath bomb is put in the bathtub, it begins to stream a beautiful rainbow of color and to fizz its way around the tub. The show lasted way longer than any other bath bombs I've ever had, and it was an absolute delight to watch. The color continued to stream until every last particle of the giant bath bomb cloud had dissolved. The scent is quite pleasant, but even if it had no scent whatsoever, the color display alone makes these bath bombs well worth the current listing price of $19.99. These bath bombs are most definitely giftable to anyone of any age or gender that likes to take baths--whoever receives them is in for a true treat.

title: Beautiful, Smooth, Well Carved
text: This set comes with seven small heart shaped crystals in chakra colors and one larger rose quartz crystal heart. There is a black velvet drawstring bag to hold them all. The small crystals are 3/4" long and 3/4" wide. The larger heart is 1 5/8" long and 1 5/8" wide. Each crystal is polished super smooth. They are beautiful to look at and a pleasure to hold. The black velvet bag is well made with good stitching and no loose threads. This is an extremely nice set, a good value, and very giftable, although I intend to keep this set for myself.

title: Intoxicating Scent, Couldn't Get Enough of It
text: I ordered three different bags of these in different scents, so my reviews will be similar for each. This review is for Orange & Lemongrass. Of the three scents I’ve tried so far (Peppermint & Spearmint, Peppermint & Citrus, and this one), this is hands down my favorite. I absolutely love it. This order comes with a package of 10 shower tablets. The tablets are not individually wrapped and are all in a bag with a Velcro closure instead of the standard ziplock closure. The tablets are a bit powdery, as you can clearly see in my photo, but still work well and release an incredible amount of aroma in the shower. They dissolve faster than other shower steamers I have used, but I still managed to get two showers out of each tablet. The lemongrass and orange blend well together, and the scent is downright intoxicating. It made me take a much longer shower than usual, just so I could keep inhaling the fragrance. I feel this is a reasonable price for these 10 shower steamers and definitely consider it giftable because of its incredible scent.

title: Nice Presentation, Very Giftable
