title: An excellent quality device at an incredible price point
text:
About four months ago, I was offered a free Antrolife Blood Pressure Monitor for review via the Amazon Vine Program, and I accepted.

My blood pressure (BP) has always been a little high. It's great to be able to track it at home with a straightforward, compact, lightweight, easy-to-read, easy-to-use device like this. It is SUPER easy to use. The most difficult part is putting the arm cuff on, and that's easy! Once you have the arm cuff in the correct position, slightly above the elbow, attach the hose to the main unit and press start. The built in voice guidance is fairly good and understandable. The cuff will inflate and your BP will register on the bright, crystal clear screen. When the reading is all done, the unit will read the results aloud and give you a prognosis. Depending on what you're shooting for, your interpretation of the numbers may be a little different than what it says though.

The unit itself is lightweight, but feels like it's well made. I like the clean design a lot, too. The edges are all rouned so it's easy to handle and hold. The LED screen is super crystal clear and easy to read... in fact, I'm not 100% certain, but I think it may be OLED. There are four rubber feet on the bottom along with the the speaker. The cuff is easy to insert and remove. The design is great.

It comes with a nice little carry case that fits the main unit, the arm cuff and a USB-A to USB-C cable for using it without batteries (and it includes 4xAAA batteries).

Overall, it is an excellent quality device at an incredible price point. I gotta say that at this price, everyone should have one of these along with a fingertip blood oxygen monitor and maybe even one of the new ECG (EKG) readers. Take charge of your health. The first step is knowing your readings. Highly recommended.

Just a little side note: One of the most important things in taking an accurate BP reading is to be relaxed. If you look up info on the proper procedure, you're really not supposed to be doing any activity for at least 10 to 15 minutes prior to the reading and certainly you wouldn't take a BP reading for hours after any strenuous excercise. BP is very sensitive to both physical activity and stress. IMO the best time to do it is when you're relaxing at home, maybe even just prior to going to bed. When you put the cuff on, try to stay calm and let it do it's thing. You can throw off a reading by a lot just by being tense.

title: An excellent quality device at an incredible price point
text:
About two weeks ago, I was offered a free Antrolife's Blood Pressure Monitor for review via the Amazon Vine Program, and I accepted.

My blood pressure (BP) has always been a little high. It's great to be able to track it at home with a straightforward, compact, lightweight, easy-to-read, easy-to-use device like this. It is SUPER easy to use. The most difficult part is putting the arm cuff on, and that's easy! Once you have the arm cuff in the correct position, slightly above the elbow, attach the hose to the main unit and press start. The built in voice guidance is fairly good and understandable. The cuff will inflate and your BP will register on the bright, crystal clear screen. When the reading is all done, the unit will read the results aloud and give you a prognosis. Depending on what you're shooting for, your interpretation of the numbers may be a little different than what it says though.

The unit itself is lightweight, but feels like it's well made. I like the clean design a lot, too. The edges are all rouned so it's easy to handle and hold. The LED screen is super crystal clear and easy to read... in fact, I'm not 100% certain, but I think it may be OLED. There are four rubber feet on the bottom along with the the speaker. The cuff is easy to insert and remove. The design is great.

It comes with a nice little carry case that fits the main unit, the arm cuff and a USB-A to USB-C cable for using it without batteries (and it includes 4xAAA batteries).

Overall, it is an excellent quality device at an incredible price point. I gotta say that at this price, everyone should have one of these along with a fingertip blood oxygen monitor and maybe even one of the new ECG (EKG) readers. Take charge of your health. The first step is knowing your readings. Highly recommended.

Just a little side note: One of the most important things in taking an accurate BP reading is to be relaxed. If you look up info on the proper procedure, you're really not supposed to be doing any activity for at least 10 to 15 minutes prior to the reading and certainly you wouldn't take a BP reading for hours after any strenuous excercise. BP is very sensitive to both physical activity and stress. IMO the best time to do it is when you're relaxing at home, maybe even just prior to going to bed. When you put the cuff on, try to stay calm and let it do it's thing. You can throw off a reading by a lot just by being tense.

title: Love this stuff!
text:
About a four months ago, I was offered a free jar of BIOHM Super Reds for review via the Amazon Vine Program, and I accepted.

I have recently taken a number of different green superfood powders and this is the first red superfood powder I've taken. I love it! First of all, it tastes really good! It's sweet and has a very bright, fruity, what I can best describe as a berry-type or fruit punch flavor. It dissolves easily. It's refreshing and seems to have a positive effect on my energy and digestion. I'm a big fan of beets and pomegranate and just about every ingredient in this. Overall, highly recommended.

title: Dissolves well, but very expensive per ounce when compared with others
text:
About two months ago, I was offered a free 7.4oz jar of Ketond Collagen Peptides (types I & III) for review via the Amazon Vine Program, and I accepted.

I've been using various brands of collagen peptides for almost three years - mostly type I & III. I can't be 100% clinically certain, but collagen peptides seem to have done a lot of good for the health of my gut - so I'm definitely a fan.

The Ketond Collagen Peptides arrives in a resealable 7.4oz plastic jar. In my case, it was completely unlabeled - I assume, because it was a new product released to me for early Amazon Vine review. That said, I prefer plastic jars over bags for collagen peptides as they offer the easiest, fuss-free usage. There is a fairly small plastic serving scoop in the jar.

According to the product description here (since my jar had no label), this is a type I & III collagen peptides. According to the question that I asked of the manufacturer, "the collagen ingredients are from the USA and the product is also manufactured in the USA." The description also states that the product is from "grass-fed, pasture-raised, Grade A bovine, and are certified hormone-free and 100% non-GMO." That is all very good.

Probably unlike most people who add collagen peptides to liquid for consumption, such as coffee, I tend to add them directly to my meals whenever possible. However, for the purpose of this review, I tested this Ketond collagen peptides in both hot and cold liquids. It dissolved as quickly as some of the fastest dissolving peptides I've used in the past, such as [[ASIN:B00XQ2XGAA Sports Research]] or [[ASIN:B07BL69CD2 Orgain]]. Like most collagen peptides, it dissolves notably faster in hot liquids than cold. In my experience, all unflavored collagen peptides add some very subtle flavor, usually similar to a very, very weak salt. This is no exception. Depending on what you put it in, you may or may not be able to detect it.

In all honesty, I tend to purchase the cheapest collagen peptides I can per ounce and stock up when I see sales. There are huge price differences between various brands and aside from subtle differences in they way they dissolve, I seriously doubt there is much actual difference in the efficacy at different price points when compared with other type I & III peptides. I am willing to pay a higher price for the more complete type I, II, III, V & X peptides. I try to get certified grass fed whenever possible and would never purchase *any* labelled to have *anything* to do with China.

As of the time of this review, this Ketond Collagen Peptides is on the very expensive side per ounce at $4.05. I've seen some good collagen peptides that I've used for as low as $1.09/ounce. I've seen others at well over $2/ounce, such as this brand. Based on the price alone, which is really high for a type I & III peptides powder, I'd give this three stars. I'll give it an extra star because it dissolves quickly, if that's important to you. That said, at well under this price point you can easily get a superior type I, II, III, V & X collagen peptides.

title: If they can improve the water pressure this would be awesome.  :(
text:
I have been using one of the bulky 350ml water flossers for quite a while now. I usually have to fill it 2 times per use. I saw this and really liked the idea that I could use it on pretty much any size bottle. It did a decent job using a 20oz soda bottle as far as water goes. But the highest setting isnt very strong compared to other flossers I have used my whole life.
Thats the only downside but its a big one.
If you need a low pressure flosser for some reason then this would be fine. :(

title: Also works for beards too.  Less little clippings in the sink to bother my GF.
text:
All my other shavers leave little whiskers in the sink, which I get complaints about. This isnt perfect but it does cut down on the whiskers+sink issue.
1.5 thumbs up.

title: Drank about 1/4 bottle to no effect.
text:
Sorry I was expecting some sort of calming stuff or relaxing feeling. Didnt feel different in any way after straight up drinking 1/4th of the bottle.
Maybe it depends on each persons body chemistry?
Bummer.

title: Using it on a very old dog that really could use some joint help.
text:
They are bacon smelling. I didnt actually taste one to verify the flavor. I hope they work for our very large 16 year old dog. Anything we can do to help we will do. Its been about 2 weeks and I havent really noticed a huge difference but she also doesnt move that much either.
So far so good.

title: "Therapeutic grade"  Remember to be careful before using on skin.  Ouch.
text: This one definitely is the pure stuff. Its on the higher bitter side if you are using it for a top note in perfume.  Therapeutic grade for sure. I put just a little below my wrist without thinning it.  Getting a slight burn from the straight concentrated drop.  Jojoba is helping calm it down a bit.

title: Jasmine and Rose really stand out from Outina.  The rest pretty much lean to the sweet side :)
text:
I love the sweter versions of oils so I'm really enjoying these. Outina usually just produces basic no frills oils that are pretty basic. Nothing super dry or overly strong. Their Jasmine and rose really stand out for some reason. The rose gave me flashbacks of my grandmothers house. I guess she used to use it a bit in her house.
This is a nice mellow kit full of the basics. And a good one if you prefer sweeter versions instead of bitter versions.
2 thumbs up.

title: Does both bug and snake bites.  Should be in every emergency kit.
text:
[[VIDEOID:96bc50c0590e7b2e488823bd58fb8389]] I didnt feel like demonstrating it by getting bit by something :) But I think the video shows what it can do.
2 non-stung thumbs up :)

title: Smells AMAZING. Quite strong and seems to last a long time.
text:
I've just taken an interest into essential oils as a hobby during the lock down. I'm trying my hand at perfume creating and this is a definite one to use. I always like the 'darker' smells like leather, tobacco and wood oils like frankincense.
Its been fun testing a few mixes so far. Now the whole house smells awesome but hard to define.
This is definitely perfume worthy vanilla.
LOVE IT!!!

title: It has a nice scent
text: It rolls on really nicely, it has not irritated my skin the last few nights and it is a pleasant smell. I was expecting a stronger smell of lavender or the chamomile but the bergamot gives it a different twist. It is a relaxing smell

title: Good for a person with a large head
text: I know I have a small head ( I usually ware kids size hats) so this was too big for me. Its perfect for my bf. He had a headache and we put it in the freezer for a bit and he put it on and took a nap for an hour. He felt great after. I recommend this for headaches and people with big heads

title: Perfect for adults and kids
text: [[VIDEOID:a3db69962621f12d8fd10f8c0ba01257]] This is exactly what I wanted. My daughter has been having issues sleeping and requires a night light. This is the perfect amount of light. Its so easy to adjust and use I love it. There is a huge selection of sounds its wonderful. The lights are pretty and soft. The only little issue I have is the symbols for the options could be a little bigger or darker. They are a light color and its a little hard to see against the white. But I really love this little machine.

title: Weighted makes it easier to keep on your lap. It can get really warm, so it has a timer for safety
text:
[[VIDEOID:503d2694b3606e2c2957bef7c0e5daff]] I'm surprised in the description it says "Machine washable". Maybe on the gentle cycle. I'll just clean it by hand when I need to.
Anyhow, it gets nice and warm. Its the weighted part that I wanted this one for. Right now its cold on OR and my electric space heater is running up quite a bill. So this way I can keep warm at my desk and save a bit of money too.
The video is sort of rambling but I cover all the important parts :)
2 thumbs up. Cant really think of any downsides to this one.

title: The flexibility of the head makes it very easy to get the back of the back molars! 6 Stars
text:
*** update 8/5/2020 I just realized that the way it bends that it makes it very easy to brush the BACK of the farthest molars. I hadnt thought about brushing that surface until my dentist removed a molar because of it.
So remember to get the back of your back molars always. This makes that Very easy (6 stars)
It takes a bit of getting used to and I originally thought the bristles were too short. But with how soft the bristles are if they were longer the ends of the bristles would not move against your teeth. The bristles in this case grips the stuff between your teeth and pulls it out instead of scraping it out of your teeth.
It takes a bit more work it seems to do a thorough job like all soft bristles.
Another advantage with this one is that because there are such gaps between the bristles its easy to clean after every brushing. I mean a FULL clean. Just your thumb and running water is all it takes. Give it a little buzz to shake off that water and makes it easy to dry.
So I would give it more of a 4.25 because of how much more work it takes to get all the gunk off your teeth. Other than that it would definitely be good for teething children or anyone with sensitive gums.

title: Wont stop snoring since they just pop out.
text:
These arent meant for those with large noses for sure. I cant keep any size in since there isnt enough space between the two. But in any case they just pop right out even if I just have one in. Not sure how they think this will work.
Sorry thumbs down :(

title: Very soft and comfy. It works. The way it cups keeps it far away from your eyelashes
text:
Ive always found the normal sleep masks annoying. Something about pressing on my eyes makes it so I cant sleep. These have deeper cups than Ive seen on other sleep masks.
The material is made of the same soft that bras are made from. (without wires) I have a larger nose which I would think would cause light leaks.
Nope. I shined a 500 lumen flashlight on it, and it was completely dark at all angles.
Very impressed this would be great for sleeping and daytime meditation since of you open your eyes its still dark. Not just 'very dark" but no light what so ever. Great job.

title: Nice combo but bracket was a bit small for me
text: The ear savers are great! Soft, flexible and comfortable all while holding the mask on well. I was a little disappointed in the mask bracket as it was a bit too small for my face. It does make it easier to breath but because of the size it moved around when I talked. 5 stars for mask extenders, 3 stars for bracket.

title: Wasn't really impressed
text: The curler is easy to use but I didnt feel like it made a huge difference. In the photo I showed one eye curled with mascara and the other with nothing and no curl. I did not do it the way the instructions said (which was mascara and than curl) because I read somewhere else that you can damage your eyelashes if you use mascara before the curler. This may be why my results weren't great however I don't want to damage my eyelashes.

title: Comfortable
text: I use this with the masks I have where the elastic is too long and I really like it. Mask stays on the ear saver well. The silicon is soft so it's more comfortable on the back of my head.

title: smells so good
text: This essential oil blend definitely lifts my spirits! Bergamot is the most noticeable scent in the mix but I do detect some peppermint too.  Rolls on smooth and scent lasts for about an hour.

title: Good for environment but otherwise just ok
text: These are slightly thicker than dollar store trash bags so you really can't fill them all the way without having issues trying to tie them shut or ripping. I'm glad they are good for the environment I just wish they were stronger.

title: Not a fan
text: This toothpaste is a healthier option than a normal toothpaste and I really wanted to like it but I doubt I'll use it again... If you smell the toothpaste in the bottle it has a nice minty smell but for some reason when brushing my teeth the scent was different and kind of smelled like hemp. This toothpaste doesn't foam which is fine for me but I felt it was worth mentioning. There is hardly any flavor at all which left my mouth feeling like it hadn't been brushed at all. I love that clean mint feeling I get after brushing my teeth but I didn't get that feeling with this toothpaste.

title: Great!!
text: I didn't realize you needed to use all 6 wool balls for a large load so all this time I had been using wool balls incorrectly and wondering why they didn't work. So glad that this one came with instructions that explained that to me. No static on my clothes after drying which is my main reason for using these! I liked that it came with a seemingly hand written thank you for purchasing from the seller. Highly recommend.

title: Earthy taste
text: You may want to mix this with something because it does have a healthy earthy type taste. My husband mixed it with carrot juice and that did mask it fairly well. Supplements like this are hard to review because its benefits aren't easily measured. I can say the quality of being organic and non-gmo is a fantastic plus.

title: No information about sourcing.
text:
This fish oil smells fresh, and the gel caps are big, but easy to swallow. It is third party tested for purity and potency (according to the product listing), but there isn't any information about sourcing, which concerns me. It also doesn't specifically say what kind of fish the oil comes from, although the bottle does say "Contains: Fish (anchovy)", so maybe that's where it all comes from.

I don't seem to have any issues with the fish oil, and it appears to be a fresh product, but I do wish there was more information about where it was sourced and how it is processed.

title: Good Magnesium in Easy to Swallow Capsules
text:
Magnesium is an absolute go-to for me and my family members. It's so easy for us to get calcium (magnesiums antagonist), because it's in so many things we eat (dairy, meat), but it's harder for us (and many others) to eat enough food that's high in magnesium, so supplementing to keep the balance correct is important.

Magnesium glycinate is my favorite, as it's easily absorbed into the body and doesn't cause any stomach upset. This product does mention magnesium oxide, (which is my least favorite form of magnesium, because of its poor absorption and tendency to cause diarrhea), but I'm not sure exactly how much is in this, because it appears to be a combination, so while I'm not thrilled about that, I can say that, overall, this has not caused stomach upset/loose stool at all for me.

Made in USA and tested for purity.

title: Nice Mild Flavor that Mixes in Easily
text:
I'm weird, because I'm not much into veggies (unless it's chef-version fancy veggies), but I love green drinks and have no trouble at all mixing the green powder into water and chugging it down. The only thing that is unappealing is when it doesn't mix in well, and there are chunks that get stuck in my teeth (tmi, sorry), which does happen on occasion.

This *wheatgrass powder is awesome. It's mild flavored (no bitterness at all) and smooth - mixing in perfectly!

Wheatgrass if full of powerful antioxidants and vitamins/minerals. Overall, it's a fantastic and easy way to stay healthy.

*This is NOT wheatgrass juice powder, which is usually a darker green and even more full of nutrients. But, because this is not the juice powder, it is a more budget friendly version.

title: My girls and I love these!
text:
My girls and I are in love with these little make-up remover pads. It's so nice using a clean pad each day and not have to purchase cotton pads. I love the little bag that these come with for storing the dirty pads before washing (and then being able to wash them in the bag, so they don't get lost in the washer). I hang my bag and wash them when it's full.

These clean well and are very soft. The container also makes for a pretty way to store them on my bathroom counter.

title: Not enough details on ingredients.
text:
I'm a big fan of powdered juices, as I don't have a lot of time to make my own. At first glance, this OMG! Superfoods Beauty Blend Powder appears to be a good product. The ingredients are organic and include: beet, maca, chaga mushroom, goji berry, maqui berry, acai and collagen peptides. It tastes pretty good and mixes well in water.

My problem with it is the maca power. It doesn't say whether it's gelatinized or raw, and the difference between the two is a pretty big one. Raw maca can cause horrible stomach cramps for a lot of people. In its place of origin, Peru, it is eaten cooked - always. So, not having this information on the packaging is troubling. By smelling, I can tell there is plenty of maca in this. It has a lovely, distinct smell.

So... I have emailed the company to ask about this, but they should definitely have this information on the packaging.

Also, while I appreciate the packaging choice (it looks highly recyclable), I don't like how the lid won't stay on securely.

title: Good Quality Wheatgrass Juice Powder
text:
It's kind of hard to find good quality wheat grass juice powder. Sometimes it's clumpy and doesn't stir in well, but this is nice smooth powder that does mix into water well.

The taste is what you'd expect. Nice, green healthy flavor.

The bag was sealed well and reseals well. I'd definitely get this brand again.

title: Good for my touch up In between grooming appointments
text:
[[VIDEOID:78d08c527f6331c3abf5278af9f04d7b]] I ordered this to do a little at home grooming on my Shih Tzu between grooming appointments as well for my longer haired cat.

I use this for helping keep my dogs hair trimmed on his backside and tummy, that needs to be done about every month or so, this saves my on those smaller job appointments that are not necessary now that I can do some trimming with this handy trimmer.

I also use this for trimming my longer haired cats backside and occasionally matting that I am unable to brush out.

This is a pretty handy clipper to have around for the pet owner of longer haired cats and dogs, I find myself always grabbing for this trimmer after seeing spots of hair that need tidying up.

Keeping potty areas neat and tidy , faces clean and matting at bay.

Very reasonably priced, lightweight and lower noise level.

title: Accurate, has memory, battery or electric.
text:
[[VIDEOID:b87c6c6b0a11848db6dac42649695dba]] This is blood pressure monitor by Antrolige has a large easy to read colored display, offers memory, is relatively quiet and seems to be accurate.

Can be used either with the included batteries or plugged into a USB outlet.

I like the look of this monitor and that it is simple to use and read with the large bright colored screen as well as it it much quieter than our old one.

The cuff says for medium to large arms and I included a picture of the exact measurements on the cuff.

Such a nice upgrade from the one we have had for many years.

title: Relaxing foot massage that feels oh so nice.
text:
[[VIDEOID:5c8db3e87fe1e6934e0d76ab4773ed6d]] This foot massager/foot rest is very relaxing and my feet are certainly enjoying it.

I love foot massagers and have several different foot massagers and one problem I have run into is that I can’t use them too long because they will tend to keep rubbing the same spots on my skin and then it starts to hurt, this machine does not do that at all.

I can use it for hours while working or watching a movie and it does not rub me wrong.

The massager mechanisms are on the bottom of my feet and the top has the compression and it gently pushes my foot down towards the massager and then releases and back again, you can change the compression settings as well as the speed of the massager, and choose heat or no heat (the heat is minimal).

The front and back of your foot massage is like little fingers pushing up and down and the arch massager is rolling balls and it feels so nice, you can reposition your feet a little to get different affects.

If you would like to use the foot stool/ottoman part you simply flip the top and and then you have the options of using heat and/or vibration (again the heat is very mild).

This works well for the office under your desk, couch watching TV, etc…

It feels amazing after a long day on your feet, long hike or just need some relaxing time.

title: I absolutely love this hair dryer
text:
[[VIDEOID:57187dae6749392acda949017f9b3fb]] This is not like any dryer I have had and I am loving it.

Four heat settings and 3 power selections plus cold shot.

Sleek design and great performance, not too
Loud , dries my hair very fast.

So nicely packaged, would be a very nice gift.

I am throwing out all my old blow dryer’s.

The air suctioning comes in at the base of the handle and not the back of the blower.

title: Nice scents. Beautifully boxed, nice gift, makes your shower feel special!
text:
First of all they are beautifully boxed and would make a special gift .
We ordered these for a vacation next week to make out vacation that much more special.
I tried one and it’s really nice to to have your shower smell so nice , spa experience!!
Highly recommend:-)
I just wanted to add that I just got home from a Hawaiian vacation and I brought these along for a little added treat for everyone and it was so enjoyed by all, with the big variety of scents it was fun to try a new one each day and leaving the bathroom spelling wonderful. I suggest placing you scent disc towards the back of the shower to it lasts the whole shower,.

title: Good Wrap.
text: The plastic is thin but sturdy.  The box is all carboard including the jagged cutting edge, no metal.

title: Great Gloves
text: Durable.  Good fit.

title: Very Strong Scent
text: This has a strong perfume scent.  The instructions said to place the color and dirt catcher sheet and the clothes into the washer with laundry detergent.  I thought the sheet was the laundry detergent?  It gives you measurements in kgs.  Made in China.

title: Fruity
text: It looks like dirt but it has a fruity smell.  It comes with a tiny scooper.  I mixed it with a teaspoon of Dried Strawberry Powder and water.  It was a little gritty and might be better in a smoothy but it tasted pretty decent.

title: Works great
text: My mother-in-law is an esthetician, and I gave it to her for her business. She was looking for a microneedling pen, and I was able to order this one, and thought that she would be the perfect person to test it out. As it turns out, her first few clients that she used the pen on, were my wife and sister-in-law. They always get treatments from their mom for these types of things, as she obviously will not charge them. My wife really liked the effect that she got from it in combination with a hyaluronic acid treatment, as she claims it vastly improved the hydration of her skin, as well as the glowiness of it. I fiddled around with it a bit too, and thought the quality was really excellent. It doesn't feel like a cheap product at all, and watching my mother-in-law use it, seemed fairly straightforward. From that perspective, I think if you're a newbie to microneedling, the learning curve for this particular device is not terribly steep. I notice the technique is to pay attention to one area at a time, while lifting the pen to another area. Never drag, always lift. I think to help gain the most benefit from skin care products, such as serums, microneedling is something that could really accelerate your results. I might even ask my mother-in-law to give it a try on my face, as I'm in my 40s now, and could use all the help I can get, to regain a youthful look. All in all, it's a really high quality microneedling pen, and one that I would certainly recommend.

title: Not too bad
text: First off, I have to say that I approach this type of device with skepticism. I didn't have any experience with TENS units before, but wanted to give this a try for some shoulder pain that I experience. The pads that come with the unit are very sticky, and easy to apply. I also did like the size of the unit, as it's extremely small and portable, and with a little practice, not too difficult to figure out. I must admit, my skepticism has been tempered a little bit, because I would find that after a session, my pain would be reduced. That relief lasted a short while however, as it tended to reactivate not that long after. However, I was expecting no results at all. From that perspective, I can say that there is something to this technology. I wouldn't describe it as a cure, or absolute relief, but it certainly can provide a measure of relief that for some people may qualify as invaluable. I think that the size of the unit is ideal, and makes it extremely portable. I will continue to use it in the hopes that perhaps with prolonged use, I can achieve better results. My initial experimentations with it have been more positive than I expected. From that perspective, I'll say that I was pleasantly surprised.

title: Improved her nails
text: My wife loves to spend an afternoon giving herself a manicure, using those gel UV light kits. As a result, they may look great for a long time, however her nails have been taking the brunt of that manicure lifestyle, and become very brittle and weak. I have gotten her powder collagen before, and she seems not to mind it by mixing it into her coffee, but oftentimes forgets it as well because it's not like it adds flavor that is pleasant enough for her to remember to always take it. She and I do take vitamins, and have some medications as well, so taking collagen in a pill form is a lot easier for us to remember, because we just put it in our weekly pill container. After taking the 28 day supply, my wife did let me know that she was happy with how her nails had began to recover. The strength of her nails had improved quite a bit, as they were almost paper thin at one point. I remember her constantly complaining that she had just broken a nail, but the collagen did a good job of strengthening her nails. This also may be anecdotal, but she did notice an improvement in her skin as well. All in all, I would say that they do work, and taking it in pill form as opposed to a powder that you mix into your drink of choice, is a superior method of delivery, in my opinion. My wife liked it a lot, and I think she's going to make me buy some more. It's also worth mentioning that there are some vitamin added benefits to this collagen pill as well, such as vitamin C & D which are necessary and imperative for improved immune system health. It is rather expensive for a 28 day supply, but perhaps worth it if you're looking to regenerate some damaged nails or skin.

title: More than just a protein
text: What I like about this particular brand of protein powder, is that it can operate as more than just a post workout recovery drink, and do double duty as a meal replacement as well. A couple of years back, I had some surgical procedures in my mouth as a result of some receding gum lines, that required gum grafts. That really is as unpleasant as it sounds. I mentioned that, because at the time it was difficult to eat solid foods for a while, so I was more or less on a liquid diet. I would very much like to have had this protein at that time, as a meal replacement because I feel it would have done a very good job of offering a good overall nutritional value. In this case, I have been using it as a post workout recovery drink. For that purpose, it works very well too. I do fairly high impact resistance training, so by the end of it I'm spent. My muscles certainly benefit from post workout recovery drinks that are protein rich, and will encourage muscle regeneration and synthesis. I found that this protein did nicely at helping me recover from my workouts. I have had the opportunity of trying the vanilla flavored one as well, and I think I actually prefer that one to the chocolate. My wife on the other hand, very much prefers the chocolate. So, I guess you can see that it's obviously going to be subjective. I personally found the chocolate to be a little sweet for my taste. So it's no surprise that my wife liked it, because she has quite the sweet tooth. I did find it to have just a touch of a grainy texture, but certainly nowhere near as bad as others that I have tried. I use a ninja blender that has a smoothie attachment, and that thing does a pretty incredible job of pulverizing the powder. I make my shakes very simply by just adding ice and water, with a couple scoops of this protein powder. As far as the ratios of how much water to powder I use, I usually experiment with that and don't pay much attention to the recommendations by the manufacturer. Personally, I prefer to dilute it a little bit in more water, as I find that makes for a more pleasant drink. All in all, I do like the fact that it has a good nutritional balance of fibers, vitamins, and minerals, as well as the protein content. Like I mentioned, when I had my surgery, it would have been nice to have had this as an option as well as the Ensure drinks that I was always having. I think it's a fine option, and I would recommend it.

title: Good healthy ingredients
text: I have to say that I was fairly impressed with the quality of this protein powder. I find the ingredients to be very impressive. I do like protein powders to be nicely flavored, but I'm always very skeptical of ones that are too tasty. If they taste more like Hershey shake for example, versus a chocolate protein shake, then you know they're heavily laden with sugar, and other additives that bring down the quality of the protein powder itself. This vanilla flavor one I found very nicely flavored. It wasn't too sweet at all. I'm not too sure that I like the recommendations on how much powder to add to how much water however. 10 to 12 ounces of water with two scoops of this protein powder, is in my opinion not enough water. I use a ninja blender, that has a smoothie attachment, and so I just measured water by eye, more or less, but I could tell you for sure I put probably closer to 16 to 20 ounces of water. I just like to water it down a bit, as I found for my personal taste, it was more pleasant that way and went down smoother. The taste is subtle and nice, especially when diluted, like I did. I use it as a post workout drink, to help my muscles recover from resistance training that I do five to six times a week. I found it very adequate as far as a post workout recovery drink, and on par with other whey proteins that I would routinely use. I mean, you have to take that with a bit of a grain of salt, because it's hard to anecdotally quantify the results in comparison, but I can say that I hardly notice the difference between this and your name brand whey proteins. I didn't try it for cooking or anything like that, but I know that these powders can be used in many different recipes for baking protein rich snacks. All in all, I found that it was a nice quality protein, that certainly fit the bill, and did the job for me and my needs. I found it very easy to take down, and light on my stomach. For all these reasons, I would certainly recommend it.

title: Continues to work
text: I had reviewed Braini capsules before. My experience with their products was very positive. When it came to the capsules, I wanted my 80 year old father to try them. He unfortunately, has been going through several health issues, but was also experiencing a little bit of fogginess in the head when it comes to memory, and issues of repeating himself. My father is still very much lucid, but struggles from time to time with remembering details, as well as short term memory issues. I actually had him try Braini for 30 days, and he had experienced some very promising improvements. His memory, as well as his focus had certainly improved. For him, that was something that also translated into an improved mood. That's because his frustrations from forgetting things, could often lead to aggravation. When I saw that there was another opportunity to order more capsules from Braini, I jumped at the opportunity, because I wanted him to continue taking it for longer than just 30 days. He continued to take Braini, and saw an even greater improvement in his abilities for recall, as well as communicating his thoughts without having to search for ideas. Basically, he did notice a positive impact to his cognitive ability, more so after continuing then even during his first 30 day trial. I personally, I'm very pleased with these results, and I know for him, who is going through health issues, something that can improve his cognitive abilities has increased his quality of life. For this, I am thrilled about it. I know he's happy with it too, because he says it to me directly. Based on his and my own experience with brainy products, I do highly recommend them.

title: It helps
text: I have tried several products from Braini already myself personally, and have found them to be very good as far as the results that they provide. I have been able to improve my cognitive function, focus and attention, as well as my memory over the timeframe that I took it. With this particular supplement, I was actually interested in having my father test it. My father is now 80 years old, and oftentimes repeats himself, and has trouble with his memory. This of course is a factor of aging, so I wanted to see if Braini would be able to help him out with this problem that frustrates him. My father is certainly no stranger to taking pills, as he does so for his heart condition, diabetes, and as of late, cancer. Certainly, he has been going through some difficult health issues, so I thought perhaps he might be pleased by improved cognitive function. After taking the entirety of the bottle, and speaking with him regularly throughout, I noticed as well as he did, that his memory had actually improved a fair bit. He was a lot less likely to repeat himself, though he still did repeat himself from time to time. I would say though, that the frequency of him forgetting things, had been lessened. I hesitate to say anything definitively, because this isn't some sort of controlled clinical test. My experience here, and my father's experience, are entirely anecdotal, but that being considered, it was a positive experience. I think I would consider reordering this, and having my father continue it, to see whether or not his brain function could improve even further, or at the very least maintain the improvement that he already achieved. I know that for him personally, with all the frustrations that he has been facing lately with his health issues, the fact that we can speak without him having to repeat himself as much, or forget what it was that he was going to say, has been a great relief for him. For this reason, I do recommend giving it a try.

title: It does work
text: I wanted to give this supplement a try, to see if I could improve my focus and attention, as well as cognitive abilities over the time frame that I was using it. I used Briani for the 30 day cycle, and after that time frame, I would say that I've noticed a decent improvement in my cognitive function. I think for myself personally, the issues that I always wanted to have sort of rectified, or at least a little bit of help with, are in my ability to maintain my focus and attention, as well as my memory. Oftentimes, I find that I'm forgetting things, and being that there is a history of dementia in my family, I sometimes fear that these may be signs at a younger age, that perhaps I may be in line for this terrible disease. Any type of improvement in my memory and cognitive function, is something that I'm very interested in, and will indulge in. The powder doesn't really dissolve the best if you just take it with a spoon, and mix it with water. I also wasn't a great fan of the taste. I began mixing it in with my smoothies that I have every day, and that was a big help. Primarily because the blender would make mincemeat of it, and mix it in without issue, and secondarily because I didn't really notice the taste afterwards. I didn't find that the powder taste affected my smoothie. I often sit and require attention with the work that I do, as well as good memory. Even though, I don't have baseline tests or anything to that effect that I can point to to give you qualified results, I can tell you anecdotally, that I certainly felt more focused, and better memory towards the end of my 30 days. I have to say, I was relatively surprised by that. It is an expensive product, but if it provides good results like the ones that I feel I achieved, it's well worth it. I know that my experience was positive, and so I can recommend it for a trial if you are someone who wants to improve their cognitive function as well.

title: Good pre and post workout
text: There was a period of time where I pretty much stopped working out. For me that's unusual because I've been working out since I was 16 years old and I'm now in my early 40s. I always like to keep in good shape and these days concentrate on achieving a good physical condition to keep my health as a priority. I took an 8 month hiatus from working out, for no particularly good reason really. Needless to say, when restarting, it's always challenging at the beginning, but I'm glad that I did. After working out for about a month, and slowly working my body into the stress of physical training, I decided to get some supplements in order to help my now 42 year old body generate muscle mass. Along with other supplements such as protein, and oftentimes a pre workout drink, I decided to take the BCAA, to help me develop muscle mass and break certain plateaus of my training. I was pretty pleased with how I was able to achieve good gains in a reasonable amount of time, and I feel very strongly that the BCAA did a good job at helping me recover and build muscle mass. I would take two before workouts, two after my workout, and two with dinner. In the month that I used it, I did notice significant gains in muscle mass, as well as shorter recovery times. It's not a miracle worker by any means, but it does give you a nice edge to help with your training. My experience with it was very positive, and so I would recommend it if you're somebody who's looking to improve their muscle mass.

title: Amazing energy booster
text: I started lifting weights again in March 2021. I’ve been working out without taking anything as a pre workout. I just drink a protein shake after a workout. I decided to try this creatine because there are days that I feel weak and I have a hard time pushing hard for 45 minutes straight. I never thought that this would actually help. I am impressed by the energy boost I get right after I drink this. The flavor is delicious and it dilutes extremely well. I like to add a few ice cubes after I blend the powder in 8oz of water. This is perfect if you are lifting weights. I often feel fatigued on day 4 of training and this has been the key to keep me going!! I really recommend it.

title: Works fine
text: I consider immunity boosting supplements a very necessary part of my daily routine. I decided to try these immunity boosters as I have never tried any that come from goat milk. I always take my supplements either first thing in the morning, or a hand full before bed. There have only been a few rare occasions where I have experienced any sort of stomach discomfort from taking supplements, but these ones do not apply to that at all. So to clarify, I did not have any sort of stomach disagreement from taking these immunity boosters.  I think we should all recognize how important keeping your immune system nice and healthy is especially in today's day and age and for obvious reasons that I don't think need repeating. Clearly if you are someone who is interested in immunity boosters, the chances are that you are thinking along the same lines as I am. I did find the product to be a little expensive or rather on the expensive side , but I also feel that it's working to operate preventatively in order to maintain good health. So from that perspective it's easy to justify the expense. As I have been taking immunity boosting supplements for a long while now, I don't really know how to quantify the results of these, but I will say that I do feel in good health and have had no issues whatsoever. All in all, I would certainly recommend giving them a try. They worked extremely well in helping to maintain my immunity health.

title: important supplement
text: I've been supplementing like crazy quite a bit over the last little while for obvious reasons. One of the most important supplements that I take is vitamin D, and D3 is certainly a part of that routine. 5000iu is definitely an excellent amount to be taking on a daily basis. These tablets are small and easy to swallow I have had absolutely no irritation or side effects from taking them. I think it's very important especially nowadays, to consider supplementation as part of your daily routine, and taking vitamin D is definitely going to be at the top of that list. That's even more true, if you live somewhere where Winter tends to take away the sunlight. With 5000 IU's per tablet, and 180 tablets  per bottle, you're good for 6 months with this bottle.  I think it's an expense that's well worth it, and very reasonably priced in my opinion. I know that for my intentions, and certainly wanting to stay healthy, vitamin D is going to remain as part of my routine. I highly recommend people decide to take vitamin D for themselves, especially if you live up north. I actually happen to live in the tropical South, but I still take vitamin D daily. So for the obvious health benefits, and the mood elevating properties, I would highly recommend taking this Vitamin D supplement.

title: Added protection
text: With new variants of Covid evolving lately, the new advisory is to look for kn95 masks, or double mask.  These slip in filters can certainly help in adding layers under your existing mask, and if you have a mask that accommodates filters, then perhaps doubling or tripling up on these filters is a good idea.  Otherwise you can even simply put one of these under your existing mask.  Now I haven't done that as I do have a mask that accommodates filters, so I don't know how well it would stay put loosely under a mask, but for ones that take filters it seems to fit well for me.  They seem to be good quality from the look and feel, and a necessary tool for todays day and age.  They also represent pretty good value at 30 for under 10 bucks.  I do recommend them, and hope that everyone wears a mask. It's just common sense, which I guess isn't often so common.

title: works great for sleep
text: Ever since I was a kid, and I am in my 40's now, I have been sleeping with ear plugs.  It started because of my father, who snored so loud that he could drown out a passing Harley Davidson.  Since then, I simply cannot sleep without them, as I like the area where I sleep to be quiet and dark.  I often reuse my earplugs night after night, as buying a fresh pair for every night can get expensive, and honestly most earplugs that I have used are good for a long while.  These are no exception, and I have gotten a few weeks out of them so far, and still going.  they do lose a little bit of effectiveness over time, but not that much at all.  They have a nice bounce back and do well to block out external noises. They are quite comfortable in the ear, and easy to sleep with.  If you are like me and need a quiet environment to catch some z's, then you'll need a pair of these for that good night sleep.

title: It's OK
text: I got the Medium version of this and it works pretty well from a resistance standpoint. It definitely provides some resistance and works well to exercise your hand or fingers. I recently had trigger finger surgery and have been told that I need to move my fingers a lot to help with the rehab. This putty works as well as the other resistance devices I have so I'm happy with it from that standpoint. It offers plenty of resistance so I don't know that I could handle the Firm version of this. It doesn't have a discernable odor but it is a bit oily feeling while you're using it. However, after I put it away I don't feel like I have to wipe anything off my hands so I guess whatever the oily feeling is absorbs well.

title: Feels Nice On The Neck
text:
This device gives you two forms of therapy for neck pain - heat and 630nm red light penetration. It warms up quite quickly and I can say that the heat feels very nice against my skin. With temps ranging from 101 to 113 degrees with an in-between 106 in the middle, you can find a heat setting that you like. You turn it on by short pressing the power button, which starts it in level 2 (106 degrees). Subsequent presses go to level 3 then back to 1 and so on. It turns off with a long press. The neck band consists of three sections that are hinged and the band fits comfortably on my neck (size 16) and there's still quite a bit of room left for larger necks. I like that the red light chips go all around the band, almost to the ends, so your neck is basically surrounded by the heat. I like that. On top of the band there is an indicator that glows with the heat level number so there's no guesswork as to the level you're at. It comes with decent instructions and a charging cord. Unfortunately, like most devices these days, no charging brick is supplied.

Overall, I like this neck heater pretty well. The heat relieves the pain I sometimes feel in long computer sessions and the lightweight band is easy to keep handy for those times.

title: Just So-So
text: I'll say this much for this shaver: it's very compact and thus works well for travel or keeping in the car for a quick touch-up. However, the motor is quite weak and on my face seemed to pull, leading to an uncomfortable feeling and some irritation. The pop-up trimmer works pretty well on my sideburns - no irritation there. Overall though, this shaver doesn't give an overall comfortable or very close shave for me on my whole face. Perhaps it's ok for a quick touch-up on small areas. It comes with a cleaning brush, a head cover, a travel bag, and a USB cord for charging. My overall rating - I don't think this underpowered shaver is worth the price charged.

title: Very Nice Lemon Oil
text:
I had never tried the US Organic brand before so I was anxious to try it. I love lemon oil and this is a very good one. Out of the bottle it has a wonderful strong pure lemon scent. I put a few drops in one of my diffusers and it filled the room with a nice lemon scent in short order. Since it's a very concentrated oil you don't need many drops in the diffuser.

This essential oil comes in a 1 ounce amber glass bottle (30ml), which is 3x larger than the typical 10ml bottles of essential oil. It has a Euro dropper top for easy dispensing. I particularly like that it is certified organic. It's on the pricy side compared to others but it's a very nice oil and you get quite a bit of it. I recommend this very nice lemon essential oil. Enjoy!

title: Works Well On Sore Neck
text: My neck often gets sore when I have long computer work sessions. But since I've been using this after these sessions I've gotten some good pain relief with it. I've found the middle height works best for me. I plan to keep using this regularly.

title: Cooling Topical Cream
text: This pain relief cream goes on very smoothly and a little goes a long way, so use sparingly. When I applied it to my aching wrist tendonitis flareup, I felt an immediate cooling sensation but not much else. After I few minutes, though, I noticed that the pain in my wrist had lessened some and the tendon seemed to ease up a bit. It's not magic but it seems to help some. The camphor and menthol smell appropriately medicinal, and the odor is helped along by peppermint, eucalyptus, and some other things. With the 2 for 1 deal and $5 off coupon that is currently available, it seems like a good value if you like camphor/menthol products.

title: Nice Specialty Bandages
text:
Often in sets of bandages you don't get the butterfly (knuckle) or fingertip ones, or only a couple of each. This set can make up for that shortfall by giving plenty of each. The packaging of these is really nice. In the box, you get two smaller boxes. Each one has 26 knuckle and 24 fingertip bandages.

Each fabric bandage does the job it's intended for. I like that they have adhesive on all 4 sides of the nonstick pads. The fingertip bandage fits nicely and securely on its intended location. The knuckle bandage has long legs to fit around the finger and hold the bandage on the knuckle. The photo shows the fit of both. Since these are fabric bandages, they're not waterproof.

This is a good set of bandages to add to your first aid kit around the house or car. You may not need this shape often, but when you do, you do!

title: Compact Panel Format Red Light Therapy Lamp
text:
There are quite a few red light therapy lamps on the market these days. Most are packaged in a lamp format with a screw-in red light bulb. This one is in a compact panel format that can be powered directly from a USB port. The panel has 18 LEDs: 3 630, 6 660 and 9 850nm wavelengths. When turned on, only half of the LEDs appear well-lit. That is because the 850nm light is nearly invisible. The compact size makes it ideal for travel.

The light from this lamp feels really great on my sore neck and lower back after hours sitting up working on my computer. It doesn't feel warm at first but when you train it on a body part, you feel the heat penetration pretty quickly. An adjustable stand is included that allows varying the angle. The angle is fairly adjustable over a range of almost vertical to about 45 degrees. Of course you can use it off the stand as well. The panel has an on/off switch on its body and the cord has a timer control switch. The control is on the cord is a bit odd. When you first turn it on it is on the 5 minute setting and it flashes 12 times before turning the lamp on. Pushing it a second and third time sets the timer to 15 or 30 minutes. The cord is fairly long for flexibility of placement. There are no different intensities, so this panel is pretty simple. A carrying case and power plug are included.

There are no instructions included aside from a few printed directions on the cardboard box it comes in. I think a product such as this should come with instructions that explain its use and any safety warnings/issues that may arise. Aside from that I find this a nice device. It seems built well, it works well, and the LEDs should last a long time.

title: OK Sound Machine - with some flaws
text:
Unlike a lot of sound machines, this one is rechargeable and can operate without a cord. That's a good thing because the charging port is located underneath the unit and the unit cannot stand up when the supplied USB-C charging cord is attached. The vendor really should have supplied a right-angle cable to fix this. At any rate, the sounds supplied with this unit are pretty good. There are 6 of them - forest, thunder, white noise, waves, wind, and campfire. Unfortunately, they're fairly repetitive on a pretty short cycle and you hear the pause as the cycle repeats. This is somewhat annoying. Other sound machines either blend the cycles or randomize them. There is a timer function that can be set in 20 minute increments up to 2 hours or you can run the unit continuously. There is a volume control but I couldn't tell how many volume levels it has. It goes from very soft to quite loud. The lights on the front can either be turned off or set to illuminate either 1,3,or 6 of them. When on, the lights "breathe" - go on or off. I don't want moving lights when I'm trying to sleep so I recommend turning them off.

So I rate this sound machine as just ok. The sounds are nice but the cycles are too short. The best features are the rechargeability and the very compact size, which makes it great for travel.

title: Really Strong Stuff...
text: ... but it works! It has a really strong smell that lingers. It smells of tea tree, eucalyptus, and peppermint predominantly. I happen to like those smells so this stuff works for me. It's far better than foot odor in my opinion and I like the fact that it lasts awhile. I use it on my feet after exercise and it works right away. After spraying it in my shoes and letting it dry, it completely replaced the bad odor with those of the oils. This stuff has earned a permanent place in my closet and I will spray my shoes regularly. I like it and recommend it.

title: Does The Job!
text: This trimmer does a good job on nose and ear hair. It works fast and I didn't feel any tugging or discomfort as I used it, although it did tickle a little as I used it in my nose. The heads come off with a twist and are easy to install. The hair trimmer has an adjustable guard so it can be used on multiple areas if you're so inclined.  Included are a USB charging cord and a cleaning brush. This is a good instrument at a good price. It works well and I recommend it.

title: Very Nice Heated Pad
text: This heating pad is a bit different than typical ones in a couple of ways. First, it's weighted a little bit, but not too much. That helps the heating elements stay a little closer to the area you're applying heat to and makes it more effective. Second, the cord, at over 7 feet, is longer than most and gives some extra flexibility. The pad is very generously sized at 1x2 feet so it can soothe relatively large areas. The outer cover is a very soft, plush material that feels great against the skin. It's simple to operate  - press the Power button to turn it on and then click the Heat button to cycle through the 6 heat settings. The instructions say it turns off automatically after 2 hours. I wish the instructions said what temperatures each of the heat settings is, but it goes from quite low to more heat than I can stand. I like the 4th setting best. The pad heats up quickly and feels very soothing. I like it a lot and I recommend it.

title: Well Designed Halloween Party Kit
text: This is a very well thought out collection of decorations for a Halloween party or to decorate a small space like an entryway for the big night. The kit comes with all the components described and pictured in the product description. Everything is individually packaged so you can use what you want without affecting or needing to unpack the other items. The quality seems typical for party favors: paper for the garlands and circle dots, latex and mylar for the balloons. A helpful touch is the inclusion of glue dots for hanging up any of the items. We normally go very big for Halloween but will scale it down this year so this set will serve handily for that purpose. This is a nice set and is a good value.

title: A easy way to fix a problem.

I did have another table I tried this on but wasn't as successful. I had a difficult time matching the color and the spot was larger. Perhaps working on smaller repairs is my niche

title: Helpful
text:
The soft cushion which is positioned directly under the neck area is a big plus. It’s cushy enough not to cause extra pain when using this aid most days. But some days it’s still just too rigid to use.
I have chronic pain, so my motto is that every little bit of relief helps. This offers a little bit of relief for a short amount of time on some days, so I’d consider it helpful, however, if a person has significant spine/neck/cervical issues or injuries, I would certainly recommend checking with a PT or doctor before using.

title: Gag gift

title: Great!
text: These work really well!  The top spout is bent at a good angle to direct the water right where it is needed and the two interchangeable tips control the flow of water.  The valve on the bottom keeps water flowing at a steady pace.

title: Works great!
text: These spray mop pads work great!  The microfiber cleans well and also picks up water well, making them perfect for spray mopping my entire house. They’re convenient and wash up easily in the washer and dryer, and with the multi-pack, you always have a clean one on hand while others are being washed.

title: Works, but...
text: These mask brackets work to keep your mask off of your mouth and allow easier breathing, but the bracket itself sticks to your face with extended wear, which is nearly as uncomfortable as the mask sticking to your mouth.  I guess it depends on which discomfort you’d rather have as to how much you like these brackets?  One extra perk of the brackets is that they DO work to keep the paper mask fibers from tickling your nose all day long, which I appreciate.

title: Do not block enough sound
text:
I really wanted to love these earplugs. I have chronic migraine with sound sensitivity, so I wear earplugs almost every day. I have been wearing the soft foam plugs, but when I saw these, I was eager to give them a try. They looked perfect!
However, I was disappointed at their sound blocking abilities. The foam plugs do a much better job of blocking noise. Even with these earplugs in, I still had to plug my ears with my fingers to block out loud sounds.

Though they don’t do a good job of blocking sound, they are fairly comfortable and they stay in my ears much better than the foam plugs. They’re also waterproof and come in a handy carrying case (though they get stuck in the case, making it hard to open or close).

However, my main reason for wearing earplugs all the time is to block sound, and these fail at that, so I can’t give them more than three stars. It seems like I just cannot get a good seal with them inside my ear canal. If I could, perhaps they’d do a better job of blocking sound.
Also, they’re very OBVIOUS. They’re not very low profile and the bright colors make them quite noticeable. I’m sure that if you dropped one, the bright color would aid in finding it, but I was hoping for an earplugs that was a bit more discrete and low profile.

title: Thin but durable

The gloves are quite thin but are more durable than expected as i have to really tug on them to put on properly and removing can be just as rough but I haven't torn them yet. Material is a semi translucent latex, powder free but are textured in away so they don't get slippery and provide some grip.  Good for kitchen prep and other basic home tasks.

This one features 20 grams of 20g Collagen Peptides along with rehydration electrolytes and a mix of vitamins and minerals for to recharge quickly. This comes as a 12-pack of 24 ounce plastic beverage bottles. Recommended to down the full bottle post workout. Only problem is that I ound the taste quite off putting with strong chemical aftertastes. Best way to consume is to open a chilled bottle and chug it down as fast as possible.

title: Worth trying
text: The use of activated charcoal toothpaste may seem strange if this is your first time around but with consistent use (I use this once a day at night and use regular toothpaste in the morning) you will see good whitening results in a non-abrasive manner that only charcoal can pull off. The taste of this paste is pleasant and feels like regular paste in the mouth. The color of the paste is a medium gray that will lighten a bit while brushing after a minute or so. End results are good and only gets better after using daily for around 5 days. This is a 3-pack containing 50 gram squeeze tubes of paste.

title: Nota bene

Decent paper quality that is easy to write on with a variety of implements ranging from ball points, sharpie, fountain and pencil. Each of the pages utilizes wide rule lines and features headers to jot down date and page# if you so desire. A nylon bookmark strand is also stitched into the spine.

title: Hearty dose of greens

Product comes with a plastic scoop inside of the re-sealable pouch. Overall its a decent value as this 8 ounce bag is good for 91 total servings (or scoops).

title: Easy to eat on the go
text: Soft and chewy, with decent taste able to stave off mid-workout hunger. These endurance bars (from Clif) are meant for quick energy replenishment and is easy enough to eat in small bites while in the middle of a long hike, bike walk or round of golf. The double peanut butter flavor uses real nut butter and has a satisfyingly wholesome taste with no artificial aftertastes. Each bar clocks in with 210 calories and 20g's of sugar.

title: Quick, effective way to boost your smoothie
text: The 'Superfood Energy Blend' comes as a very fine red powder in a resealable plastic pouch. There is a 1 TBSP scoop included in the bag to measure your portions and with recommended dose at 1 tbsp you're getting a total of 28 servings.  This is a relatively quick and easy way to add additional nutritional boosts to your smoothies thanks to its formulation of organic beet powder, coconut, cocoa, and cava amongst others. In a standard smoothie blend I really don't taste much of the powder at all. Blended in water, however, and you'll notice its taste with pronounced beet notes and the inclusion of sweetener (stevia).

Each of the glasses also comes with their own soft fabric carry case which is effective if they're just sitting around your home office but if you plan on taking them out and about you will need your own hard case.
